text:
People have had a need in communication since the dawn of time.Every human being has a need in socialising and that is the first reason why I believe we start making friends.
 Personally I usually get on with people pretty well and make new friends easily as I am a natural extrovert (or so I think). It usually starts with small talks or compliments, as at school I was taught that expressing appritiation to people can be a good start of any kind of relationships. A true friendship itself forms on a base of strong mutual understanding and this takes a good deal of time. Friends do not have to share the same opinion on every topic, however, they should respect and support each other even if they disagree.
All in all, even despite the fact that making friends can be a struggle (they need our time and efforts), they give us support and love and improve our mood when we need it most.

I was walking in the center of Turin when I saw a big, beautiful hotel, with a lot of police who were trying to maintain law and order because there were a lot of people like me that wanted to know what was going on.

I saw a policeman who was my friend and he explained to me that a man had been killed by someone and he allowed me to go into the room and see the scene of the crime.

I went to see the room of this poor man, called Mr Smith. All the room was in order and the policeman explained to me that the man, who had been very old, had also been rich. Mr Smith was found on the floor with next to him a glass, which was completely broken.

I thought that he must have called the reception for some wine, as the waitress said that every night after he had eaten, he always drank a glass of wine. 
All night the body had lain like this on the floor. The next day the waitress knocked once, twice , three times but no one answered, so she thought that the man might have gone out. She opened the room with some keys that all the waitresses have, and saw Mr Smith lying dead on the floor. The detectives analysed what was in the glass and it was poison. 

I think that someone who wanted to inherit Mr Smith’s money must have killed him for this reason. In fact I discovered that Mr Smith's nephew wanted all his fortune. So he must have killed him with the poison. Sometimes people will do anything for some money

Nowadays it's believed that it's better to work on your own than to work as a group. First I completely agree with this but then when I started to think about it I realized that it's not like that. 

 Firstly I think that if you work as a team  you can help each other and if you have more people to talk about any situation you could have a better and more completely answer because you have the ideas and the knowledge of every single member of the group.
 
Secondly I think that the members of the team give you support, love and company. Sometimes the members of a group began to be so close to you that you love them the same as if they were part of your family. Moreover if it is a really nice group it is funnier to work with them than to work alone.

In conclusion, I believe that it's better to work as a team than to work on your own because they give you love, company and you could pass a very good time

It is well known that an image is better than a thousand words and that may be the reason for the success of television in a recent survey as the most important invention of the last 100 years.
However, this election could not be the wisest as there are other inventions more useful than television and with better future applications.
I am referring to the Internet. Born in the 1970's as a military project to interconnect the missile facilities and the central headquarters, it soon spread to universities and educational centers. This fact, along with the spreading of personal computers, quickly became in a generalization of its use in the first decade of the XXI century.
Nobody wants to dismiss the importance of television and its achievements. For more than 50 years it has been the main entertainment channel displacing others as radio, theater, cinema and, sadly, also books.
In its first years television was also an important channel to culture (theater plays, classic films, etc.). Unfortunately, in the last years television has lost this educational focus.
The Internet, on the other side, has became more and more popular not only for entertainment but also for business and today is almost impossible to find an activity in which the Internet doesn't play a major role.
The Internet has also replaced television to watch films and TV shows, especially among young people who prefer to download and watch the videos instead of watching on the fixed schedule of TV.

A fire in the French Alps
This experience is  unbelievable and unforgettable to me. It was in winter 2002 when 2 friends and me were working in a hotel in a village called Tignes. The hotel had 8 floors and the workers lived on the top floor.
	At about 8 p.m in the evening on December 12th, my friends and me went back home. It was the end of a hard work's day so we went to bed early; we were very tired and we had forgotten to put out a candle. Then, disaster struck. One hour later our table was on fire. 
	While the fire was spreading all over the bedroom, I woke up and Matxi was unconscious because there was a lot of smoke in the bedroom. Monica and me called out her name and we slapped her face. Fortunately, we managed to wake her up. 
	At the moment, some friends and other workers who lived on the same floor go into the bedroom. At the beginning, we couldn't stop the fire, and although this night sound impossible, we managed to put out the fire. 
	That day I was afraid, but now I remember this experience as a good time.

Public transport has been discussed enough but there is always space for further discussion. Now the question uder discussion is whether public transport has future as travelling by car is gaining more and more popularity because of its advantages. Well, I think it has future. 

First, there are always lots of people who would prefer not to give much thought where to park their car or how to avoid traffic jams. The metro, which is a means of public transport, solves all these problems. In smaller towns without underground  there are usually a number of bus routs to cover the city area, so, all you need is to go to a bus stop and to get on a bus and soon you'll reach the destination. One shouldn't forget that using public transport helps to save money. It's not a secret that gas, insurance and reparings are costly. 

Safity issue is very important also. It is obvious that  is safer for the environment than thirthy cars with  an only person inside. You should take into account that thirty drivers(often inexperienced or aggressive) pose a greater danger to road users than  than one trained bus driver who feels responsibility for his passengers and for other participants of the traffic. The answer is evident, I think.

And the last but not the least thing is that there are quite a lot of people who are not able or just don't want to drive, so the only way out for them is public transport. Moreover, cities' authorities encourage development of public transport because it creates employment, lessens impact on the environment and contributes to road safity.

So, my opinion is that public transport does have the future. Travelling by car is convenient but public transport has undeniable benefits for long lasting life as well.

It was a beautiful Sunday morning and Michael was preparing to go out to meet his old friend Peter. He was running to the cafe where they were supposed to meet. Peter was  already there and he  immediately told Michael about a trip  to  Italy that he had planned for them.  Everything sounded great, they only needed a little bit more money and a car. Michael taught that he could use his father's car, and borrow some money from his mother. He knew that Peter was a little bit irisponcibile, but he taught that the arragement sounded perfect and nothing could go wrong. He managed to get the money and take the car from his dad and went to pick up Peter. He got to Peter's apartment to help him with his luggage. He was thinking that this time it would be different, everything was planned and they will have a great time. He opened the door and saw that Peter wasn't packed at all, he had changed his mind about the trip. Michael closed the door and knew at that moment he had made a mistake.

Alison read the note, smiled and immediately put on her coat. She's gotten used to receiving those short messages every day. Someone would write something short and simple like "Keep smiling" or "You're beautiful" and leave the note on the mirror right behind the front door. No name of the author on it, but let's face it - there was only one guy on Brooklyn who would wake up every day before the dawn, no matter if it was raining or snowing, and run like crazy to Alison's family small flat. Just to make her smile every single morning as if something amazing had happened to her. 
Occasionally her older sister would watch her down from the hall and poke her index finger on her forehead. "What a jerk" she'd mutter under her breath. But truth was that she was jealous. Very, very jealous. 
Thomas was one of those guys that every gal had wished to be around with. He was handsome as hell, well-build and a true gentleman. He worked hard at the docks to make a good living with his mother. She lost her job when war started, as well as her husband - Tom's father. Back then it was pretty obvious that regardless his young age of seventeen, he would quit school and start earning money. Because it's just the way Tom is - stubborn and righteous. 
Alison, well... Try to fit a heart and bravery of a lion into a small frame of sixteen-year-old girl. She was weak, but preferred to be called fragile, as if that made a significant difference. Her major health problem was asthma, as well as anemia, low immune system and underweight. Credits to the last one, she's skin and bones with almost no muscles. All her clothes are from kids section and yet they're usually too loose. But there's something in her big bright eyes, circled with long brown eyelashes and frecles, that makes her appearance unique and causes Tom's heart to flutter every time he brings to his mind her piercing stare. 
Alison's sister, on the other hand, is a total opposite. Mary is a picture of health with all her curves and pretty face. Small snub nose, full lips and high cheekbones. No freckles as her skin is perfect at every inch. The only thing they have in common are eyes, taken from their mother. Rest is anything but completely different.
That's why Mary is constantly surrounded with a bunch of fellas meanwhile Tom is the only one to follow Alison and have her back. And hell, she needs at least one to do it.

FILM REVIEW
ROMEO AND JULIET, Franco Zeffirelli (1968)

The best known love story of all time – Romeo and Juliet – has been adapted a number of times for the cinema and also made into successful musicals. One of the most renowned romance films based on the Shakespearean play was directed by Franco Zeffirelli in 1968. This flick  stands out from low quality versions because of its accurate details. The script is a faithful translation of the original text and the plot, as well, sticks to  Shakespeare’s work. 

This remarkable story is set in Verona in the 15th century. The film, instead, was shot in central Italy and surprisingly the scene of the balcony hasn’t even been filmed in Verona. It’s about the tragic fate of two young lovers whose families are bitter enemies. Romeo and Juliet fall in love and secretly get married. The young bridegroom then is involved in a brawl and banished from the village. The play becomes tremendously thrilling until the couple’s death.

The acting of a classic is undoubtedly a difficult task, and yet Olivia Hussey and Leonard Whiting play their role very convincingly. Believable costumes and location, unforgettable soundtrack and outstanding performances celebrate a gripping and moving story that will charm you.

If you fancy travelling back in time, don’t miss this piece of art. It’s worth it!

To: manager of the centre

From: John Jones

Re: Report about Active Leisure Club

The aim of this report is to make suggestions about the facilities of the club.

The swimming pool is big enough and the temperature of the water is fine.  However the water is dirty and it is recommended to clean the pool at least twice a week.

The gym is nice and comfortable, but newer machines should be bought to replace some of the machines that are actually in use.

The new tennis court was found very useful because most members of the club claimed that they liked playing tennis.  Also the court is cheap and the changing room is nice and clean. On the other hand the opening hours are not enough and they should be extended.

The gym reception is nice, but the walls are painted with dark colours. Is advisable to paint the walls with a brighter colour.

Apart from the above mentioned points, there maybe so many other ideas which can make a big difference to the club.

Anna knew that it was going to be a very special day for her. She didn't know exactly why, but she had the feeling. The feeling it would be the last day of her journey. She began to reminisce about the start of her journey.

Back then when she had been a little kid, she had dreamed of seeing the entire world. In order to realize her dream, she had begun her journey. It hadn't been easy, she had had to leave her beloved homeland behind.

Just after saying farewell to her homeland, she had met an old woman. The woman had smiled to Alice and had given her some words of advice, "Young girl you lose something important to you. But don't worry, as long as you're willing to regain it, no matter what it takes, you will find it again". Alice had looked on confusion as the woman had been walking away.

Many years had passed. Alice had gone through the entire world, from the hottest desert to the highest mountain. Alice had decided to return to her homeland. However, when she had arrived there hadn't been anything but a barren desert. She had been shocked. Her family and her homeland had disappeared. Sadness stroked her heart.

But, just as hope almost disappeared, she had remembered the words of the old lady. And so, she had looked around to find a way. Then she had found a gate nearby. As unbelievable as it seems, it had been a gate of time. It had been told that anyone who stepped through it would be cursed, but Alice's willingness had been stronger than her fears. She, without any hesitation, had gone through the gate.

Finally, after much time travels, Alice had this feeling.The feeling of the end of her great journey through time. She went for her last journey.

The first thing she saw was a young girl. She looked at her and was instantly reminded. That girl, indeed was Alice herself in her youth. More specifically, it was Alice when she was starting her journey. She instantly knew that her homeland must be nearby.

She then said the same words as the old lady she had met long ago. And finally, she went on to her destination, her beloved homeland.




Has you told me that I will win some literary competitions and that some people will speak well of me, I wouldn’t have believe you.
The year was 2012 and I hadn’t written anything until that day – I just had been translating some stories and once even subtitles for a Korean movie from English and Spanish. But that day – it was on spring and I believe it was Thursday – my English teacher told us about a literary competition. The theme was ‘I visited the Earth in2112’. It sounded like a quite good challenge for me so after finishing the then lessons I quickly sat down and started writing. And when I wrote down the last sentence I immediately sent it to the stated email. Only then I realised that there is nothing more to do, that I have to just wait. First days I was a little bit nervous but day by day I started forgetting about any competition.
But a month ago my mobile phone started to ring. An unknown number. I picked up and heard nice woman voice. And that voice told me that I am a winner of a third place! So happy was I!
That moment a bit changed my life because I’ve started to write more and more stories. And the more won competitions, the more proud was I of myself.

Since I was a child, I had been curious to know how stuff works. Disassembling games, building things of wood and playing Lego were my favorite hobbies. Through the years, my interest in machines and electrical devices increased, so whenever a device stops working I tries to fix it before calling the maintenance, and my parents always encouraged me even when I broke it down.
When I was in secondary school, and my friends were dreaming of be Doctors or Dentists, I decided that I will be an electrical engineer or mechanical engineer, so I entered the scientific branch. During my study, my parents and I noticed that I understand kinetic physics more than electrical physics. Also, I was good at mathematics subjects that related to solid geometry, that is why I decided to study mechanical engineering.
Since I enrolled in the faculty of mechanical engineering, I had a goal to complete my master study in Europe or America. After searching and asking, I found Germany has numerous prestigious technical universities, and it offers great study atmosphere for foreign students and supports them in many ways. Moreover, Germany is one of the biggest industrial countries in the world and it has many huge factories. Additionally, the living costs are quite affordable.
For those reasons, I am convinced that Germany is the best country to complete my study abroad.
I have been working as a teacher of mechanical materials in a vocational school since my graduation. I really like this profession and how good it feels to spread science and knowledge to new generations. Therefore, I have decided that I am going to continue my postgraduate study and pursue a Ph.D. degree to work as a teacher at a university.
I have been looking for a while for suitable university to apply to. I read about TU-Clausthal and I decided to apply to it for many reasons. First, I like the curriculum of the mechanical engineering master program. Second, TU-Clausthal has very good rating in engineering at many websites like ranking.zeit.de. Third, TU-Clausthal gives conditional admission and it has a language center. Finally, TU-Clausthal located in fascinating nature.
I hope that I get the chance to complete my study at your university and to gain practical experience in one of the greatest industrial countries in the world.

A lot of different languages are spoken in all over the world, and it is not easy to choose one of them to learn it. my view is that nowadays English is an important language that it is necessary for almost everyone, so I will choose to learn  English first.

The most common reasons to study a language are the job and travelling. Although in some places people don`t speak English, you always can find somebody who does. 

In addition, English is not too difficult to learn. Even though you have to study vocabulary and expressions, the grammar is easy to understand and you can be able to do simple sentences in a few days.

One of the subjects at school is English. Therefore, we have to study it, and when we finish school we usually continue improving our English before learning another one.

All things considered, I think that English is the easiest option when you want to study a language. Whereas there are a lot of options, we rarely start learning other language before we can communicate well in English.

Digital advertising; an exciting but undesirable business


It is indisputable that advertising has become a permanent fixture in our daily lives. Once a curious novelty that was largely considered a harmless addition to our sometimes dull and overly familiar environment, it was welcomed as fun and informative. It was also - if one wished to do so - relatively easy to ignore.  But we have now entered a new era of the attention-grabbing business: its digitalisation. 
Their transformation from innocent posters to digital screens ranging in size from miniscule to vast has made adverts all-pervasive. Researchers say that an average adult in the developed world is now exposed to hundreds of commercial messages every day.

Those involved in this lucrative business are in awe of the almost endless possibilities that recent technological advances offer them. Multimedia, advertising and entertainment companies now work in synergy to target everyone from toddlers who can barely speak to pensioners confused with the speed of life in the new age, unsubtly playing on their needs and desires in order to turn them all into faithful consumers. 
They have so successfully infiltrated their own product into our everyday existence that we no longer see it anymore as what it really is: a nuisance. Creators of adverts have long given up on informing the consumers and instead opted for seducing them. The result are insincere, misleading and often deceitful messages that our minds are saturated with.

Perhaps it is time to do an experiment and hit a pause button and reflect upon this subject matter.  Imagine a world without adverts, for a week at least. Would it be bleak and boring and leave us at a loss as what to buy, or might it just turn out to be a long yearned for respite?

Dear Chairman,

I am writing with regard to the campaign that you are promoting in favour of an international sports competition that could be hosted in my town.

As a matter of fact Venice could be a very good candidate for hosting the marathon competition, which will last one day

Moreover Venice is one of the most beautiful cultural cities in Italy. The marathonetscoming before or staying after the competition can take the advantage of visiting the city, which offers a great deal of facilities

There are two separate communication networks in the city, that of the waterways and that of the narrow streets. Public water buses and private water taxis run 24 hours a day although less frequently at night. The main centre can be reached very easily. Despite the private service is very expensive it is efficient.

Four and five stars hotels are located in the main area, but smaller hotels and a youth hostel are also available to families.

Hotel receptions and travel agencies are always ready to help their guests with a wide range of information on the city's entertainments, exhibitions and so on.

Sightseeing and excursions with private local guides are available on request.

In addition to this there is a significant lack of evening entertainments in the city such as theatres, cinemas and night-clubs.

On the contrary participants will find a wide range of restaurants, trattorias and bars with a good selection of menus suggesting local food.Some of these restaurants can be quite expensive.

In conclusion I think there will be no obstacles and objections to host this sporting competition in my town which on the other hand is also a cultural event for many of the participants.

Yours faithfully

Hey Paul 

I read your email yesterday but I hadn't had the time to reply yet.
The concert I helped at was amazing! I helped catering the staff and during the concert I was free to walk around wherever I wanted because they gave me a security badge. I just had to make sure nobody was hungry or thirsty. This also meant I was allowed to go backstage and take care of the bands. I had asked if I had permission to stand in front of the stage during the main concert and the organisation agreed. The support act was a rather unknown band but they were really good. Did I tell you who the headliner was? I don't think so.. It was NICKELBACK ! Their setlist was extremely good. They played all of their famous songs and added some new ones. After the show I had the chance to meet the band members. Chad Kroeger gave me their new CD and the entire band signed it for me. The guys were really nice!

I had an amazing time, too bad you couldn't be there.

Hope to see you soon.

Valerie

Hello Jane!

Here is a picture from the last summer when we were in Halland on an island called Nidingen!

My name is Lorin and I am 13 years old. I live in Djursholm at Riddarvägen 42, close to a field. I was born on August 4 at the hospital in Danderyd. In my family we are five people, my mom Malak, my dad Claes, my little sister Novalie and my little brother Edvard. Novalie is 10 years old and Edvard is 6 years old. In my spare time I like to be with friends and I do also play soccer, dance and ski. I really like to do sports because I like to be outside. I compete in skiing and I think it's very funny. I often go skiing in Åre, Vemdalen and in Ramundberget. Once every year I ski with my ski club (Täby slalomklubb) in Switzerland. In Switzerland we have been to Saas fee and Zermatt. In Zermatt you can see the mountain Matterhorn (the mountain that you see on toblerone package). It is a very cool mountain. I do also ski with my family and that is the best. I like slalom because it goes fast and I like snow. In the summer holidays my family and I just to be at the vest seaside on a small island called Kålhuvudet. That is one of our summerhouses I love to be there because when we are there we swim in the ocean and we fish crabs and just have a really fun. You can of course see the ocean and it is very beautiful.

Something else I like to do is shopping. My parents call me a shopaholic and I almost agree. I like it because it is fun to look at clothes and try them.

I read pretty much and my favourite book is Harry Potter. I like fantasy and that book is fantastic. If it was possible to go on Hogwarts I would do it. Now you know what my favourite book is so you can almost guess what my favorite movie is… Of course Harry Potter. But I do also like a movie called The game plan. It is about an American football player who doesn't know that he has a daughter and one day the daughter came to his apartment. Then it is a fun and fantastic story that I don’t want to say  because then it is not going to be fun to see the movie. I don't see movies only I look at some series to. For example Pretty little liars and Modern Family. Pretty little liars is a little bit scary but I like it. Modern family is my favourite series. I like it because it is very comic.

My favourite song is a song called Chandelier with an artist called Sia. It is a girl called Jasmine Thompson and she sing cover songs and I think she is a really good singer. I do also like a song called classic with an artist called MKTO. One band I like is One direction I think they sing really good. When they were in Sweden I was on their concert and after that my voice were almost gone. But there was really fun to be there but is what pretty cold, because on friends arena the roof was open.

My favourite food is sushi or a fillet of beef with potatoes and béarnaise. I like sushi because the combination with fish, rice and soya makes it delicious. I like beef and my favourite is a fillet of beef with béarnaise, it is a very good combination. My favourite restaurant is a restaurant called dahlboms in Åre because they have the best spaghetti bolognese ever. 

Hope you enjoyed your reading, I think this is what you maybe want to know about me!

Michael closed the door and knew at that moment he had made a mistake, because the door couldn't be opened again. He was trapped. Michael was very anxious and he didn't know what to do anymore. The room was really dark and Micheal couldn't see anything.
Then suddenly Micheal felt something under his foot. It was a hammer. Micheal tried to hit the door with hammer, but it was useless because that door was made of steel.
Snugly Micheal heard steps coming towards to him. Micheal was really scared and he closed his eyes. He opened his eyes again when the steps were faded away. Michael felt himself strangely, because he wasn't feeling walls around him.
Micheal was stuck in nowhere.
Suddenly Micheal felt pain in his chest. The pain became stronger and stronger. He felt like he is about to die. He started crying because there was nothing he could do about it. 
At the moment Micheal wanted to die, he saw a light coming from beyond. He started running towards the light. The moment he reached the light everything changed. He didn't feel anything. He could fly around. Micheal seemed to be really happy in this moment.
Micheal felt something shaking him. He was really confused because he thought he was dead. Suddenly Micheal opened his eyes and he realized it was just a weird dream.

Smiles and Sounds at Charity Fun Day

This year's Charity Fun Day was brilliant and we raised lots of money. It was amazing event! Local people were invited and a talent competiton was held. Several student bands played and a variety of food was available!

Everything started on Saturday afternoon on the main square in Krakow. Number of people exceeded my expectations! There were a lot of them. The weather was fantastic: the sun was shining and birds were singing. Generally, bands played great, but of course there were also terrible singers in the competition - but it didn't matter so much. I'll never forget the sounds and smiles of these happy people with their arms in the air who were standing under the stage.

As we know, this type of event can't take place without food. On a Charity Fun Day the air was filled with the fabulous smells of Indian, Italian and many other world cuisine. 

Unfortunately, not all of the food was tasty, so one of the thing I'd suggest changing next year is to avoid the hot dogs. Also I'd recommend delicious homemade ice cream.

It was fantastic experience, especially for people for which it was intended. If you're looking for a really good day out, come to next year's Charity Fun Day. You won't be disappointed.

Dear Jane,
I'm so sorry that it took me so long to reply, but I had to move out of my parents' house last week. It's breaking my heart to hear that you're in so terrible situation. It must be awful for you. 
To be honest, I've never understood why you enjoy boxing anyway. It's brutal and I'm always worried about you. You're such a cute, little girl. And this sport... I'm surprised you can still play piano after all those accidents you've had. And you know how much I love your music. It's calming, beautiful and somehow suits you. So if I were you, I'd go for music classes. Having said that, I also must admit that I know how hardworking you can be. So I believe, if you really want to pursue both, you can do it and I'll support you no matter what. 
I hope I helped you a bit. Let me know what is your decision. And tell me more about that guy you met last month! You've been suspiciously quiet about that recently. 
Best wishes,
Daria.

I discovered the English language when I was eight, and that amazed me so much that one year later I started to take a course. English was also the key for my passion for technology, the more that I understood the language, the more I understood how to use computers and the internet. About six months later, I joined a computer class for kids in the same location that I took the English classes and since then, my love for computers and the language just grew.

That is why I wish to work in the areas of Computer Sciences, and studying abroad would give me an extra motivation and open new doors to show and expand my full potential. Besides being my personal favorite for its culture and language, the United States of America offers big opportunities in this area, for it's great universities and educational system.

I am currently an intern on a scientific research program in a group called GALP - Logical Programming Teaching Group, that, with the local city hall of Araraquara, aims to transform the city into a national  technology, research and software producing center, accomplishing this goal by teaching logical thinking and alghoritms to kids, diminishing future evasion in many exact sciences courses. To bring back from this exchange technical knowledge in programming, as well as new methods of teaching, would be outstanding.

Although I write and speak English in an advanced proficiency level, this exchange would provide the fluency I need in academic grounds and interpersonal communication, as all of the most relevant  papers, research and journals are written in English, I want to achieve this level to make it easier to write and produce good material for the scientific community, and to communicate better with all cultures.

In Brazil, there is a huge lack of professionals on the field of information technology in both academic and work market, travelling abroad, especially in the U.S., would qualify me in both areas. Although I prefer the academic field, working in a company related to software design and creation would be a marvellous way of gaining experience in the field.

I would be happy too, if by any chance I could apply to summer jobs or internships, as another way of gaining experience. Working as an intern at an information technology company or as a teacher assistant would provide me with a good example of how the market work for both academic and work careers.
 
In conclusion, I want to study in the U.S. for it's differentiated educational system, for the work and research opportunities that I might find, to know better a culture that amazes me for its capacity to innovate in all fields,to become fluent in a language that I love, to return to my country with more knowledge in areas that I would not find here, and, in long - term, become a better professional or teacher, with a good and solid background on computer sciences, information technology and finally, system analysis and development.

I am writing to inform you about the most beautiful places and interesting buildings in Vilnius. There are many places to visit but the most beautiful is Traku castle. It is very popular pace to visit among tourists. I think that a group of overseas students must see it. This castle is very old and it is surrounded by water. The castle is very big and you will need some hours to visit it. It is very beautiful and there are many interesting things to see in this castle. If you want to visit it, order a guide who will tell you the  history of the castle in English. This castle consists of many buildings and even underground tunnels. In the yard of the castle you will see some cannons and other guns. Moreover, there are many souvenirs sellers so you could buy something. I hope that you will visit Traku castle while staying in Vilnius. 

Yours faithfully,
Rasa

"Installation art" is a new form of expression made of a mixture of media art works, used by contemporary artists to communicate something in a modern way, different from traditional arts. Installations are usually placed in big spaces because they have an important structure with the main task of making people reflect on something important that the artist needs to communicate to the biggest number of people.

Personally, I have seen only one "installation art". It was situated into a stand in Parque Del Retiro, in Madrid. It was built by two different elements. The first, placed in a corner of the stand, was made by a pile of plastic bottles and plastic baskets. The second, in the centre of the stand, was a column made of coloured plastic baskets, surrounded by plastic bottles. The artist wanted to represent the difference between the ecological recycling of plastic compared to the common collection of trash. Seeing it for the first time it was impossible to understand the meaning of the column or the pile. Only after having read the explanation it was possible to appreciate the installation art, and to have the complete attention to its meaning and shape.

Despite their beauty, new form of arts are very complicated to understand, especially compared to classical arts. An example could be the medieval art. Seeing a Da Vinci's portrait or a landscape painting, it is immediately possible to appreciate the beauty of colours or the accuracy of shapes and the expressions of the subjects painted. At first sight those paintings evoke an emotion in the observer, and the name of the piece helps  to have a complete knowledge of the masterpiece. On the other hand, looking at an installation art it is harder to have a clear emotion at the first sight without knowing the meaning of it or something about the artist.

In conclusion I think that all forms of art are made for the same reason, to communicate something. In every historic period, artists have represented their life and what they feel in different ways. Classical art was more easy for us to understand because it has been studied at school and it is very famous, while modern arts are totally new and more complicated to understand because of their composition and their significance. In my opinion the difference between installation arts and classical arts stands in the feeling that they can suscitate in the audience.

Feel the wind!

Kitesurfing - this sport discipline is getting more and more popular not only in countries such as Australia, Turkey or Egypt, but also in other ones, just like Poland or Germany!
Everyone who has ever stood on a surfboard and tried to catch the wind with a kite knows how wonderful it is. A feeling of being completely free, a joy of moving on a surface of water standing on a small board, an incredible speed - all of those things can easily make you happy.
When I tried kitesurfing by myself for the first time, I was a little bit scared. "How difficult it is!" - that was my very first thought while seeing some surfers on the Baltic sea in Poland. But believe me - there's nothing to worry about! Despite the fact that it seems hard, kitesurfing is one of the easiest water sports! If you just learn how to keep a control of your body standing on a surfboard and how to steer a kite, there's nothing that seems hard any more.
My only advice is: go to the seaside, find a nice camp for surfers with a good instructor, and enjoy your moments of freedom!

This past year was special for me, I graduated from High School and I took a gap-year. It was a very confusing but probably the best year of my life and I will tell you why.

As I said earlier, I graduated from High School which was a huge relief. It was aweful. The students were mean and the teachers didn't like me at all. So on the day the vacation started I was the happiest I've ever been. 

Thus came the question of what I was going to do next, but I wasn't ready to make that descission back then so with agreement of my parents I decided to take a gap-year. Which was the best thing that ever happened to me. 

I was extremely nervous about a week before my departure. I was going to spend the next 6 months in the United States which actually teriffied me. As my departure came closer, I started to question myself more and more if this was a good idea and if I would have a good time all those things. On the big day I must say that I kind of felt numb, I didn't know what to think and what to feel. 

The journey to the United States was surprisingly good,  I had some friends on the plan who were going to the same destination as me and I actually didn't miss my family that much. 
The 6 months I send there were the best of my life, I was so happy and enjoyed myself every day.

 I also got to know myself better and I have reached a descission of what I want to do next year, I am going to study at the university. I hope that I will enjoy that as much as I enjoyed this past year, it was truly amazing.

So if you are ever even considering the fact of taking a gap-year, don't doubt, just do it. It is amazing!

When I got to the door, I realised suddenly that something was wrong. I anxiously turned and looked at the window. It was slightly open. I felt cold sweat on my back. I was sure that I hadn’t left the window open. So who had…? 

I was wondering that maybe it’s just my imagination. I had been staying at home for five days, I wasn’t really willing to see other people. Maybe I have gone mad? I stared blankly at the window, unable to move. Eventually, I slowly opened the door and came out of my room. I went to the kitchen and sit on the chair, nervously fiddling with my bracelet. It suddenly broke apart, and all the beads dropped on the floor. In that sinister silence, it seemed to be the loudest sound on the world. 

All of sudden, my phone rang. It was my best friend. „Laura? Are you okay? We haven’t talked for ages”, she said. It was reassuring to hear a familiar voice. I had been feeling so lonely for a long time. Before I made it to tell something, I heard terrible scream and my friend just hung up. I felt cold sweat again, just like five minutes ago when I’d seen open window.

After a little while, I heard a hoarse voice coming from the room with the open window. „Laura? Come here. We havent’t talked for ages”. It was my best friend’s voice.

We at Madhura Nagar, understand the need of protecting the environment and hence are committed to what we do. We limit the number of houses and the number of people living in those houses because more people would mean we have to clear vast expanses of land for housing which would mean a reduction in the number of trees and a deathblow to the natural balance. We also see that people adhere to the norms when they build new houses and don't encroach on any public lands. We encourage people commuting to nearby places to walk or use a bicycle depending on the distance and those going to the same areas outside the town to join car pools. We also have a biogas plant in our outskirts that takes care of the rubbish and sewage and the power generated is used for street-lights and meeting the power needs of the community office. We distribute jute bags annually with our community logo on it so that people can use them instead of plastic bags. Each year, we encourage school-going children to plant trees to teach them the importance of trees in safeguarding our environment so that they can grow up to be responsible towards the environment. We encourage people who come up with any innovative thoughts about how we could further protect the environment. Besides this, we often visit our neighbouring towns and educate them on the issues of global warming, the threat to ecological balance etc., and guide them on how to protect our environment.

Being famous seems to be the best thing that can happen to us. But no matter how fabulous it looks, it brings some consequences and even problems. One of the biggest disadvantages of being popular is that they are on everybody's lips. Public loves to know everything about their idols and they always try to find out some spicy details.
Everyone deserves privacy, but public figures should be aware of the fact that the society wants to know about them as much as it's possible. Whether they like it or not, they should be prepared for photographers and journalists trying to chase them in every single moment of their life. It might be hard, but they need to be patient and try not to care about the people who interferes with their personal being.
In my opinion, journalists and paparazzi shouldn't stalk celebrities on their private holiday or try to get into their intimate life. There are some borders that shouldn't be crossed. For example, when a popular film star goes to hospital because of his relative's illness, reporters and photographers in particular should stay away and leave the celebrity alone.
Even though they are well known, they have a right to have a free time and they should be albe to use it however they want to without anyone disturbing them. It's really important for people to know the bound between curiosity and nosiness. We should respect other's right to privacy and let them live their own lives.

Nature is one of the most important theme in the Romantic Age, since it is a reality that inspired many writers, both novelist and poets.
It has been an important subject especially for writers from the ''first generation'' like William Wordsworth; he  saw nature as an inseparable reality from man, whereas it comforts in sorrow and teaches to love and to act in a moral  way.

In the Romantic Age we can find another important subject based on the concept of nature: the sublime.
It is associated with strong emotions caused  natural spectacles, like hurricanes, waterfalls or starry sky
The sublime  inspired many writers likeW. Wordworth and S. Coleridge, who had a conception of it as the feeling brought by the view of infinite spaces, like desert, sky or ocean.
The idea of the sublime that Wordswoth had is considered by many as the standard idea of the Romantic sublime: forms of nature that inspire feeling of awe, danger or weakness.
Also Coleridge had a concept of sublime, but for him it was associated with infinite spaces and the sense of perdition and suspense .

The art of making a good impression.
An old saying goes ‘You never get a second chance to make a first impression’. 
That’s always important when you meet someone for the first time, but especially when you come to a job interview. 
Here are some tips to help you get a positive first impression. 

Dress to impress 
You should dress appropriately for the job that you want to get. 
Men should wear a suit and a tie, and women should wear an appropriate blouse and skirt or pants. 
Everyone should have clean hands and fingernails. 
You should take no bags or backpacks along when you come to the interview. 

Manners & Behavior 
When you first meet the interviewer, shake his or her hand firmly. 
Then you should thank the interviewer for the invitation. 
Whatever happens, you should smile and keep cool. 
If you are asked about yourself, you shouldn’t tell your biography or something that has been written in your CV. 
Instead of that you should show that you have experience or specific education in the area. 
Try to avoid using filler words such as "like", or "um" because they tell the interviewer that you're nervous. 

Dos & Don’ts 
Don’t be late. 
Don’t talk too much or too quickly. 
Never use monosyllabic answers. 
Don’t hesitate to ask questions. 
Switch off your cellphone. 
Maintain eye contact. 
Relax and enjoy the moment. 

Going on a job interview can be a stressful experience for even the most job seekers but if you use these tips, the first impression of you will be positive. 

Good luck!

Dear Sir or Madam,

I am writing in response to the article about friendship that was published in your magazine. I would like to share my feelings about a particular friendship that is highly important to me and furthermore evaluate the reasons why is especially complicated to maintain long lasting friendships in any situation. 

First of all, as far as special friendships are concerned, I must say that I am not a person who makes friends easily, consequently I do not have a large circle of friends. However, I can portray a unique relationship that I have with a generous and warmhearted person. Although it is true that this is not a long term friendship I can admit that I have found a true friend. Throughout this friendship I have been given the support, the affection and the confidence to pursue my dreams. On the other hand, friendship is a two way street where you receive and give back the same favors and, naturally, I enjoy doing so. I value this friendship and is of great importance to me because it is a balanced one of a kind relationship. 

Secondly, I would like to say that maintaining friendships over time entails strenuous effort. A justification for this may be the fact that over the years people change and grow apart. For this reason not all childhood friends grow older as close confidants, simply because they are not the same people as they were before. As you gradually grow up your world expands, your personality changes and so do your acquaintances. However, the natural process of aging is not the only change we undergo but there are others such as enrolling in school, getting our first job or changing the old one, travelling or moving to another city. All this situations may impede us to stay in touch with old friends but on the other hand can give us the opportunity to make new ones. 

To summarize, I would like to say that even thought we are incapable to remain on friendly terms with everyone we should know that the process of socializing is one of the factors what makes us human and we should always embrace it. 

Yours faithfully,
Allison Green

Viña del Mar is a wonderful city on the west coast of Central Chile and boasts a  number of shopping facilities and different sorts of attractions for tourists of all ages.

There are several shopping centres in different areas of the city. The biggest and best one is the Marina Arauco Shopping Centre, located on 15 Norte St. It has two anchor department stores, Almacenes Paris and Almacenes Ripley, one at each end of the  mall which is two blocks long. There are four floors, each of which contains different departments of the anchor stores, and a number of small shops which sell a variety of products. There is also a food court on the third floor, catering to all sorts of customers, as well as a few restaruants on the first and second floors. On the top floor there is a multi-cinema complex, offering several options of the latest movies. There are two underground floors for parking, which can get a bit crowded at peak seasons, but which are very reasonably priced.Nearby there is also a large supermarket and a home store which offers products for building purposes, also connected to a shopping gallery.

Another shopping option is the main streeet in the centre of Viña del Mar, which used to be more popular in the past, but which was displaced by the shopping centres. This street runs from the Viña Square towards the sea for about six or seven blocks, and has many small shops and businesses which attract a lot of people. There is a parking meter system, which is not very cheap, compared to the shopping mall parking, and it can be difficult to find parking nearby. There are several supermarkets and two anchor shops at one end of the street, which are convenient shopping venues for people who live in the city centre.

There are also other areas in Viña del Mar where groups of shops have concentrated so as to offer facilities to residential areas, also convenient for people who live in the surroundings.

All in all, I consider there is a wide variety of shopping options in our home town, so I expect tourists would not be disappointed with what there is to offer.

How my town takes care of the environment:

Introduction:
This report has the aim to show and discuss the main ways to reduce the pollution and to take care of the environment in Zaragoza. Some information about what people do with their rubbish and how they try to keep the area clean, is described in the following lines.

What do people do with their rubbish?
Although the majority of the citizens in Zaragoza don't give a special treatment to their rubbish, there are some people who have recycle bins in their homes. Also, Zaragoza is provided with a number of collection points, where rubbish with big dimensions such as furniture can be collected and recycled.

How do the town try to keep the area clean:
There is a law which states that if someone throws rubbish such as papers, cigarettes or chewing gum to the street, they may be punished with a fine which could increase up to $100. We also count on the following services:
1. A team of professional cleaners responsible for keeping the streets clean, scheduled every four hours and divided by areas.
2. A commercial team responsible for raise awareness of the critical situation the environment is suffering.
3. More than 200 buses with the aim to avoid excessive CO2 emissions.

Conclusion:
Zaragoza's population is aware of the importance of keeping the town clean and so they're willing to do plenty of things to avoid the pollution and its environmental consequences.

It was 8:00 o'clock in the morning that Saturday in L.A., and suddenly an urgent message appeared in the TV news and in all the radio channels. They announced that the Big One earthquake would occur that afternoon at 7:00 PM approximately, so they alerted that people had to leave the city or go to save places in the few hours. From that moment, there was panic and chaos all over the city.

Peter's father was the mayor of Los Angeles, so he had to calm down and inform the people regularly. Peter decided to help his father with his work and the problems that were happening, while his mother was doing the luggage and preparing the car to leave.

Peter and his father were very busy solving problems of neighbours and it took them some hours. They finished the work when it was 6:30, so they had to leave the city quickly or they would die.

Finally, when they were in the car, Peter turned round and he saw a little boy in the road calling for help. Peter looked at his watch and knew that he had to do something immediately.

Dear sir,

First I would like to thank you for your interest in our little town, and we will guarantee you a very warm welcome on the day of your arrival. We will take great pleasure in helping the students to get around and feel at home in their accommodation.

You requested us to organise a visit to a place or building that mirrors one aspect of our life here. We have brainstormed about many possibly interesting locations, and we eventually decided to prepare a little tour at and around the Grand Place of Brussels. Away from busy and noisy roads, the beautiful old inner city reflects what Brussels really was for centuries; small but cosy cobblestone streets flanked by small houess and shops in light colours and old-fashioned roofs. In our opinion, the area around the Grand Place is the most beautiful part of the centre of Brussels and what really attracts so many visitors worldwide each year. We would gladly share our excitement about the Grand Place with your students so that they can immediately get acquainted with it as a very enjoyable place to go to.

We hope to receive a positive answer soon, and again, I thank you for your time and interest.

Sincerely,

Hi Mark,

as you already know, I'm from a little town, Kętrzyn. Most of the year I live in Poznań, because of my studies at the University, but every summer I go back home to spend some time with my family and friends. Last summer I decided to do something more than just relax and have fun, so I started to look for an interesting summer job. Like I previously said, Kętrzyn is a rather small town, so there is only one old movie theatre and it's closed for most the time. It opens only in a time of summer, mainly for tourists. Because of that, there are no regular employees, at the beginning of every summer new season stuff is hired. So I decided to give it a try and I applied for that job. 

It was the best summer ever. You know how much I love watching movies, especially in small and cosy movie theatres. It was like working in a paradise. My duties were pretty simple. Selling tickets, snacks and drinks, cleaning the place after and before the shows, so work itself wasn't the exciting part. The main reason why I loved to work there and every day I went to work with a big smile on my face were the possibilities to watch every show I wanted. There is only one auditorium so I was busy just between the shows and sometimes, for family shows, there was a 15 minutes break in the middle of the show, for the kids to use the toilet or buy more snacks and drinks. I watched almost every shown movie, some of them for more than once. When my work there came to an end, I was happy, but on the other hand, I felt some kind of sadness too. I mean, it was September, so I had a one whole month of vacation ahead of me to do whatever I wanted to and it was awesome because I could finally just relax, sleep, read books and spend a lot of time with my loved ones. On the other hand, I was sad to leave that job. This place really stole my heart and I miss its atmosphere, regular visitors and people I worked with. I'm planning to work there for the next summer too. 

As you can see, my summer was great. How about yours? I remember you were saying something about planning to go to India. How was the trip? I bet it is an interesting story.

I look forward to hearing from you,
Maciej

The line graph illustrates the amount and type of fast food eaten by teenagers in Australia between 1795 and 2000. As an overall trend, it is clear that consumption of fish and chips decreased over the period  while the amount of pizzas and hamburgers eaten increased during the same period.
In 1975 the consumption of fish and chips was ten times higher than the consumption of the other two types of fast food. However, the quantity of fish and chips plates eaten per year declined from 100 times per year in 1975 to just over 80 times in 1980. Then, there was a slight increase to about 95 times per year in 1985. After that, this trend kept falling and reached the lowest point in 2000 (just under 40 times that year).
In contrast, the consumption of hamburgers and pizzas started at about 10 times for hamburgers and 5 times for pizzas in 1975, and then rose constantly until it reached approximately 100 times and 85 times respectively in 1995. It then levelled off during the next 5 years.

The purpose of this literature review is to provide the clear picture about motivation and business strategy of entrepreneurs in their start-ups. The literature review contains three main parts. Firstly, the review of literature will define the word "entrepreneurship" in business context. Following that, the next section will examine the entrepreneur's motivations, which contains 2 major aspects: intrinsic personality traits and extrinsic factors. Thirdly, the current opportunities and challenges of Vietnamese Food market will be reviewed, coming together with the literature of Vietnamese entrepreneurs’ motivation. Finally, the problems facing and business strategy will be introduced and explored. The conceptual framework will conclude the literature review and open up the subjects which this thesis will explore.
