The streets were calmed and the lights were pleasant. Travelling at night was a pleasure in this town.
"So here we are" he said looking upward. "We better do our exam as soon as we can"
They moved in the crowd that made several phone calls and talked about their busy life. 
She looked around  making faces at everyone around. She made a complaint; they were so annoying.
"You have to do your duty here too, remember? We made a progress back in the other city"
She nooded and made another effort to look around. Who could be? It was difficult to tell. They needed someone who looked important or rich. Someone who knew too much maybe. 
"What about him?" She pointed at a man who was making a deal with another man. As usual, they were talking about illegal things
"He will be our ticket to the main building and to the exam" he said. They came closer to the man. He was making preparations to make a huge deal with the other person. The other person wasn't convinced howewer. They talked for hours one trying to convince the other, he was doing his best, but at the end, the other man declined. 
When he finished talking he looked to the young couple in front of him 
"What are you doing here pests?!" He made sure his voice was heard on the streets, to reafirm his social position. The young couple grinned "You haven't heard about the mind hackers right?" They said in a delightful and evil tone.
He gasped and tried to scream but it was too late to run. They controlled his mind.She looked on her laptop, where all the information in that man's mind was displayed
"Bingo. We got a code"
She made a note and wrote it down. She inspected the man looking for an Id. She took it and as soon as they got it, they let the man go, who fainted and will not remember anything that happened to his mind. The thief couple made their way to the main building. 
The building was luxurious and covered by the most wonderful structures ever. They entered the building with the aid of the ID and made use of the code to enter the interiors of the building. 
They got with the receptionist 
"Are you two the people who will make their skill test?"
The couple nooded and showed the ID of the man from the other city.
The receptionist nooded and conducted both to the main hall. What was inside was dangerous but fascinating. They saw every register of the memories of people in that town. It was disturbing as kids were also included. 
The young couple continued forward until they reached him. One of the bosses in charge of such thing. 
She felt somehow nervous "I know we are doing this to escape this inferno but...I have a bad feeling about this" but it was too late. They made a decision and one of the bosses was in front of them. 
They walked in to find a man looking through the window 
"You two are finally here. I know who you are"
It was impossible they deleted every bit of information about themselves
"Did you think you two were going to make fun of me?..."He pushed her backwards
"Welcome to your tombstone, hackers"

Home of the future will look more or less the same as the home of the present. However, I believe that their functionality will change. Even today processors are in almost every device: dishwashers, vacuum cleaners, television sets, even blenders. So, how can we improve them? By hooking them up to the Internet. It may sound silly, but I think it actually will make those devices more user friendly and functional.
 Even now we can buy TV sets with Internet connection, so development of technology is not a problem. But we have to ask ourselves why would we connect every device in our house to World Wide Web? The answer is: remote control. Imagine you can programme your house to welcome you after a long day at work. You come back and dinner is cooked, all your favourite programmes are recorded and ready to watch, Your bath is full of hot water and you can just relax.
Reassuming, while design of houses may look different the most important change will be in technology which will make our life easier. It has already done but we still can’t see the end of possibilities.

It's no secret that there has been a decline in the use of transport such as taxis ever since cars became more affordable and your common Joe became capable of sustaining one, two or more per family, however, does that really mean that the future of public transport like buses is hopeless?

People are becoming more and more aware of the strain the carbon dioxide emissions of their cars put on the environment, and many municipalities have already outlawed the circulation of certain types of vehicles in given parts of their cities to reduce atmospheric pollution and improve the quality of its air. Many affordable bus and metropolitan passes and other systems have also been created in order to motivate the citizens to use them, providing a quicker, and sometimes cheaper, alternative to their own transport.

The recent focus on public transport, along with the certain technological improvements and innovations that will follow it, are going to revitalize the public transport sector and hopefully make cities more eco-friendly.

He walked as fast as someone who knows the way. Nothing was taking his attention. His head was wandering around the sweet smile that made him feel nervous like a child just a few minutes ago. It wasn't only the smile, but the way she talked to him, the look in her eyes and her flirty attitude what had filled his stomach with tiny butterflies and, as he was going home, he started to realize the love running through his veins, right to the heart. The voices in his head kept repeating: "Michael, you should have kissed her. You don't know if you will ever have another chance." 
On the other hand, his wife, his not-so-lovely wife, always angry and cold as ice, was waiting for him at home. As Michael approached the house his feelings dropped down. Was she alone? Why is that car parked right at his house's door? Why are all the lights on? He picked up the keys from his pocket and approached carefully, holding his breath. Michael closed the door and knew at that moment he had made a mistake.

Dear Katy
 
I'm really glad to hear from you! It's been a long time since we last contact each other. So, you don't know what to do with your promel, do you? Don't worry, I'll try to make it easy for you to decide which is the option that suits you best.

On the one hand, you've been doing sport since you were seven years old and I understand it's very important for you. It's an activity that you need to do every day, now that it's a good way to keep fit. However, as far as I'm concerned, it's not necessary to work out that much to be healthy. As a matter of fact, you just have to eat a balanced diet and do sport twice or three times a week. That way, you will be able to do sport as well as going to music classes.

On the other hand, you love playing piano and, in my opinion, you won't be able to keep it up if you give up music classes, as you don't have any instruments at home. Besides, I don't think your parents would buy you a piano, since it would really annoy your neighbours. Besides, as I have already said, you can exercise three or four hours a week instead of going every day to your training session. As I see it, you couldn't live without music even if you tried. Now it's your time to choose.

I hope my advice makes sense to you and that it helps with your decision. 

Best of luck with your dilemma and don't forget to write and tell me the outcome!

Love

Ariana

Dear Editor,

I am writing to inform you that the package holidays to Madrid you are currently advertising in your newspaper are apparently not what they claimed to be. I believe you should be fully informed about the quality of the services in the advertisements you publish, as your readers could be negatively biassed towards your paper only due to such incidents.

Generally, the holiday as a whole was good enough as the most important –in my opinion- aspects, like the quality of the guided tours and the accommodation, was very high. Nevertheless, there were many inaccuracies in the advertisement and certain aspects of the holiday were chaotic. 

The fist day was a great shock to me as I realized I would be part of a group. The tourist agency made group bookings, which resulted in the unusually low price of the holiday package. Spending holidays with a group can be very convenient and for some people is the only way of travelling, but the advertisement did not state clearly that it concerned this particular type of holiday, which made me and some others feel deceived. Another point of concern was transportation. We had several problems, especially with the bus, which was often delayed and in one case it even caused us to miss a scheduled guided tour.

I believe there is plenty of room for improvement since, although the problems were not insuperable, they caused great inconvenience. Firstly, a better transport agency should be found for the former difficulties to be prevented. Secondly, advertisements should be clearer as it is very easy for someone to misunderstand them. But the most important issue is the improvement of the general organization. Much time lost could have been saved with a few phone calls, for example waiting for half an hour in a  queue could have been prevented if a call had been made to the museum before we arrived there.

I assume that the tourist agency can think of better solutions than me, but I hope that my recommendations will be taken seriously.

Best Regards,

With no doubt all parents want their children to be citizen models. However raising a child into a model citizen is extremely hard - working. Some people think that this job should be done by the parents and others think unfairly that this is the teacher's responsibility.
On one hand, parents should take responsibility on their children education as they are a child's first contact. Also, parents are like models to follow for their children, and as children do what they see they will copy their parents actions.
Indeed school is the first place where a children interacts with society. However, they will talk or build a relationship based on what they see their parents doing with other people. Ultimately, teachers may have different values from the ones of the parents.
On the other hand, parents may have lack of time to spend with their children due to demanding jobs and to provide everything that their children need, for example pay for their children school. It can also be argued that children spend most of their time at school and not at home, making the school responsibility to pass good social values. But it should not be forgotten, that parents have the most influence as they are models to follow.
To sum up, parents should take full responsibility for their children education. However, one should take into account that a school with similar values to the ones of the parents would be a great help in the children raising process.

Everything in this movie, Henri, is so simple and startling, but in the same time is hard to describe.
It tells the story of a widowed shop owner and a mentally handicapped girl. As time passes by, the relationship has so many ups and downs, but with consistent love and caring it ends with a strong bond that isn't easily broken. In France, where the film is made, they call the handicapped ,"White Butterflies", which is definitely a better nomenclature than "People With Special Needs" and so many dishonored names. The only reason I want to recommend this movie to you is because I want you to forget about all the action, thrilling, money making or good fighting evil. My sole purpose is to help you enjoy the little things in your lives, appreciate the life and its simplicity with all its hidden fun and sad parts as well. Unlock the door toward a new life and kick off your journey toward a whole new group of characters. chase the childish dream of visiting a foreign country and get to know new aspects of life. Check out how ordinary people, just like you and me, live each and every day, share their grief and problems, join them with their happy moments, get involved in their lives and be passionate and compassionate. Refresh your soul by getting involved in their special moments and get ready to make a change in your own life.

REPORT ON THE COURSE "Good design using DTP"

The aim of this report is to briefly describe the main strengths and weaknesses of the course "Good design using DTP" so as to give an overall view of it. 

DESCRIPTION  

The course took place in the Training center in Regent Street - London on the 14-15 of May, as scheduled. All the participants, which were ten in total, were given a personal computer for the duration of the entire course in order to put into practice what was taught. Furthermore, the organizers had carefully planned the whole course, including meals and beverages too.

ACHIEVEMENTS

The tutor, Will Reeves - a lecturer of the University of Cambridge, succeeded in covering the whole program in an extremely effective way. To begin with, he focused on design considerations with DPT, explaining what software to use, and then he went on to tell us about typography and fonts, layout and balance as well as graphics and logs. Therefore, he concluded the course by making color considerations and showing proofing and printing. The highpoint, however, was the final practical exercises which gave us the opportunity to test our comprehension. 

FAILURES

Despite the strengths mentioned above, there were also some areas that required some attention. Not only was the venue inconvenient but it was also dirty. The general dissatisfaction was perceived by the lecturer too, who pointed it out to the organizers who immediately started looking for an alternative venue. In addition, in spite of having paid a lot, the participants were not allowed to take any materials away, and this resulted in obtaining a less effective result as the participants didn’t have any materials to use to revise. 

FINAL CONSIDERATIONS

To sum up, the course was generally successful, as the positive feedback received suggests. In conclusion, we would definitely recommend it to anybody interested in this subject for both the quality of the course and the unquestionable preparation of the tutor.

Nowadays, many countries have been ruined areas of farmland, forest and wetland with the intention to construct housing and transport networks to cater to the demand of people.There are many problems created by doing large-building projects, and it is the government's responsibility to cope with these problems.

There are some unfavorable influence on people's lives.Because of the damage of farmland, forest and wetland, it is likely to lead to the pollution of water and air, which can cause the decrease of people's living quality.For example, in some areas ,people have to wear a musk while having outdoor activities and they might need to purchase water from other towns.As a result, their lifestyle can be negatively affect and thus they would feel less happy than other people lived in unpolluted areas.

The damage of habitats have affect animals in negative way. They have to immigrate to another place since their homes are destroyed, and during the immigration most of them would die because of lack of water, high temperature or predators.Besides, those animals who successfully arrive at proper place to live are likely to suffer from disease, because they didn't exposed to such a new environment before.

Although there are many people and animals are suffer from these problems, i do believe that the government can take some actions to solve them.Firstly, laws should be set to forbid some projects which cause massive problems to the environment. Secondly, it is necessary for the government to warn people the serious problems caused by constructing large-scale buildings.

To summarise, large-scale building projects create massive problems which are harmful to human and animals,but the government can be helpful in solving these problems

I agree with the given statement. This is because all the people dream for a better future. Domestic violence

Everybody knows about the big problem that our society has, in terms of domestic abuse. But most of us just from far; we really do not imagine how this can affect people who suffer it.

Unfortunately, many people are damaged, not only physical but mentally and the worst is that violence destroys families and also involves their sons in the hell it causes. Children quite often feel guilty of cannot avoid these troubles or help their mothers to escape from them and tend to think they are doing something wrong when they obviously do not. They are just the most sensitive and innocent victims of mistreatment.

It is very serious and hard to solve because victims have to be very strong and brave to recognize and face these situations and being able to report their aggressor so as to manage the matter finishes. This is so difficult due to the fact that they usually feel stupid, miserable, hopeless and do not feel good about themselves. Their aggressors make them become insecure and they think that they are alone. Even, in most cases, they feel ashamed or afraid of these situations and prefer saying nothing to tell their truth. 

All those people who are living this abuse have to know that they are really important and deserve to be happy and free and they are not alone. There are many people who worry about and are willing to help and support them. There is always someone who you can count on in your family, friends or associations, but you must ask for help.

We need to consider both sides of the argument for public transport use prior to reaching a conclusion. Public transport is used for many reasons and can be convenient for different circumstances. There are many reasons for using public transport, such as commuting in to the central business district. This form of transport can be used to avoid delays due to traffic conditions and parking restrictions. It can provide an opportunity for people to complete work during the journey. Public transport may be the only option for individuals who do not drive or have access to a car. It is more environmentally friendly because it has the potential to reduce the numbers of vehicles on the road. However, the public transport use can be affected by a number of factors such as mechanical failures and environmental issues. It may be expensive to use for some individuals and crowded during rush hours. Using the car can be more flexible for some individuals. A car can be useful for effective performance of many tasks. It is easier to change routes when circumstances change unexpectedly. However, a car can be expensive to maintain, park and fuel.

I think there is a role for both methods of transport after taking in to account all of the above reasons. The reasons for use is dependent on the individual and the circumstances.

My favourite film of the last few months is "Scent of a woman". It's one of the best Al Pacino's films and it's very different from previous ones.

First of all, in this film you don't see a gangster Al Pacino, it's about a retired army's coonel who suffers from loneliness and depression. It's worth seeing because a young boy, Charlie, helps him get through his sadness in a very luxurious trip to New York.

One problem is that some scenes are too long, like the one in which they're having dinner with the colonel's family. However, the drama is perfectly achieved in each scene and they keep you tied to the screen.

So, overall I strongly recommend  it if you like redemption stories, and if you want to learn some pieces of advice for your life. It's certainly a good choice if you want to watch a DVD next Friday night.

The reading discusses the idea of how advance communication technologies give us an advantages of creating a 24/7 international working day and provides several reasons of support. The professor, however, disagrees with points made in the article and explains that this system has its own disadvantages.

First point the professor addresses involves the reading's assertion that creating two or three teams situated in different geographical locations will help reduce the work hours for each team and at the same time it will decrease the time frame of getting the project done. The professor refutes this point of view by saying that based on his own experience this team work could be not so much beneficial. For instance, some group could have questions, but it would not be able to ask the other group because they would sleep at that time. Therefore, the working group will do its assumptions and may cause a waste of time. Moreover, the group in California may do work in one way and a group in India do same work differently, so it will be challenging to bring both of them to the same way of getting things done.

Another point from the article that the professor opposes is the claim that telecommunication helps to solve many problems that physical separation would cause to businesses. The professor points out that holding virtual meetings between teams in different time frames will be challenging. Thus, one of the team will have to stay late in order to talk to another group causing inconvenience.

It is not easy to prove that there is a relationship between organizational culture and performance. For a very long time there has not been scientific evidence that proved the relationship between organizational culture and performance, until studies found a correlation between these subjects. These four studies are put together in a model named ‘Organization Culture Performance Model’ (OCPM). This model tells us that the culture is determined by actual behavior of individual or groups of employees.  The culture is caused by organizational variables. These variables include internal and external cultural expects. The external aspect is: external client orientation. The internal aspects are: design of organization, communication, HRM-orientation and leadership. This variables influence the behavior of employees. The model distinguishes three kinds of expected performances:  individual-, groups-, and organizational performances. There isn’t a direct relationship between organizational culture and actual performances, but there is a direct relationship between organizational culture and expected performances. The researchers found that there is a big difference between what the boardroom preach and what the employee’s experience.
A short summary of the OCPM- model: there are organizational variables that determine the visible and invisible behavior of employees. These variables and behavior of employees determine the expected performance and then there is the actual outcome.

Should smoking be banned?
More and more people nowadays try to  find some ways of relaxation, due to a fast pace of life and stress. Smoking appeals to hearts of many people of different generations, because it gives a fast relief for a short period of time, that is also quite reasonable.
It`s a fact that tobacco is used as a light drug for centuries by people of different nationalities. It`s a real issue for the government to understand that if the process of banning smokers starts, the income rate will immediately decrease. Moreover tobacco contains a vitamin, called PP1 that is beneficial for your health. It also helps to overcome some stressful situations, even though it`s temporarily, it`s still beneficial for your heart, rather than being constantly stressed.
Finally smoking is personal choice of freedom for everyone.
On the other hand, smokers sometimes even don`t realize that their children or relatives become passive smokers too. It`s important to understand that you are responsible for your surroundings and people around you. So if your habits can be harmful for them you need to understand what`s a cost of it. For the same reason  government needs to control the situation,by using banning strategy if people smoke in one of forbidden ares, like kindergartens, schools , hospitals, etc. 
In my opinion, people need to have freedom to make decisions on their own, but as soon as it starts to be a treat for others, they should be stopped immediately.

The purpose of this report is to consider how my town takes care of the environment and to explain what kind of recommendations and improvements you can make if you live in Madrid.

Madrid is a huge city which offers a lot of recycling facilities that take care of the environment:
There is a great public transport syste. It’s very easy to recycle things and it’s possible to choose alternative energy sources.

Firstly, people can take the bus or the underground and leave his or her car at home. 
Secondly, it’s quite easy to deposit plastic, paper and glass in different recycling bins. 
Another option is the possibility of having solar panels on the roofs of some buildings in Madrid.

We could reuse and recycle household waste.
When we go shopping, we should take our own bags instead of using plastic bags from the shop. 
Old clothes, books and toys in good conditions can be passed on to charity shops. 
Our aim should be to deposit as many things as possible in the plastic, paper and glass bins.
And if you have a garden, you could turn your vegetable peelings into compost.

In conclusion, Madrid offers a lot of alternatives to take care of the environment. It could be an example for other cities on how to help and conserve our planet.

Discuss the risks and impacts of climate(weather)-related natural disasters.

Over the past few decades, human activities have changed global climate, hence we are facing higher risks of weather-related disasters.  Furthermore, various destructive disasters have struck into the whole society with many negative elements, drawing the attention of citizens toward catastrophes.  Natural disasters such as drought can be generally defined as one that has a far-reaching influence because its long duration and wide scope.  This essay will examine global warming and precipitation shortage as causes of drought, followed by two main negative impacts in terms of the economic and social problems in agriculture.

One of the overt reasons for weather-related natural disasters is global warming.  It is obvious that global warming can be attributed to greenhouse gas emissions.  Moreover, the world’s uncontrollable population results in the demand of cars, industries and farming industries, that have contributed to greenhouse gases.  With the cause of human activities, the temperature of sea surface and the atmosphere have been gradually growing to a new level.  van Aalst (2006) pointed out that an increase of earth mean surface temperature with approximately 0.6 degrees has been explored over the past century, with the phenomenon which has been observed that land temperature has exceeded that of seas by a quicker speed ( p.6 ).  In addition, most of greenhouse gas emissions can affect the atmosphere for decades, which might cause marine monsoon inaccessibility to mainland resulting in low rainfall.  Another phenomenon can be caused by global warming is the decrease of snow coverage in relation to glaciers melting (van Aalst, 2006, p. 7).  Thus, it can be seen that global warming has accounted for a series of extreme weather phenomenon.    

Undoubtedly, all the factors are responsible for the soil water shortage and decreasing precipitation.  Generally, the increase of temperature has resulted in a surge of hot days, and a drop of cold days.  This will largely causes less of soil water and precipitation.  Additionally, this event is different depending on the areas.  The area as mid-continental will unquestionably become dryer and insufficient precipitation, which is possible to make it more vulnerable to summer droughts (van Aalst, 2006, p.8).  “It is estimated that 75 million to 250 million people in Africa will be exposed to water stress due to desertification induced by climate change”, states by IPCC ( as cited in Baker, 2012, p. 20).  In brief, there will be serious consequences in terms of less precipitation due to extreme weather.

In the economic aspect, drought has brought a tremendous problem of yield for agriculture.  As a consequence of both direct and indirect impacts of agriculture, prolonged drought can be commonly defined as the biggest factor.  The direct impact of prolonged drought is the reduction of incomes for farmers result from the decrease of output.  This can lead to the loss of profits from upstream and downstream throughout the supply chain, which can produce directly negative impacts for producers, as reported by Bauman, Goemans, Pritchett and McFadden ( 2013, p. 62).  Moreover, it creates a colossal economic damage when the drought occurs: lives are lost, people and animals are forced to move to a new place, resources become unsustainable or even extinct ( Bergholt, 2012, p. 148). 

Another stricken area is social perspective, which has threatened the majority of the population.  Firstly, drought has caused farming in some of the area, such as Africa where is an underdeveloped of infrastructure and a lack of abilities to react after emergency.  Moreover, farming is one of the most crucial impacts of weather-related natural disasters, and it has caused an important number of casualties for both mankind as well as animals.  Secondly, farming also has contributed to migration.  When public suffers from natural disasters and they are no solutions, they are forced to leave their home in order to move to a new place, which could affect the next generation that might confront a multicultural society.  Consequently, drought has led to severe social impacts of natural disasters.

In conclusion, catastrophes such as drought have produced immense economic and social impacts.  Not only human beings but also all the organisms are confronting the threat from climate-related natural disasters.  The fact is natural disasters have changed people and animal’s living environment bringing  about a multitude of influences in both direct economic revenue of farmers and indirect effects on enterprise.  Additionally, climate change relates to natural disasters also causes farming which has triggered death and forced people as well as animals leave their home.  More seriously, climate is continuingly changing and still contributing to natural disasters.  Thus, we should consider this kind of threat to our future.

Perhaps I am being a little wishful thinking. I do not blame anyone for this, because I know, this heart of mine seems to just fall in love a little too fast and easily. It is too early isn’t? It’s to early to talk about love at this day and age. Everything seems to strange when you fifteen and you are talking about love. Why is that so? Well, that question has been ringing in my mind for so many months. This past few months have made my life unfathomable, making me unable to grasp the idea of when is the right age to fall in love. 

To me, falling in love, is to accept and admire those little things that exist in that human being. After I have accepted that,I will begin to push all their flaws aside, because their flaws will only make me fall in love with them even more.  I know it is wrong to have strong feelings for someone who is definitely older, and I know nothing will come out of it. So why bother loving someone who will never return that love back? To me, love is not about having two parties loving and embracing each other. Their life will be happier when you ceased to exist. Yes, it hurts, but at the end of the day, almost everything in this world, will make you bleed. It will make you cringe, bawl like baby. It will make you feel vulnerable but that is life. 

They will always love you base on your looks then personality. No matter how wrong I may sound, believe me, it is so true. 

Love is not all happy. Love can kill you. It can kill your soul.

My favourite sport

My favourite sport is walking. Some people do not think of walking as a sport, they believe that a sport has to be a rough activity one that left you overtired and sweeting. But in my opinion a sport is any activity that requires a certain amount of physical activity, one that can help you to improve your health.

I enjoy walking because it allows you to do physical exercise and talk, watch the landscape or do other things at the same time. Walking is also a sport that almost everybody can do. If you are young you could walk fast, if you are old or not especially fit, you could start walking at a slow pace and with time improve your performance

I would like to give some advice to the people who want to start walking: Take your time, do not want to walk ten kilometers the first day, try first short walks and every day increase the distance. You will find yourself walking  a little longer and faster than the day before.

And if you do that then, sooner than later, you will become a walking enthusiast

It was a sunny day of April. Easter was coming. Everyone in the house was so excited about it but not Michael. He knew that soon he will must face his most powerful enemy, the Easter Bunny. He didn't know why everybody was in love with him. This character has been his childhood nightmare. He used to dream him coming in his bedroom, laughing out loud showing off his sharp teeth, threating him with the most horrible punishments. He remembered one of the awful dreams he used to have as a child. He was home alone baby-sitting his two year old sister. All of a sudden he heard somebody knocking at the front door. Then a voice roared "I'm gonna eat you up!", "I'm gonna eat your baby sister up!". "Let me in! I'm the Easter Bunny". Michael was terrified. He grabbed the phone trying to call his parents. But the phone was dead. He wanted to hide somewhere but he couldn't think straight. In a flash his brain sent him a signal and he realized it was only a dream. So he started repeating in his mind "It's only a dream. It's only a dream. You're going to wake up soon." Suddenly he felt brave and unstoppable. He decided it's time to face his enemy. He put his hand on the handle and without thinking too much he opened the door. This giant scary bunny was just in front of him. He didn't have time to get scared because all what he was thinking was why he doesn't wake up at once. It can't be real. But the bunny yelled at him to shut the door and bit his arm so badly that tears came out instantly from his eyes. He was now puzzled and frighten too. Michael closed the door and knew at that moment he had made a mistake.

It is sometimes maintained that when manufacturers and retail companies try to persuade us to buy something, colour is a very effective thing which helps them do that. I think it is true that colour do influence our decision when we buy different things. 

Firstly, I am convinced that colour is very important when people buy clothes, especially for women. No doubt that manufacturers know which colour is popular and fashionable in a particular season and correspondingly it means that things of this colour will be sold well. In addition, companies are used to conducting different surveys to find out which colour is more popular in various social classes. For instance, I have recently read that people who belong to middle class prefer pink and green colours due to some psychological reasons. 

Furthermore, colours which are used in decoration of shops or restaurants are also rather influential. For example, psychologists are convinced that red is a colour which stimulates people's appetite and makes them feel hungry. That is why the predominant colour in McDonald's is red likewise in some other cafes and restaurants. 

Having said this, however, I think that there are many other factors which are even more important than colour for people when they buy something. For example, if I liked a thing, I would not think much about its colour or a colour of the shop where I found it. Moreover, for many people the main factor is a price of a thing but not its colour. 

To some up briefly, I would like to say that there is a special branch of psychology which investigates consumers' tastes and factors which influence their choice. Thus, we can conclude that colour is a powerful tool but in the same way manufacturers and retail companies should take into consideration other factors.

Article: My Best Friend

My friendship with Jessie started the first exciting day of kindergarten. We were three years old. I went downstairs to the playground for the break.
    
I was walking alone around the noisy and crowded playground , looking for my very first friend, when I saw a quiet girl under a tree. She had deep blue eyes and looked very shy. I instantly wanted to be her friend.
   
We first met at the swings, she smiled and I knew we were going to be friends forever. I asked her if she wanted a sweet and timidly, she nodded. When the break was over we went hand in hand to our classroom. Gradually, we got to know each other and soon we became best friends. We played every day together and, in the afternoons, we went to each other's houses.
  
Now, we don't have any secrets between us and we always know when we need each other. I love how Jessie helps me with everything I need, like with guys or family problems. We love doing sleepovers, watch movies and going on holidays together. After many years, we still share the same kind of sweets we shared the first day we met.

It is generally accepted that television is providing us by far the best and easiest way to stay in touch with the whole world, while relaxing on our sofa, taking some time off from our housework. This is the innovation that such a worldwide media is bringing to our society. Anyway, I wonder whether it would be useful and able to increase our culture and help us to be more critic towards life rather than impose its power on us. A recent research shows us why there is always an increasing number of children who are getting used to spend most of their afternoons in front of the television, not to miss a new cartoon nor a well-known film: they seem like they are unaware of the existence of documentaries, news and all the other educative programmes which today televisions are plenty of. It has been suggested by some European governments to introduce televisions in schools to give the opportunity to discuss together about present topics and problems, in order to learn something more about the world we are living in. I am sure that, if taken up, this idea will surely be a failure. In view of the above arguments, I would suggest anyone to cut out on television in order to have more time to read newspapers daily.

Taking a year off after finishing school can be harmful depending on what you're planning to do in that year. Interrupting the momentum by taking a year off is  maybe the worst thing you can do. Unless you get a job in that year, to keep you busy, or do whatever that keeps you focused and gives you a routine, you shouldn't take a year off at all. Without the routine that studying gives you, with all the dealines, the exams, and other stuff that forces you to get things done, and, by consequence, teaches you to be a responsible person, which you would need to be when you get a job, you will simple be wasting one year of your life  by taking a break. One thing that I've learned in my life is that you never should take a break from your everyday routine unless you really need, due to fatigue or some other physical or pscychological reason, otherwise you will be, I repeat, just wasting time, time that you could be spending in an usefull way, by getting something done, or improving yourself academically, intelectualy or doing whatever you think that can enrich your life. So, whether you take a year off or not, my point is that you shouldn't be wasting your time. Don't waste your time, spend it in a fruitful way.

I've wasted so much time in my life that even I found it embarrassing. I've wasted the best years of my life doing nothing. Now I'm doing something, although I will probably never see the fruits of my labor. 
I like to beleieve that, like the old Latin proverb  says (and I have already said this), there will be glory at the end to the man who endures hardships in his path. Maybe one day I will experience the glory that awaits at  high places those who walk through the narrow paths of life. Or, most probably, I won't.
Regardless of what's waiting for me at the end, I will never give up walking through those hard paths no matter how challenging and hard they may be.

I was alive! I was alive!...I couldn't believe it! Having gone through all those tough times; trials and tribulations and I was alive! I was as happy as a lark but soon it was getting dark. My leg was injured and it was as painful as a thorn in the paw; after countless hours of crawling. I couldn't bear the pain but I had to endure it to survive my ordeal. Leaning forward slowly, I started crawling slowly like a turtle along the slender hill; I was on all four! I was feeling as tired as a worn out shoe. After a long and tiring crawl, I needed to find a shelter from where I could seek refuge from the chilling wind howling over my head unabated. I kept my body very close to the icy ground in order to reduce the impact of the bone-chiseling wind. Suddenly I saw a small gap between two blocks of snowy hills just enough for me to lie down in. The place was a bit gloomy and cold but I had no choice; I was too tired to move on. But before I knew it I was asleep. I woke up to the sound of the howling wind once again, in a state of vertigo. Looking down at the watch on my wrist, I realized it had been nearly a week since I survived the fall over the snowy cliff and now I had to go through this all alone with no improvement to my dire predicament. I continued crawling on all four while wondering, for how much longer, Simon till we meet again. I never stopped praying all along; in hope that somehow, somewhere, someone would come along to rescue me. As I was climbing downhill, I found myself getting blisters on my palm in a manner I could have no control over. The pain was excruciating but I just had to move on as if I ever hoped to survive my ordeal! As quickly as I could, I managed to get myself to the nearest leafless tree that I could find where I leaned my back against it to try to gain whatever support I could muster with the little energy that I had left in my body. I was a broken man; barely alive! Emphatically I reminded myself that I shouldn't have survived had it not been for God's help! I kept praying to God to give me the inner strength to carry on although I was fully aware of my own self-imposed exile from church services the last two years. Doubts began to creep in, "Would God show his mercy?". With the pain, doubts, hunger all crashing down on me, I was about to give up my fight for ultimate survival. A second thought crossed my mind telling me that I would miss my family and my best friends! I had to carry on to fight to stay alive! The very thought of winning an accolade in front of a jubilant crowd disappeared all together and all I ever wanted was to be home, be safe, and be with my family.

There is no doubt that the subject of keeping animals in zoos creates a lot of debate. Some people say zoos are traditional family entertainment and good for animals. Others say keeping animals in zoos is cruel and inhumane.
One advantage of zoos is that they give people the chance to see and learn about animals. This makes people more likely to want to look after animals and protect their natural habitats. Due to the interest in protecting animals, people are eager to take part in organizations such as World Wide Fund for Nature (WWF) which is an international non-governmental organization working on issues regarding the conservation, research and restoration of the environment.
Another positive aspect of zoos is that they help to protect endangered species by offering them a safe place to live. In addition, zoos help to find mates for endangered species. For example, many pandas would not find a mate to breed with if they were on their own in the wild.
On the other hand, there are many arguments against keeping animals in zoos. Firstly, zoo animals often suffer from stress and boredom when they are not in their natural habitat. Secondly, unwanted animals are sometimes sold to circuses, hunting parks or for meat. Consequently, they are mistreated, hit and live in an inadequate place where they cannot behave freely.
Another drawback is that animals sometimes escape from their enclosures, which is dangerous for humans. This is clearly seen when driving in the route and suddenly you see a bull or a cow in the middle of the way. this may cause not only the animal death by being run over but also the passengers' death if the driver tries to stop and lose the control of the car.
To conclude, there are strong arguments for and against keeping animals in zoos. Personally, I think it is acceptable to keep animals in zoos, as long as they have enough space and are properly looked after.

First of all, I would like to say that the young people have worse health nowadays. This is not their fault, of course. It is our fault because we have let the companies to profit from our own sins. We are made of flesh and it can be very difficult to resist the temptation.

You should take a look at the things your children have at their reach. They have computers, smartphones, cleaning robots, fast food... And the list goes on. I am not saying we should travel back in time. We have developed  technology to make our lives easier. Nevertheless, we cannot allow that technology to put our children in danger.

On the one hand, I am going to sound like my grandfather telling his war tales. On the other hand, can someone tell me why their children can spend hours playing video games? Why do we allow them to eat hot dogs?  Why do they need a smartphone?

In summary, I know it is a hard choice. I am talking about multinational companies that try to change our way of life to suit their needs. I am a believer that any parent would do whatever it takes to protect their children. Therefore, I call to action.

Kateryna was born in 1988 in Siberia, RF in the family of Ukrainian Tatars. Kateryna was sent to Ukraine at the age of 6. The art of writing letters along with painting colorful mandalas were taught by her grandmother. A huge mirror in her bedroom made a child believe that one is able to travel through it anywhere. Algebra and geometry were the most important subjects taught by her grandfather. She loved watching printer at work producing numerous results of psychology tests, which she had just passed.  She graduated the high-school at the age of 15. By this time she had been spending almost all her free time near the computer. She devoted all her free time to experiments on linking the math homework with programming of the music equalizer. That's how creating visuals on the screen became her favorite activity. 

She graduated Kiev International University in 2009. Kateryna was frustrated with classic film genre and started looking for possibilities for realization of experimental theoretical ideas on practice. After taking part in numerous festivals and concerts she had finally entered a joint British-Russian program for training socio-cultural managers in the cultural sphere.

The sport that I like the most is Dancing. It may sound weird or even wrong for some people, because there are many of them that don't even consider dancing as a sport... but for me, and for everyone that has ever done dancing, it is not only a sport, but a very difficult one. Dancing requires a lot of things, like cordination, flexibility, and physical condition, just to mention a few. But despite how hard dancing can be, it is also really fun, and that's actually what makes me enjoy it the most. You don't even notice how hard your body is working because you really are enjoying yourself, and I think that's awesome because it just makes everything easier. However, I would advise people who would like to start dancing to really take it serious, because even though I said it is fun, it really does require commitment and discipline. Dancing is not as easy as everybody thinks, but it is definitely worth a try.

The influence of the grown-ups: great or not so?

Recently I have listened to a discussion on how adults can be a good influence on young people. This got me thinking, how do adults influence the behaviour of youngsters? And is this always a good influence, or should adults interfere less with the behaviour of younger people?

Adults can influence the behaviour of youngsters in different ways. First of all, they can give rules to younger people. This can differ from the rules your parents have set for you, to the laws created by the governmen. These rules can influence behaviour in a positive way, because they prevent you from doing stupid things. Secondly, adults can offer advice to the youngsters. This might be of great influence on youngster, for adults are seen as the wiser people. They have more life experience so they probably know what they are talking about. Lastly, adults can set an example for younger people. Think of celebrities for example. They are of great influence on younger people. When someone greatly admires a person, they will try to behave like them. So when admirable adults set good examples for youngsters, they can influence behaviour in a positive way.

However, it isn’t all that great. Because young people often don’t like to be belittled. So setting rules might cause them to do the exact opposite. Especially when they have to live under a great lot of rules. Also, advice isn’t always taken positively. This is because adults lived in a complete other time, so their advice might be outdated. This causes young people to ignore the advice. Lastly, when a wrong example is set, this can influence behaviour in a negative way, because they’ll try to act to this wrong example. 

So all in all, there are many ways in which adults can influence the behaviour of younger people. And whether this is taken positively, is completely up to the adults and youngsters themselves.

Myths and facts about frozen shoulder

Frozen shoulder or shoulder stiffness is an extremely limiting and debilitating disease. The condition starts with pain when you move your shoulder joint and then progresses into total failure and limitation of the shoulder. Although very important and critical, there are lots of myths surrounding it and many patients suffering the disease do not know the real facts about it. Today we will make a spotlight on the famous facts and myths about “Frozen shoulder”.
1-	Most of the patients believe they have got frozen shoulder due to a trauma or injury in the shoulder joint, but this is a myth because frozen shoulder can occur after a trauma or even without any trauma as in elderly people especially those who have diabetes and those recovering from an operation. 
     
2-	If you believe that doing exercises worsens your condition, then that is another myth because frozen shoulder occurs to people who stop or decrease using their shoulder joint for a long time. Usually after major operations, having a stroke or bone fracture. They ignore using full range of joint motion to avoid the pain sensation. So an inflammatory response starts leading to the joint stiffness, movement becomes painful and range of movement is limited by time.

3-	An important fact about frozen shoulder is that no surgeries are usually needed. The first treatment that your doctor will suggest is medications such as analgesics and paracetamol. In addition to this, physical therapy is also an important way of treatment to maintain a full range of movement. Cortisone injections are also helpful, these injections can improve everything; decrease swelling, stiffness and pain. Surgery is our last resort if the condition is severe and all the previous lines of treatment failed.


4-	If you believe that you can easily prevent frozen shoulder, then of course you are right. You can never have a frozen shoulder if you followed these advices:

-	If you had a surgery or an injury, you should keep moving your shoulder joint within a limit even if it is painful.

-	Having physical therapy after a surgery or trauma is crucial. Physical therapy returns your body to its previous healthy condition before trauma. If not done, healing is not fully completed and the joint remains painful. Therefore, further avoidance of movement occurs and leads to frozen shoulder.

-	Physiotherapy is not only about exercises, some physiotherapy techniques can decrease your pain and suffering.

Introduction

The aim of this report is to inform an international organisation how our town takes care of the environment as well as what do people do with their rubbish and how the town is trying to keep the area clean and attractive.

What people do with their rubbish

Nowadays young children are well informed about the dynamics and the complexity about the pollution cycle. However, it is estimated that at least 70% of young kids do not take care of their personal rubbish and are the main contributors to a polluted environment. 
Besides the fact that adults were not as well taught as children in school, they are the most civilized and responsible. A study shows that adults take care of their personal garbage not just because of their education but because of their anxiety to show their kids that they are a great and responsible parents.

How the town tries to keep the area clean

According to our mayor, there are several points that our town really cares about to always keep our area as clean as possible. Every year we nominate a person that is responsible for supervising the dustman's work every single day. 
As far as I am concerned there are now a few rules in our town legislation that if you do not take care of your garbage or if you take papers to the floor you will have to pay a fine. This fine can reach between 100 and 150 euros.

Conclusion

To conclude this report, there are many things that still need to be done. However, everything starts at the level of education that every human being receives. Unfortunately, there is still a long way to do in terms environment concerns, but some of this solutions suggested by the mayor help us stopping the pollution.

Environmental problems are becoming more and more serious all over the world. There are some kinds of pollution such as garbage and wasted bottles, but some pollution is invisible such as noise and dirty air. Air pollution is the most serious problem among all other kinds of pollution nowadays. They have already had great impact on people’s life. "Air" is one of the necessities to maintain a human being's life. However air pollution affects not only people health but also the whole environmental system. 

China is a big industrial country so there are a great number of factories and trucks. Much dirty air is released every day. Trucks have made the air unhealthy for people to breathe and poisonous gas is given off by a lot of factories. It also makes oxygen lacking but more and more carbon dioxide, the same result as CO2. CO2 can destroy the ozone. If we don't start to face this problem, we will hurt this planet we live in.


Environmental problems that touch us all. Not only the government should make laws to control the situation but also we should do our best not to create more pollution. For Example, if you don't smoke, you won't cause air pollution and you won't damage your health; if you use public transportation, walk more or take bicycle as your transportation, you will not only help reduce the pollution bust also improve your health. Also, planting more trees instead of cutting them to purify our breathing air and reduce air pollution.

While there are many things to appreciate and celebrate about the world in which we live many pressing environmental problems cry out for our attention. To maintain the only earth we live in is now the major issue for us nowadays. It's also our responsibility to protect it and to do our best to prevent it from being polluted.

Alison read the note, smiled, and immediately put on her coat.Was 31st October.She went out to meet her friend from India. They had been writing for two years on the internet. It was dark outside,the weather was windy and the leaves fell from the trees.Alison ran along the nocturnal streets of France.They were to meet on the street Boulevard Arago.When Alison came to she did not see any people.She waited for half an hour but her friend never came.When it was already 10 pm suddenly a car appeared in the dark.Alison felt fear,her heart was beating and she started to run.The car began to chase her.She ran forward but was far from home.Tears flowed down her cheeks,she could not run any longer.Finally, she saw the lights of the approaching car and ran toward the car.The car stopped quickly and her friend stepped out of the car.They embraced and Alison thanked him for saving her.

Should boys and girls go to the same school?

Many parents face a dilemma when choosing the type of education they wish to give to their children and one of the first decisions they must take is what type of school they would like their children to attend and whether it should be a single sex school or a mixed sex one.

It cannot escape our minds that at this stage and age, children are exposed to sexual images from a very early age and some people would argue that our society is hyper sexualised, which is a reason why many parents see single sex schools as a means to protect their offspring from having sexual thoughts before they are ready to understand the complexity of sex and sexual relationships. 

While the hyper sexualisation of our society may be a reality that many parents would want to protect their children from, it is true to say that children need to adapt and be ready for the society in which they live and for may parents, sending their children to a mixed sex school is just a natural environment, much more similar to the “outside world” in which they would grow to adulthood.

Considering how much time children spend at school, it appears to me that choosing a single sex school will make the child, somehow, segregated and in many cases, reinforce some of the may stereotypes that we, as society, have regarding gender which , if we take into consideration that these children are going to be the future leaders, educators, lawyers, politicians and so on, I would argue that the more schools reflect our society and the way that we like it to be, the better, not only for the child as a person, but the child as a key in the future of the country and, as an extent, to the world. Therefore and to sum up,  Is my view, that public money is better spent supporting mix sex schools, which reflects the society we live in, as opposed to single sex´ which may reinforce those stereotypes that are mining society.

I absolutely agree with this statement. Travelling by car is not only much more convenient than public transport, it also grants one's independence to go wherever and whenever one might wish. Moreover, driving grants motorists one of the most popular feelings in Western societies: the feeling of being free.
Even if it is true that many citizens use public transport when their finances are tight, it is also true that most of those same people would use their private cars instead if given the chance.
The car industry could also be considered one of the main driving engines of the Western economy. It is difficult to imagine what the future would hold for the European economies if the car industry collapsed. Thousands would lose their jobs, both directly in the car factories and indirectly in many other car-related businesses, like car part stores, petrol stations, garages, and so on. If private transport was fully replaced by public transport, the world's economic foundations would shake and a global financial crisis of unprecedented impact could occur. 
It is true that cars pollute the atmosphere, but it is also true that the emissions from public transport also contribute to pollution - some would say that even more than private transport, as Diesel motors are particularly dirtier and more inefficient than smaller, petrol driven motors like those of private cars.
All things considered we might conclude that public transport will eventually disappear in the short term and in no time everyone will be driving their own clean-energy-driven flying cars to go everywhere.

edits: of human genetic engineering outweigh the drawbacks
text:
Recently, genetic engineering has become a highly controversial  issue around the world. Many people think that genetic engineering has many drawbacks. However, others claim that it is vital for societies and next generations.

Genetic engineering is the process of manipulating the genes of an organism. According to supporters of it, there are many benefits of genetic engineering. As it is known, it is used to produce crops that are more resistant to insects and diseases. Besides, some genetically modified crops grow more quickly. Supporters also claim that, it is vital for some countries which are struggling with famine. The other benefit is about human life. With  genetic engineering, human health has become better in many ways. For instance, it may be used by scientists to cure some diseases. Genes could be changed before a baby is born thus, inherited illnesses would no longer exist. It could also be possible to clone human organs so that we could have a chance to replace our damaged body parts. 

In spite of the benefits, there are also certain drawbacks of human genetic engineering. There are many ethical concerns about human genetic engineering. It is still unacceptable in most cultures because of their religious beliefs. They believe that it is unnatural. Another problem is the genetically modified food products. Although they look  bigger or more attractive, genetically modified food products are unhealthy for people.

In conclusion, it seems the benefits outweigh the drawbacks of human genetic engineering . Therefore, genetic engineering is important for humanity and the future.

Charles Dickens and the Brönte sisters were famous Victorian writers. Not only did they share a clear interest in writing about social issues that struck the contemporary life in Britain, but they also had similar ways of structuring their novels. For example, in Dickens' "David Copperfield" and Charlotte Brönte's "Jane Eyre", the story is told by their respective protagonists who remember their own past experiences. In both novels the writers also dealt with the mistreatment of children in workhouses ("David Copperfield") and Boarding Schools ("Jane Eyre").
Although they may share these themes,  their ways of writing are quite different.In the Brönte sisters' works, we can find some Gothic elements - especially in Emily's only novel "Wuthering Heights"- and a detachment from the figure of the Victorian dutiful woman. In Dickens' novels Realism allows the readers to know how tough London society was in that period.

Michael, my never-ending love story, was walking down the street one night with no particular thoughts in his mind. It was a narrow street lined up by two-story buildings on the floor of which shops,pubs were flashing their neon signs. People were coming in or out of the pubs,some walking straight,others on all fours, cheerful anyway. 
Michael couldn't bring himself to enter one, too proud to admit he needed people's company after a long year of being a single guy because he , on the spur of the moment, decided to  split up with me.How could this have happened to him? What he didn't know,or just couldn't accept, was he was unwilling to tolerate other people's views,and jokes that's why he packed my things and asked me to find another place to stay. The reason? I told him I found a job in another city and I was considering moving house. Due to the ever-increasing population coupled with the climate change, food shortage has become a significant facing by many countries. Some assert that genetically modified technology can be applied to address this problem. This essay will argue that genetically modified food can be the way out of the problem of food deficit and this will be done by focusing on its environmental benefits and increasing food yield.

Firstly, GM food can have a positive impact on the problem of food safety. It is well known that the GM food is inserted with various resistance genes, such as pest disease resistance gene. This means that the food being more resistant to pests and agricultural diseases can minimise the use of chemical pesticides and fertilizers that can poison the water supply and pollute the environment. This reduction in the application of chemical materials can create a safer agricultural environment, ensuring food safety.

Furthermore, GM food can also improve the production of crops. Due to the various new traits resulting from the GM technology, such as drought tolerance and salinity tolerance, GM food can ensure the food production in the period of drought. This could be important for food production, especially in developing countries. However, some may argue that it is also questionable whether GM food has a detrimental impact on human health. Actually, thousands of tests on GM food, before bring it into markets, have been proven that it is harmless to both the environment and human health.

In conclusion, it is evident that GM food can increase food yields with the less use of chemicals. In views of this, it is reasonable to believe that GM food might be an ideal strategy to alleviate the problem of food shortage. However, because there are some disadvantages in GM technology which is being developed, it is also recommended that governments should give more importance to the management of GM food.

An elderly university professor had to give his students the last lesson of his professional life, because he was going to retire. However, only a few students, just five or six, had followed his course and, recently, only two of them had been present.
As soon as the professor entered the classroom, he was surprised to see that it was completely full. He thought that many students had decided to follow his last lesson and he was pleased and moved by this kindness.
There was very little light in the classroom because it had been a rainy afternoon and a terrible thunderstorm had caused an electrical blackout.
When a student came in, also he was surprised to see so many people inside, but, after a while, he realized what was really happening: dozens of wet raincoats had been left on the chairs by students of another course.
The student didn't have the courage to interrupt his teacher and give him such a strong pain and disillusion: he slunk away while the old professor was still speaking enthusiastically to nobody.

Students Use of Leisure Time
On 3th March 2014, a survey was conducted among 60 students. The purpose of the survey was to discover popular leisure time activities of male and female students. 
The survey was carried out by means of a questionnaire given to the male and female students to complete. It consisted of three parts. The first part of the questionnaire dealt with leisure time activities on holidays. The second section was concerned with time-out activities. The third part touched on the ways of spending free time at home.  
From the table of data, the most significant items are as follows. It has been found in the first section that a large percentage of the male respondents preferred to stay at home on holidays, while 90% of the female students would like to go to the seaside. The male students would gladly go to historical places, while 57% of the girls who filled in the questionnaire weren’t inclined to spend their free time in that way.  
In the second section both the girls and the boys interrogated claimed that they don’t spend their free time going to the theatre or the opera. 53% of the male students never do that; while 50% of the girls stated that they try to go theatres and operas several times a year to expand their horizons. The majority of the male and female respondents enjoy going to nightclubs in their spare time. For example, only 10% percent of the boys never do that and 24% go to nightspots at least one time a week. More than a half of the male students spend their spare time doing sport two and more times a week. Unlike the boys the female respondents usually don’t feel like going in for sport at leisure. In contrast to the male respondents the girls interrogated go to evening classes in their free time. While 53% of the boys never do that. Like the male respondents the girls interrogated go regularly to the cinema. For instance, 47% of the female respondents watch films on a big screen every week.  
In the third part of the questionnaire was found out that the male respondents are similar to the girl respondents in that they both enjoy listening to music at home more than 2 hours a day. In contrast to the girls interrogated who almost never play computer games the majority of the male students gamble for hours at leisure. The female respondents are more fond of reading books that the male ones. 40% of the girls read books several hours a day, while 13% of the male students don’t read in their free time at all. The males who filled in the questionnaire and the females alike spend many hours by surfing the Internet. For example, 53% of the female students are on-line more than 3 hours a day. 
If any conclusions may be drawn from the data, they are as follows. The leisure activities of the male and female students have a lot in common. There is an evident tendency to the decline in the active ways of spending free time. The young people of both sexes prefer to be on-line or playing computer games at leisure. According to the findings, it is clear that nowadays going to nightclubs and cinemas are more popular than going to theatres and operas or visiting historical places. There are therefore a clear need for young people to prefer active and educating leisure time activities to passive ones.

Having used public transport for so many years, as I´ve lived in a big city since I was just a child, I don´t think public transport will disappear. In my opinion many people depend on public transport to get to their place of work, university or school. In terms of money it is much cheaper to travel by bus than to use your own car. If you compare the price of petrol with the price of a bus ticket you can clearly see how much better it is to travel by bus. I enjoy travelling by bus or train, on your journey you can read or just look through the windows. You don't need to get angry or mad if you don't find a parking space, you can just get on/off the bus wherever you like. You can also enjoy the company of those travellers sharing the same transport. Sometimes you can even meet new people on the bus.
However, I must agree that travelling by car can give you more freedomn, you can carry your shopping and pick up other people on the way. Furthermore, you can choose what time you would like to travel and where. But despite all this there will always be people without a car who needs to commute every day so there is a long future for public transport.

As long as people keep accepting this technology for communication, social media sites will also keep proceeding to the next step and affecting the society. In terms of the communication society, they will possibly change the way in which people develop relationship with each other, and consequently, they will create two types of culture: communal and agentic. In the former, people have ability almost equally, and value interpersonal relationship. In contrast, agentic culture stresses the differences between individuals, along with egotism and inequality (Zarbatany, Conley, & Pepper as cited in Okazaki, & Taylor, 2013). These types of culture will oppositely exist in the future as an effect of social media sites.

ARTICLE
There is nothing worse than not be able to communicate with people when you're in a foreign country. It might be such a frustrating sensation that you couldn't want to go back again.

This article deal with the benefits and drawbacks, if there are any, of learning another language.

Speaking for myself, I think that the pros outweigh the cons. On the one hand you'll feel more active and you’ll realise how your brain memory gets better and better. Besides, you’ll understand the native people when you're going on holiday. And furthermore, it’ll be reassuring to get by with your basic necessities in another country.
On the other hand, studying a new language can be a bit daunting at first and you’ll have to keep on track on a daily basis if you want to improve your language skills. This could be a drawback because not all the people are up to the task.

To wrap up the article I’d strongly recommend that young people to learn at least a new foreign language especially if you’re a student. This will give you an advantage in your future career.
