We are living in a digital age. Nowadays almost everyone in the world has contact with computers and the great majority of them have been using the Internet. The Internet has many good points: it’s an infinite source of information and it’s a cheaper and faster way to communicate with other people. The Internet is also a ‘home' for many social networks. One of them, the most famous and the most used, is Facebook.
       We can use Facebook to get in touch with our friends and even to meet new people. Sounds nice and easy, right? However, Facebook, as well as many other social networking sites, has its dark side too. 
       On the one hand, it’s addictive. Internet addiction represents a serious problem in our age. It may lead to inefficiency at school - or workplace - or even sleeping disorders. 
      On the other hand, lots of people using fake accounts are lurking on Facebook. This means you don't know for sure who you’re really talking to. Nowadays, anyone can take a photo from the web and assume it’s theirs. Stalkers, pedophiles, human traffickers, murderers and other criminals; these are just a small part of the threats you can come across on Facebook.
      In conclusion, I think that we can't be safe anywhere anymore - not even online. The best way to keep ourselves safe is to keep our Facebook profiles private. And also, lets not forget that going out with friends from time to time won’t hurt anyone.

The Soviet Union collapse has become one of the defining events in the world’s history. It influenced the further development of post-Soviet countries as well geopolitical situation in the whole world. It has also influenced the international relations not just within post-Soviet area, but also in the entire world, as the period after the collapse of the USSR was marked as crash of bipolar structure of international relations. So long as for fifty years the world lived under the shadow of the Cold War, fearing a fatal confrontation between the US and the Soviet Union, the dissolution of the USSR had a huge resonance not only in the US mass-media but also in the American society.
American press had widely illustrated the revolution in the Baltic States and the tension which has been spread in the Soviet Union after the fall of the Berlin Wall as well as the fall of communist governments within the whole former Soviet Bloc.
The tensions in the Soviet Union came to its peak in August 1991, while Gorbachev was on vacation in the Crimea, a group of right wing military and KGB leaders staged a coup in Moscow. The”New York Times” made a series of publications dedicated to the coup. They were published under the common title “Soviet crisis”. The articles headlined “Soviet crisis” have broadly described the situation in the capital of Russia. On the August 20, “New York Times” published the article which contained the excerpts from the news conference held by Acting President Gennadiy Yanayev and four other members of the State Committee for the State of Emergency .
The American press summing up the era of Gorbachov frequently highlighted his attempts to increase the openness of the Soviet society. Those attempts were considered as one of Gorbachov’s main merits. “The buried secrets of past regimes and the foibles of the present one were exposed to public scrutiny by a press ” – the New York Times wrote. 
The plotters have immediately encountered strong opposition from the leadership of the RSFSR leaders under the guidance of President Boris Yeltsin. Tens of thousands hit the streets in Russia in order to defend the democracy. Decisive actions of Yeltsin have been supported by most world governments and international communities. Boris Yeltsin has gained international acclaim when he occupied the Russian White House and faced down the threats of the coup’s leaders. The coup, due to lack of organization and support by the military forces, failed three days after. The person of Boris Yeltsin has become the most popular one in that time world’s press. Leading articles of the most read newspapers in the States were dedicated to the first Russian president. American newspapers wrote that Boris Yeltsin acquired new status for his defiant stand, also mentioning that the people had knew a little about him . The article of the New York Post “THE SOVIET CRISIS; Yeltsin's Remarks: A 'Reactionary Coup”  refers to the night of 18-19 August 1991 when the legally elected President of the country was removed from power. The author lays the stress on the democratic processes in the country which have acquired broad and irreversible character. Also it shows the disposition of the soviet people towards the changes in the country. “The people of Russia are becoming masters of their destiny. The uncontrolled powers of unconstitutional organs have been considerably limited, and this includes party organs.” 
This coup had a big resonance among the American society; consequently the US mass-media were eager to know the feelings of the US citizens about the situation in the Soviet Union. The US citizen deemed the crisis as a menace for the liberalisation of society; they assumed it as an actual barrier for the expression of people’s will. “In the hearts of many Americans, the cold war finally ended this week ”, the New York Times wrote. The press accentuated that many of Americans dusted off fears left over from the Cold War were harshly reminding that this is still the nuclear age. 
The dissolution of the Communist party has also become one of most popular issues among American mass-media. The reduction of Gorbachov’s role and the growth of the Yeltsin’s haven’t been out of the attention in the US media sources. Russian President Boris Yeltsin proposed a radical restructuring of the Soviet Union that would minimize the role of Mikhail Gorbachev and reduce the USSR to a loose confederation of nine republics. “The Communist Party, which has had control for 74 years, is rapidly dissolving  - the Chicago Tribune wrote.
The US mass-media followed the reaction on the crisis inside Communist party closely One of the articles of the Washington post “Soviet Turmoil Shakes Europe's Communists ”tells that Soviet President Mikhail Gorbachev's call for dissolution of the Communist Party Central Committee has called into question the survival of its satellite parties in Western Europe. 
The dissolution of the Communist party was concerned as the one of the features of the Soviet Union collapse. In the Washington Post the editorial remarks that the failure of the Moscow coup has finally broke the influence of the Communist Party over the power structures and the world outlook of Soviet people. As a result, the Soviet Union has been disintegrated along traditional ethnic lines .
The upshot of the matter is that the dissolution of the Soviet Union has caused the formation of the new states and following referendums on their independence. The leaders of Russia, Ukraine and Belarus formally announced the dissolution of the Soviet Union on Dec 8, 1991 and agreed to establish a "Commonwealth of Independent States" instead.
The official collapse of the Soviet Union has occurred in December 1991. On the 25th of December 1991 Gorbachov has officially resigned. The Washington Post has written down: “a spokesman for Russian President Boris Yeltsin said that the Soviet Union will cease to exist by the end of 1991. Soviet President Gorbachev agreed to the dissolution of all Soviet agencies ”. Soviet époque, which had existed for 74 years, came to its end and this paved the way for establishment of new independent republics.

REPORT
"What young people are interested in?"

INTRODUCTION
As requested I interviewed a large number of young people, trying to understand their main interests, especially as regards music, TV programmes and clothes.

MUSIC
Many people aged between fourteen and eighteen said that the most listened music among teenagers is definitely rock music. However, some of them admitted their interest also for pop music and RNB.
Only a few youngsters listen to classical music and love the Opera.

TV PROGRAMMES
The people I interviewed are very keen on reality shows like "Big Brother" and similar but I have to say that many of them are also interested in cooking shows and documentaries.

CLOTHES
Finally,regarding to the clothes,young people declared to prefer casual outfits like jeans, t-shirts etc.
Only a few of them like to wear fashionable clothes.

CONCLUSION
In the whole, I think that young people have now a large variety of interests. Some of them are pretty similar to those we had in the past; others are completely different and very interesting to explore.

This house believes that everyone should be able to speak English.

A world where everybody is able to communicate in the same language - is that pure utopia or may it be a considerable idea? What would the possible advantages and disadvantages of a world wide spoken language be? Establishing English as the new worldwide spoken language might be a favourable example since English is already spoken by more than 300 million native speakers and therefore the third most spoken language in the world, according to Ethnologue. Moreover English is already a universal language used by many people to communicate or  negotiating within the business market. Imagining everyone had the opportunity to learn and therefore communicate with each other in a worldwide spoken language is certainly an appealing idea and would, without doubt, have many benefits.

Firstly, as mentioned before, it would give everyone the opportunity to communicate with everyone. However, the realisation of English as a world language would certainly need an educational basis for everyone which might not be easy to accomplish but it would be possible. While teaching everyone English it would also be profitable to instruct basic knowledge in mathematics, physics or other relevant topics which might be helpful. 
	Such a standardised educational system for every single person on the world would therefore not only benefit the communication or existing businesses but also help third-world countries to start companies, trade and industrialise their countries so they can take care of themselves and emerge out of poverty.

Moreover, the standardised educational system would also need people who teach and instruct others so the world language will be established everywhere. In order to accomplish this endowment there would be a necessity of teachers which leads to many new job opportunities. After all, a couple of professions might become extinct, for example translators, but, therefore, the organisation and execution of this big project would  provide a range of other jobs which can make up for the ones lost. 
	The educational system would also provide a valuable basis for the world of politics so conflicts might be prevented due to the lost language barrier with its vulnerability and risks of misunderstandings. In addition, civil wars or catastrophes like the Arab spring might also be avoided since there will be an educational standard which could teach different ways of political leadership. 

However, this great improvement still holds a few weaknesses. On the one hand there would be a great loss of cultures and in some cases the implementation of the educational system might be impossible, for instance the aboriginal people. Anyway,, those tribes would not even need or want an education or a world language because it is their way of life to live in groups together with the nature and disturbing these cultural groups would simply be unnecessary.
	On the other hand the suggestion of English as the world wide spoken language might be up against much criticism since the United States do not have many supporters everywhere. Nevertheless, English was just a suggestion and other languages like Spanish or Chinese could certainly be used as well.

Nowadays, more and more people are learning how to drive, as driving one's own car is, as everyone knows, much more convenient than taking public transport. The future that lies ahead for public transport seems to be a bleak one. But is it really the case? Is it really that the end of public transport is soon to come?

I hold an opposite view; my answer is "no", for sure.

Without doubt, having our own car provides us with great convenience. However, we should not overlook the fact that not everyone can afford a car. Some people may argue that we can buy a second-hand car if we can't afford a brand new one. Yes, they are right in saying so and in fact, many people are second-hand car owners. But they seem to have forgotten the extra cost incurred by maintenance and repair, and, of course, buying petroleum. The cost of having a car is hence not as cheap as we think if we also take into account those avoidable extra cost. Under this circumstance, some people may rather take public transport to save money for their "dream house" rather than buying a car. Not to mention that there are tourists in Hong Kong, who have no choice but to use public transport. It is clearly seen that there is still much room for survival for public transport. 

Secondly, even people have cars, they may also take public transport. As we all know, Hong Kong is famous for scarcity of land, there are not many parking spaces available, so employees may not be granted an official parking space by their company are hence may resort to public transport if they want to avoid the fees of using the parking lot. Having scarce land is not the sole problem in Hong Kong. Hong Kong is also famous for its heavy traffic, which implies the problem of traffic congestion. By taking MTR, one can save all the hassles of wasting precious time being stuck in a traffic jam. Besides saving time, taking public transport can also help reduce the emission of greenhouse gases. Greenhouse gases have already posed grave threat to humans, e.g. global warming and ozone depletion, which raised people's environmental awareness. People are becoming more and more aware of the importance of environmental protection and want to contribute to saving our Earth. In this regard, they may take public transport instead of driving their own car even if they have one. Hence, contrary to many people perceive, there should be an increasing demand, i.e. a rosy future, for public transport. 
 
From the reasons mentioned above, it is obvious that the doomsday of public transport is definitely not something down the line. But how about the future further far away? Maybe. Like our ancestors would have never imagined that we can now fly in the sky by plane. Technological advancement is, after all, always something that drops us a bombshell, so rapid that we can never predict how far it can go. Maybe one day we need no cars, or public transport. Simply by thinking of a specific location, we can go there in a split second. Who knows?

Hi Harry

It's good to know that you'll be in the shop next Saturday while I'm away in Lugo. There's not much work you have to do on a normal day, but maybe this will be a special one, because of the match between Celta and Real Madrid that is going to be celebrated half a kilometre away.

First, you need to know how to open the establishment. I asked for my right-hand employee David to come earlier due to your arrival. He'll be in front of the place at 8.30, just 15 minutes earlier than we open the doors. The problem is David's shift ends at 14:00, so he won't be with you in the evening, when we usually lock up at 20:00. Once you close it, it would be great if you could let the keys in David's house, which is in the same building.

There is about 14 workers in the shop, divided in 2 groups with different schedule each one. They have similar skills and productivity, but, honestly, I prefer working with the morning one. I don't think you'll have any problem with both groups. 

If there is any problem with the cash registrer (very common, actually), you have a phone number under it of a good technician. The bill will be assumed by us.

Write back soon and let me know if you have any concern.

All the best

Alberte

Change frequently creates a great deal of suspicion and mistrust in us.  However, it is one of the most motivating challenge in our lives.
To start with, it is an essential feature in our lives. They are in constant adaptation to new events or personal experiences.For example, a close relationship or a serious illness make us look at the world around us through different eyes, and also they let us grow into more interesting and nicer human beings.
Even so, change can be perceived as a disturbing question due to the fact that it provokes a strong feeling of uncertainty. Often, dealing with new situations does not help us to feel comfortable. Furthermore, we sometimes feel scared to face new experience and then we can lose a perfect opportunity to improve ourselves.
In short, I consider that change is always the best way to develop our personality to become better people in any aspect of our lives because it represents a major challenge. It is true that sometimes it is hard to accept certain changes but we can always learn something useful from them.

Hi George!

What's up? Are you ok? I hope you're great!

So, let me see. You said that your flight lands at 10.30 am so it's better if you go to the train station near the airport. 

When you get out of the airport you have to turn right and walk for ten minutes and then the station is right in front of you, it's quite simple my friend! I've just looked the timetable and your train arrives at 11.04 am. Your journey lasts about 40 minutes and you have to get off at the station called Brighton and I will be there!

Get it? 

Oh, the ticket! It's about 6 euro. It's cheap, isn't it?

Then, yes, the weather. It's going to be sunny and warm dude! So, don't worry and take t-shirts and shorts! We're going to have a great time together!

KIT and let me know about your journey!

See you soon,
Mich

Nowadays, there's more to school than sitting quietly at the desk and saving mathematical equations. Classes are being held much more interactive than in the previous years, and also subjects are supposed to prepare pupils for adult life. In the following essay I want to discuss the most useful skills which should be taught in school from an early age on. 

 First of all, it is essential for young people to learn how to take care of themselves, such as knowing how to cook. Fast food has become part of everyday life. In order to prevent the younger generation of our society of consuming it, we should give them the possibility to attend cooking classes. Not only is it an advantage for their health if they're able to create healthy meals, but also does it strengthen relationships among classmates, as they might help and support each other while trying new dishes. Moreover, it is a welcome distraction from the theoretical school routine. 

 However, there's still a more important area to have a good knowledge about – personal finance. Some families may be able to afford money and don't think about its value. Passing this attitude on to their children, they won't be able to save money for emergencies and deal with it reasonably, which is a necessity in order to survive. Teachers can take up the role of the parents and giving them a knowledge about finances and the right way to handle it. 

 To conclude, there are a lot of things worth considering to teach in school. The two most useful, in my opinion, are cooking classes and personal finance. Both of them are skills which help managing your life later on, finances in particular.

Jake is a free lance. He uses to travel from place to place following the most burning news around the world.
As a free lance, he has to invest in his ideas, hoping that someone will like his stories and buy them. 
To fly in different continents is nowadays easy but still expensive. Therefore, Jake tries to arrange his stays with one goal in mind: travelling in a comfortable way but saving as much as possible.

A few months ago month he had been spending two weeks in Brussels. He was following an important European summint on environmental issues. 
Brussels, Europe's capital, made his stay very pleasant. Jake was able to enjoy its multicultural environment and its great cultural initiatives. He could easily move from place to place at very convenient prices. Access to sevreal public transport services (such as underground, buses, tram, etc.) let him reach his working meeting always on time. He also had the chance to know more about the diverse atmosphere characterizing each and every Brussels' suburb. During winter Brussels might be quite cold.However,metros and buses are equipped with such a powerful heating systems that you forget about the cold.

A few weeks later, Jake had to travel to the South of Italy to follow the case of immigrants reaching the coasts of Europe via sea from Africa and the Middle-East. He was so excited about that trip. Italy is his parents' country of origin and it was the first time for him to visit Italy. He was able to reach the South by a connection flight from Rome. It was spring, the prefect time to go and visit South of Italy. Nevertheless, his stay was not as pleasant as he had thought. Jake's main challenge was to move around and reach the places he had planned to visit both for his research and for tourist purposes. He soon came to realise how disorganised public transport is in the South of Italy. Its inhabitants move around exclusively on their own cars. Towns are congested by traffic jam, especially during rush hours. He was surprised by the poor quality of the air when walking around. The air was polluted by smog due to the huge number of cars. Jake could only move around by using the few expensive taxis available.

Such experience made Jake realise the considerable impact that a good public transport system has on people's life and their surrouding. In particular, an efficient public transport impacts on:
Stress - it makes your life easier since you avoid driving in the middle of traffic jam
Communications - it eases movements from place to place
Environment - it reduces cars on the roads, therefore air is less polluted
Your own and your community's pockets!? - access to public transport is way cheaper than taking care of your own car; though initially it might look like a huge disbursment of money from the community, in the long term it shows to be the most efficient way to travel!

Seville is well known for its stunning monuments. Although, I have been struck by its major draws such as Plaza De Espana, Real Alcazar and El Torre del Oro, this is the relaxed and social way of living which has most impressed me. Therefore, it all comes down in this writing to expressing feelings about Seville and its surrounding.

First and foremost, it is difficult to feel deep emotions when it comes to living in a place without real social contact. Therefore, I miss my close-knit family and friends. I’m having a very nice time in Seville though. In fact, the more I know about its organization and its people, the more I feel at ease in Seville. It is almost as if I were at home now. I must well admit this has not always been so. To be honest, I was not very attracted by the spirit of the city at the very beginning of my stay. In my opinion, Seville was rather disorganized and not very charming and its citizens rather rude. Consequently, what are the reasons of my change of heart?

In my view, getting to know a city is quite similar to getting to know people. The more I understand it the more I like it. Of course, it may happen at times that I dislike what I discover! Luckily, this has not been the case so when it comes to Seville. This is partly due to the fact I have picked up a few words which enable me to interact more easily with its citizens. For example, people start to talk with me when they notice I make efforts to speak in their language. There are even some smiles and laughs, which is very reassuring for someone who is alone abroad. 

What’s more, Seville is bright, colourful and lively which cheers me up and relaxes me. For instance, I spent some time last night eating tapas on a small street in a laid-back atmosphere. I was surrounded by joyful Spaniards who were speaking loudly. Needless to say, I greatly enjoyed this time as it made me feel as if I were part of their life and of the place. To make matters even better, there was some music played a few meters ahead, which contributed to liven up the spirit of everyone present there.
 
In addition to this, I really like sharing tapas dishes with people, drinking a good fresh “draft beer” and going for a “tapas crawl” with friends as in Switzerland each one gets its own dish when eating out and only go for a “pub crawl”.

I am also keen on wandering off at my own pace and getting lost on the winding narrow cobbled streets as I feel like an adventurer looking for new treasures. Some of these are striking secluded places such churches or Moorish-styled houses. Thus, scouring Seville is like rewinding the time and being propelled in the past. 
  
On account of all this, it is easy to understand why my perception of Seville has significantly changed over time. As far as I’m concerned, the city is no longer a museum displaying sumptuous and ostentatious monuments. It turns out to be now a very welcoming and relaxing place where warm-hearted people live and where I greatly enjoy spending some time.

WHAT AN AMAZING COINCIDENCE!

Have you ever witnessed the collapse of a myth and the birth of a new star at the same time?
This year, in Italy, for the first time in more than 200 years, it happened a weird coincidence: the political leader Silvio Berlusconi and the singer Ligabue marked their careers on the same day.
On the one hand, Berlusconi compromised his position when some journalists told the world some wiretappings of his which would compromise his future political career; on the other, Luciano Ligabue won the award for the best song of the year, bringing his career ever forward.
Unbelievable as it may seem, this is really a bizarre coincidence.

Dear Jo,
It's great to get some news from you. What a lucky man you are to have a year free!
If I had also a year free, I would only prefer travelling not working.
Switzerland is really a great place for travelling. You should plan two different periods to visit sightseeing places, one in summer and the other one in winter. Famous sightseeing places are really different during winter and summer.
If you decide to ground in Geneva, I suggest you to visit first the north of Switzerland from the west to the east and then the south of Switzerland from the east to the west.
Switzerland is a small country also take your time and spend enough time in each place.
Concerning your inquiry on working in my country, it's really difficult to get an authorisation to work, especially for periods longer than a week.
Therefore, I suggest you to work during your travelling time. 
For instance if you plan to stay more than one week in Zermat in Wallis, think to try to find a place where you could help in a restaurant or a shop.
But if you prefer to work during a full three-month period, you should ask your employer a work permit.
In any case, don't hesitate to visit me and my family in Lausanne.
I look forward to seeing you during your trip.

Peter looked at his watch and knew that he had to do something immediately. Twenty minutes had passed, but Sarah was still inside the house. He started to bite his nails, restless. She said that she would go out in five minutes. What if she was in trouble? What if the owner of the house has caught her? Five more minutes went by, and he decided to get into the bungalow. 
 He climbed the tree clumsily and managed to enter through the open window. It was a dark night, so he could barely see.  
—There is no need for you to climb through the window, like a thief—said a soft voice. 
The shock made Peter gasp. Before him there was a tall, dark woman in black. He hadn’t seen her when he had gone into the room. His eyes were adjusted to the darkness now, so he could recognize her.  
--Tris.
Tris’ smile became bigger.
—It has been a long time, Peter. May I ask you why you are breaking into my house instead of knocking at the door? How rude of you!
There was no anger in her voice, but amusement and something else that Peter could not distinguish. 
—Where is Sarah? She must be here. 
Tris’s smile faded away. 
— You are the only person that came here in the last five hours, Peter. Unless...
The silence that followed her words was oppressive. They both know what would happen if Tris's husband found out a stranger in his house. 
— I must find her before he does it. Please, help me find her. She could be in danger.
Tris sighed. 
--Sorry, my friend, but I’m not gonna face my husband again. This time, you are on your own.

First of all, the public transport is obsolete. Take a look at the highways near the big cities. They are full of cars each and every day. If there were a future for public transport, that wouldn't happen.

Travelling by car gives you independence. You are not tied to the timetable of the public transport. You can choose when you would like to go. You can also choose where you would like to go. Finally you can choose who would travel with you. Those are great advantages everyone can see.

Right now we have a problem: the oil reserves are depleting. That is going to happen sooner rather than later. It could seem to point towards public transport, nevertheless it will push car travelling even further. The reason is that, once we are free from our oil shackles, we will say farewell to most of its problems. There will be no more greenhouse gasses, you can forget about escalating gas prices and, finally, you will not remember air pollution.

Last but not least, we are entering a digital era. Computers and smartphones are becoming more prominent in our lives. Why would I travel to a meeting in a different city when I can meet through Skype? I cannot find the reason. It's a waste of time and other resources.

In summary, the public transport is dying. We need to embrace the advances of technology and we will be free of those terrible experiences.

I enjoy watching soap operas on TV and the best one for me is EastEnders.   This TV serial is mainly based on working class people and represents various ethnic minority communities including African and Asian Muslims.  This show is particularly good as it represents how people from different ethnic backgrounds can engage with each other.  It shows that ethnic minority people can integrate with the majority Caucasian people without losing their cultural and traditional values.  

In addition, it provides an opportunity for people from different backgrounds to peep into the culture and traditions of British people.  Although this soap involves a lot of cheating and plotting between characters, it also shows the importance of family values.  I would definitely recommend this drama serial to other people.  It is important to gain awareness about different societies due to the fact that Britain is becoming such a multicultural society.

To travel around the world has always been my dream since I was a little boy.
However, what is the best means of transportation to see the world for yourself?
As far as I am concerned, I would prefer to travel by boat.
A couple of good reasons are behind my choice.
First, to travel by boat is a very relaxing and carefree experience, compared to being confined to a very narrow and limited little space on the seat of a plane.
Second, people on the boats are granted the opportunity to see beautiful ocean lives, while taking a plane doesn't provide this luxury to take a look at the birds in the sky for planes are travelling at such a high speed.
Third, when it comes to travel, what really matters is not your destination. From my perspective, it is the process that is more valuable. 
Therefore, I would choose to lengthen the process of travelling, and a comfortable voyage on the sea would certainly become my first choice, since it guarantees a long and pleasant travelling experience.

I am writing to complain about the suggested bar on smoking in public areas. I work in Café Noir, a well-known restaurant, popular with visitors in the centre of town.
I am very concerned about this proposal, for a number of reasons. Firstly, I do not understand why this is being implemented so quickly and why there has been no discussion - there is no time for anyone to feel comfortable with the idea. Secondly, it is unthinkable to suggest it in outdoor bars and restaurants - such an idea is completely unworkable.
To support my argument against this proposal I would like to explain what happened when the authorities attempted to introduce a ban on smoking in my home town. It was unsuccessful, and the politicians had to reverse their decision. In the first place, few people did know about this law, and, of course, most business opposed the idea. A non-smoking policy was introduced by some restaurants; the consequences were terrible: a large number of their customers vanished. If this happened in café Noir, probably I could lose my job.
In my opinion, introducing specific non-smoking areas in this type of establishments could be an excellent idea. This would appear to be a better solution.

edits: something I'm naturally good at now
text:
Dear Margaret,
Firstly, thank you for answering and don’t worry about the delayed reply!
Secondly, I’d like to tell you some things about myself as well. It’s not easy for me to talk about myself, but I’ll give my best.
I’ve been living in Augsburg for nearly two years now and am studying B.A. Anglistik and economics. Before moving to Augsburg, I studied biology for two semesters in Erlangen, but soon noticed that it wasn’t the right subject of study for me. So I switched and I’m happy to say that it was the right decision! Biology is still a hobby of mine, but I’ve always been good with languages and so I’m doing now something I’m naturally good at. 
I can speak English and of course German – and because my grandparents are from Korea, a little Korean, too. I am the only grandchild that can’t speak Korean properly because I grew up in Bavaria and not in NRW, but they taught me to cook. It started when I was a little child, and it’s what I do. When I’m stressed or trying to postpone things like studying or cleaning the flat, I cook. Sharing my flat with two boys is amusing most of the time, but when it’s about cleaning… oh my! The good thing is: the rest of the time living with boys is as uncomplicated as it gets. And we’re a pretty good team because all of my cooking led to many evenings spent together in our kitchen. 
My other big hobby is travelling. I’ve been to Jamaica, Morocco, the Maldives and Curacao. Also I visited the USA multiple times: I travelled the west coast from San Diego to San Francisco, I’ve been to Las Vegas, Chicago and Boston. In less than two weeks, I’m going to fly to New York City. I’m so excited! 
So, now you have a rough summary of me. 
I’m looking forward to working with you and wish you all the best until then!
See you soon,
Sarah

Dear Sir/Madam,

I am writing in response to your advertisement in a magazine. I would like to apply for a vacancy as a Camp Assistant.

I am a 23-year-old student in a Sports Science degree, so I am interested in sports. Besides, I am open-minded, easy going and friendly. I have experience in children Summer camps and recently I attended a First Aid course, so I could deal with a difficult situation.

I am a native speaker of Spanish and I have passed the First Certificate exam of Cambridge, so my English level is quite good. Furthermore, I speak a little French.

I have no problem in being hired for three months because I do not go to the university in Summer. 

You will find attached two references written by the two directors of the camps where I have worked. You could ask them about me and they would answer you immediately.  

I look forward to receiving your reply.

Yours faithfully,

Aureli Bonilla

There is no sport like football. It is an activity that requires many people, which improves your social skills and your overall ability to manage a group. It demands physical effort, being and excellent way to keep fit. It involves many moral virtues, which makes football one of the best activities for teenagers.

Starting with the social skills, it is obvious that a football match is a dispute, a game we involve in with the intention to win. This kind of action, when peformed collectively, requires coordenation of efforts and abitity to work together, two qualities that are frequently forgotten in our individualistic world. If you play footbal, you know how to act when in a team.

Moreover, footbal is a physical game. Unlike chess or bridge, football makes you leap, run, kick. In times of escalators and cars, it is refreshing to find an activity that involves movement, velocity and strenght. And if you do decide to take it seriously, this sport will put you through workouts and sustained practices that are going to make you really fit.

Finally, football involves relationships in moments of tension, and this is the natural context for virtues like justice, courage and honesty. In fact, it can be argued that the human virtues are a by-product of conflicts and fights; that they are that traces of character that we aknowledge as important for everybody engaged in a competition, be it for a trophy or for a country. It is a sport that develops no only the body, but also the mind and the heart.

If you want to try it, you should find a club near you. It is easy, because football is one of the most popular sports in the western world. In a club you will find professional advice and also as many peopole as it is necessary for a match. In fact, if football has a downside, it is this, the fact that you need twenty-two people to set a match. But, provided that, you will have one of the best ninety minutes of your entire life.

I have a strong belief that being multilingual is essential for working in the financial industry and Mandarin is an important language for working in Asia-Pacific countries.  To further improve my Chinese, I enrolled for the Post-Intermediate Mandarin class during my undergraduate study, in which I achieved a First-Class result. Beyond my academic disciplines, I have consistently taken up some active roles at university and outside school to further develop my interpersonal and leadership skills. I was trained as a PASS (Peer Assisted Study Session) leader for econometrics to provide some academic support to some younger students at my final year of study at Manchester. I attended trainings and workshops to learn about the skills to be a good facilitator before the start of the academic year. Besides, I have undertaken an internship at the HSBC Risk in order to gain an insight into the banking industry and learn how to work with my peers in a business environment. A Real Vacation and A Dream Vacation
  To me, a vacation is a specific trip or journey for recreation or tourism. And I usually spend my vacation with my family during school break. However, there are two kinds of vacation, a real vacation and a dream vacation.
  One summer vacation, I went on a trip to Paris with my family. It was a 10-day trip. And we had booked all our hotels in advance. It seemed to be a dream vacation. But it turned out to be totally different when I arrived there. It was in the afternoon when we arrived. When I walked out the airport, I was attracted by the beautiful scenery. The streets, the cafés and the people formed a beautiful picture. At night, I expected to have a romantic French dinner at a posh restaurant. But no, instead of sitting in a restaurant, my mum took us to a supermarket to get some sandwiches for dinner. In the next following days, we mostly had bread and sandwiches for our meals. And we had only water when we were thirsty. During these 10 days, we walked a lot instead of catching a bus, because it saved money too. But it made my legs sore every night. This is kind of the real vacation for me. Even though I was in a romantic city, I couldn't enjoy my vacation in a romantic way due to the low budgets we had. 
  To me, a dream vacation is like going to a beautiful island like Palau, where I can enjoy the sunshine and the sea. And I would like to go there with my boyfriend. When I am there, I would start my day by calling room service for a wonderful breakfast in bed. After, I would head to the sandy beach and relax in the sun, feeling the breeze. As the day goes on, I would also go swimming in the deep blue sea, go snorkeling or just lie on the beach. Lying on the beach is very relaxing and it is the perfect thing to do on vacation. Once the sun goes down, I would hit the bars to have some drinks and enjoy the nightlife. And I would always have my meals at some luxurious restaurants. This is the kind of dream vacation I want so bad. Vacations should be relaxing, not tiring.
  There are always the differences between a real vacation and a dream vacation. And it is all on account of the budgets we have. Once I have enough money, I will have my dream vacations come true. From now on, I will save my money to turn all my vacations into my dream vacations.

When I finished the high school, I started working as accountant in my father’s carpentry. He produces doors and windows on wood. 
At the beginning it was really difficult to me because I was a little shy with customers and I wasn’t used to working among noisy machinery and shouting workers, but after a while time I learned to ignore all of that!
Very soon I realized that this job wasn’t for me. I was working in a very small country and my office was isolated, so I didn’t have any contact with other people and my job started to get boring. 
It took me 12 years to get the courage to quit because it was my family company and I felt really sorry, but I had to grow up and improve my professional skills, so I began to look for a new job.
When I received an email from a company based in the centre of Milan, I was really excited! 
My father was happy because it was a great opportunity and understood that it was what I’ve been dreaming for a long time.
Five years have passed and I’m still working for this company which has given me a lot and I’ve been learning many things about accounting. In fact I am administrative manager and I feel really proud of myself.
I meet lots of people every day and I have the chance to talk to smart people.
Last but not least I’m a great fashion expert because I work near the shopping streets!

There has never been a bigger force for change than technology, it changes absolutely everything about the way we live, even the way we talk with each other. Despite the rise of social media, the idea of community has changed radically, because people are sharing interests everywhere on the planet. Social Media such as Twitter, Facebook, Youtube and blogs illustrate surely that the definition or repercussion of digital technologies is created through the forms in which they are worn and the social relations and associations that expand around them. This essay will discuss the implications of social media for everyday life, emphasizing the problems which arose with the use of Facebook and Twitter. Finally it will look into possible future implications of this kind of technoogy.

Social networks websites can be explained as a web usefulness that admit people to create a public or semi-public profile, arrange a list of other contacts which is possible to share connection and look and cross their list of connections and those made by others within the system. Namen and Kinnison (2012) indicates that “the three types of social interactions that social networking enables include (1) creaction of an online identity, (2) establishment of relationships between users, and (3) development of layered communities defined by the lists of connections each user establishes”. One of the most popular social networking websites is Facebook. Another rapidly expanding social networking is Twitter. These kinds of websites allows people to interact with others precisely by smartphones or computers. By Twitter, users post opinions or comments narrow to 140 characters. On the other hand, on Facebook people can share pictures, vídeos and thoughts without restrictions.

As a result of an appropriate use of social networking tools in education, Javanovic, Chiong and Weise (2012) demonstrate that students adopt Facebook not especially for socialising but also for academic purposes, like to obtain benefit for their studies or to recover time in discovering learning resources (p.39). Furthermore, some departments of police in the USA used Facebook to share a vídeo of a felony with the expectancy to identify the suspects and their followers were apt to say something about the incident in return to the publication. Additionally, a politician from Philadelphia, USA was elected after take advantage of his Twitter account appropriately during his campaign.

Once upon a time there was a majestuous kingdom in England, surrounded by beautiful rivers, waterfalls and mountains. Everyone lived peacefully and harmoniously until one day, at the welcoming ball in honour of the  little princess, a horrendous witch showed up and cursed the little princess named Sophie, who would die at the age of 16 and only a kiss of true love would save her.
Princess Sophie grew up, she was so unhappy because she couldn't do anything, she was condemned to live in a room of the castle until someone could find the cure for her cursed. One day she figured out how to escape through a hidden passage, she got to the town and ran and jump, she did every little thing she wasn't aloud to since so long. While she was having some fun, a handsome boy crashed her and she fall to the ground. As only a gentleman would do, he apologised and introduced himself to the Princess:
- I am so sorry Madam, excuse me for my blunder. I am Michael.
The princess was a little scared of talking to someone she didn't know, because she never got to talk to anyone before, but still she answer him with a big smile-You are excused, my name is Sophie.- It truly was love at first sight. Michael asked her to go with him for an ice cream so he could amend his fault.
Sophie accepted and they started a strong friendship that through the time became in more than just a friendship, they fall in love for each other. 
Princess Sophie used to escape so she could meet with Michael, until one day, when she was  just about to meet Michael to confess him all the truth about who she really was, a guards discovered her and the King commanded to lock her up in her room.
Michael was disappointed because he thought that Princes Sophie didn't love him anymore. Princess Sophie send him a lot of letters telling him the truth about her, and about her cursed. But after Michael read the first letter, and found out that Sophie was a princess, he thought he was just a game for her.
He didn't want to read the next letters, in which Princess Sophie said he was the love of her life and also wrote about the curse. Michael decided to leave the kingdom, when he was just about to close the door he turned back to his coffee table and saw the letters, he had a hunch but he ignored it.
Michael closed the door and knew at that moment he has made a mistake.

I believe that saying that there is no future for public transport given that travelling by car is so much more convenient, is premature. We need to consider a lot of factors before we can make a judgement of this kind. What happens in future will be decided by what happens now. We have already heard about how pollution is killing our planet earth, gradually. People are advised to carpool and travel to work places. Several announcements over radio and  TV emphasize the need to use the public transport system for travelling to save nature. Yet, not many pay heed to the message. People may choose to ignore the advice now but in future they may not have a choice.

It is only a matter of time before we reach a tipping point with respect to the limited natural resources that we have. Then we may have no choice but to use public transport as much as we can for travel.

One of the latest film I have seen is Silver Linings Playbook, played by Bradley Cooper and Jennifer Lawrence.  It's a comedy with romantic features and at the same time very realistic. There are family problems, football madness, romantic obsessions and mental illnesses. 

The plot is about a young man (Bradley Cooper) who has just been  discharged from a psychiatric hospital  and has moved  to his parents home. He was accused of mistreating his wife and that is the reason why they had been separated for  the last eight months. The problem is that he has an obsession: he wants  to get back with his wife although  he can't talk to her as the police have forbidden him.  His neighbour is a young woman ( Jennifer Lawrence) who has been widowed for 2 years. She has  a turbulent and complicated past. They meet   by chance and started a  tortuous relationship  as  friends.  Interestingly, they find the way to help each other and not surprisingly  finally they fall in love. 

I personally think that the film transmit an interesting view  of the psychiatric illnesses and the importance of the family in this type of problems. I strongly recommend you to go and see the film .

Introduction
The aim of this report is to present young people's interests in my country. It gives information about their tastes in music, TV programmes and clothes.
Music
A revival of rock music has been seen in the past 10-15 years. So, naturally, about half of the teenagers and young adults prefer rock and roll, hard rock and progressive rock to other genres. They enjoy both local bands' production and some foreign songs. About one third of the rest would claim they listen mainly to pop folk, whereas the rest would be interested in R&B, soul and jazz.
Television
Although not many young people like spending their free time watching TV, I believe that some patterns of preference can still be recognized. Except classics like Friends, popular shows include How I Met Your Mother, The Big Bang and the new HBO talk show Last Week Tonight. I can say with high certainty that reality TV is no more in with young people in my country.
Clothes
Most teens tend to create their unique style, often managing to start a fashion of their own. Designer clothes are not what they look for anymore. 
Conclusion
This information can help the organizers of next year's festival in choosing appropriate music and catering to a variety of tastes.

Dear Sir or Madam,
I would like to express my total dissatisfaction with your latest measures.

You changed the time of the Japanese lessons from the evening to the afternoon, when I am actually at work. So if I want to come to the lesson, I have to postpone all my projects to a later time.
Furthermore you will increase the course fee by 15% from next month.

I have to say, I am really upset about these changes. In the future, you do not provide the Japanese course at convenient time. So you will provide a worse service for more money from next month.

I am very sorry but I cannot  accept this! If you do not change your policies or give me a personal discount, I will leave your school.

I would appreciate it if you took these possibilities into consideration.

I expect a quick response from you.

Yours faithfully 
Vivien Alberta

Recently I watched a film called "The Sixth Sense", and I'd totally recommend it to anyone older than 13.
The movie is set in the United States around the 1990's, so we could say the film is technically modern, though I'm sure that in some years it will be considered a classic.
It's about the story of a little boy that is haunted by a big secret, he is visited by ghosts.
His mother doesn't know about this, but she is worried about him. So she decides to take him to a child psychologist.
The boy soon becomes friends with the psychologist, and he started noticing plenty of things about this exceptional boy.
I'm not normally keen on thrillers, but this is definitely a must watch.
The boy's acting is really something, such a thing that his acting earned him a nomination for the Academy Awards.
I found this movie both exciting and emocional, both thumbs up for me!

Funding proposal

As the secretary of the English Language club i am writing to propose that our club be given funding for the coming year.

Outline of the club activity

The Club has many social and cultural programs. We regulary organise film projections and discussions around a subject related to the film. We also invite guest speakers and organise fun events.

Benefits for the students

Many students gain a great deal from our activities. For example, with every film seen our students have the chance to practice their language and to develop their own opinions, particularly as we always have discussions aroud a subject related to the film. Also our monthly speakers are exellent, for example, last year we invited a well-known actrice, Janet Hewitt, to share some of her experience on Broadway. Unfortunalety, organising this kind of events is costly and the money from membership fees is not enough.

Benefits for the college

We also believe the college benefits from our Club. Being founded in 1920 by our well-known alimni, John Carter, the English Language Club is the oldest club in our college. The fact that everyone from the community cand participate at our events is helping us to develop a positive relation between the college and the community.

We hope you will be ablte to take all thisinto account and will find it possible to help us continue and improve our club by funding us.

In my opinion, shopping is not always enjoyable. What's more, shopping is almost always unenjoyable. I just hate it. The whole process is arduous and nerve-wracking. I am a homebody type. Every time, when something compels me to leave my "castle", I feel under the weather. Especially, when it comes to go shopping. It just winds me up. 
Shopping centres are located in the city centres, so every road trip lasts ages (I live in a suburb). Thusly, when I get to the mall, I am already bent out of shape. Afterwards the crowd of people is ramming me, when I'm trying to walk. The lightning in shops is obnoxious. My eyes instantaneously start to hurt. I'm not able to find any nice gears. Although, if I find something cute, it won't fit.  And the worst thing - the queues. I hate them wholeheartedly. At the end I'm livid and exhausted. 
Thank goodness we live in the internet age and I can do shopping without leaving my bed.

1. The author compares Easter to a pagan spring festival, because they are associated with happiness. The way Easter and specifically Good Friday is celebrated is gradually deprived of religious content. People don't want to to contemplate Christ's suffering, but they want to move directly to the cheerful part of Easter celebration, so to Easter Sunday. 
2. According to the author, people "flinch from consideration of Good Friday" due to three taboos connected with this day:self-sacrifice, suffering and death. The way self-sacrifice is seen has changed enormously - we no longer want to sacrifice ourselves, because it's unpopular and it is in contradiction with the idea of consumerism. What is more, we are becoming indifferent to other people's suffering and that's why we aren't willing to think about it, even on Good Friday. Suffering as well as death is pushed away from our real life - we don't want to experience them but rather watch it on different kinds of TV shows.  
3. L'Oreal slogan "Because you're worth it" proves the author's thinking that we are unwilling to sacrifice ourselves. In a consumptive lifestyle  we want more and more for ourselves, but not for other people, because it will require self-sacrifice.

Peter looked at his watch and knew that he had to do something immediately. 

It was a hot summer day, everyone was walking to their usual destination; work, school, buy some groceries, pick up the laundry or their clothes at the cleanners, everyone except Peter. He was sweating, looking at people in a confusing way.

"Don´t they know what is happening?"  

Suddenly, Peter started to run, while he ran, he looked at his watch, over and over again as if by looking at his watch time would stop.  But this was not the case, time continued to pass by, ever so slowly, making Peter even more nervous.  He stopped at a great big building knowing that the fastest way to get to the top floor of the building was by taking the elevator, but what if the elevator stopped?  He decided to take the stairs and so he did.  He ran up the stairs as fast as he could.  Half way through his journey, he tripped.  To him, it felt as if time had stopped for a moment, but time, as time always does, kept going.  

Peter smiled for a brief moment as he remembered his obsession with Einstein's Theory of General Relativity, he thought  "finally I understand it".

He calmly stood up, looked at his watch, then closed his eyes and realized that there was nothing else to do.

Nowadays, it is hard for many young people to do physical exercise frequently. It is a well-known fact that sometimes they prefer watching TV on the sofa or playing computer games comfortably to doing physical activities. So, it is necessary to find a solution in order to make young people keep fit in a motivated way.

There can be no doubt that technology should be a tool to motivate young people.  It is clear that most of them use computers and watch television almost every day, but while they are doing this they are sitting in a comfortable sofa. I feel very strongly that computer games could be an enjoyable way to do physical exercise without going out of home. In the market, you can find a wide range of computer games or video games to keep fit, such as dancing to the rhythm of last hits, playing tennis, doing aerobics, running...

Moreover, schools can play an  important role in kids' fitness. It is true that many young people do extra activities related to sports like football or basketball. Although some schools offer the chance of doing these, many others do not do. I firmly believe that were the schools to offer kids a greater variety of sports, there can be no doubt that they would do more exercise. In this way, children could do the sport they prefer as a routine.

To sum up, it is important motivating the young people to do physical exercise. School programmes and technology could be effective methods to achieve this goal. It seems to me that school programmes would make young people be encouraged to keep fit because in this way, they do their favourite sport in a routine way.

It all started with jumping over the big black trashcans. I was 9 years old when it happened for the first time. Back in the time, when I successfully passed the third grade, my parents decided to let me pick the present that I want as a reward. The very first thing came to my mind was a pair of inline roller skates; I used to look out of my window, or sitting on my house’s door step and see my neighbors skating and trying to do some tricks and jumps, and all I wanted was joining them instead of watching them enjoying their times. My parents took me to TOYS R US to get what I wanted. I ran to the outdoor toys section and I picked the skate I liked. I tried couple of sizes to see which one fits more. I could not be more excited to join my friends. After that, I went back home, I put them on, and I went outside to skate. I fell over a hundred times in a few days. By the time, I got better, and I started to learn how to do tricks and jump over small items. While skating was a whim for my friends and me in the beginning, I found myself in it. I knew that skating is the thing I want to do for the rest of my life, the thing I want to tell people about when they ask me what your favorite thing to do is. 
        In a couple of years, I became much better and I learned to do many tricks like skating backwards, the Snake and the Zigzag. I learned how to jump over many items, such as chairs and the trashcans that my neighbors used to jump over. However, that was not enough for me. I kept trying to know more about skating. I entered middle school; I met two friends who also love to skate, Mohammed and Khalid. We decided to go skating on the next weekend at the park, which has a wide walk path by the sea. When we met on the weekend, I noticed that they were different; they have different skates, and different methods of skating, they slid on edges and skated on the park benches. I realized that this is what I am looking for, a new additional excitement to add to skating. I had to wait for two months to buy a new pair of skates, but this time it is aggressive skates. 
       When I started aggressive skating, I had to learn how to balance my weight using heavy two-wheel inline skates. This kind of skating taught me how to take risks and not to be afraid. After a while, the group expanded, and we used to go around the town, Yanbu, to search for great edges and rails to slide on. In addition, we made our own skate rails, and we used some help from my friend’s brother, who is in fact an Engineer. 
        Once on a weekend, it was my last year in middle school, I was at the park practicing as usual. I found three people skating, and again, a new kind of skates, and new methods. Their moves were so smooth; it was more like a ballet. I was impressed. I introduced myself, and as I thought, they were vising from a different city. We discussed different topics, but mainly skating. The more we get deep into the conversation, the more I want to learn this type of skating. It turned out that they were wearing roller hockey skates. “These skates are light, smooth, and perfect for freestyle slalom skating.” One of them said. The words “freestyle” and “slalom” caught my attention. They showed me what slalom skating is. They started to put small cones in one line with a bit of space in between. They played some music and started to skate with the rhythm. I was surprised, I had mixed feeling, and it was indescribable. I kept staring at them with wide opened mouth and eyes. The butterfly feeling in my stomach started to appear. I knew at that moment that I want to change my style of skating. 

        However, as the skaters suggested, I bought a pair of hockey skates. I did not have the ability to order the cones online back then, therefore, I went to IKEA, and bought small colored cups and used it as cones. I went to the same park. After couple of hours of trying to get used to my new skates, I put the cups on. I opened some tutorial videos on YouTube and started to practise. In a short time, I became so good, and some of my friends changed from aggressive to slalom skating just by seeing me practicing. My guess is they had the same reaction I had when I saw the three skaters. 
       For me, skating is not just a sport. After almost 3 years of practicing to do tricks, to create a perfect match between my moves and the rhythm of the song I am playing, and to try to reach the perfection, I realized that slalom skating is more like a performing art than a sport. A freestyle skater who can make a perfect combo of tricks that matches the rhythm is an artist. When I stopped looking for enthusiasm, fun, and excitement and started trying to fulfill my heart, brain, and body’s desires by skating, I knew for sure skating is not just a sport or a hobby. Skating is a lifestyle. 
     About one year ago, I moved to Philadelphia, United States. Unlike weather in my country, Philadelphia is always rainy, wet, and sloppy. This weather was an obstacle, it was impossible to skate in this condition. However, I was not going to give up on skating that easy. I had to find something to keep me going, to fulfill the missing part in me. A friend suggested giving ice skating a shot, and for me, everything worth trying just to be able to skate again. I went to an ice rink, I rented hockey skates, and I started to skate. I did not imagine that it would be that similar to roller skating. What I learned in 10 years, I had the ability to learn it on ice in one month. It was just a matter of balance. 
     Today, After 10 years of skating, I wonder sometimes what my life would be without skating. I believe that skating is a huge part of me, Mohammed, and I am positive that if this part was missing, my path in life would have changed and I will never be the same person I am now.

Singapore could be the place that you would find everything you are looking for. This place is a hub where east and west meet, it has been one of the biggest and busiest port in the world. Shopping is very popular among tourists. The most well-known shopping centre is called Marina Bay Sands mall, located in the south part of the island. If you are looking for any luxury brands and extravaganza shopping experience, this is the right place. Vivo city in Harbourfront and shopping street on Orchard road are good she you want to buy anything from mid-range to the high-end goods. Both places are extremely crowded with people on the weekend, unless you enjoy people watching, early bird shopping is highly recommended. Haji lane in Bugis has lots of local boutiques, you can find unique pieces from designers from Asia. Graffiti on the wall and small lane ways create a punky ambient. This place is also famous for good coffee shops. Lastly there are sports dedicated malls, which are velocity in Novena, Kallang mall and Queensway mall. A variety of selections from different brands are available.

Icebreakers

I was surprised when I realized I was talking too much. I'm, usually, not good at talking or any social things. Whenever I talk with someone I meet for the first time, I often make us fall into awkward silences. But with him, I'm ... I'm different, I'm the one who often breaks the ice. Because I want him to talk. I love to listen him talking - I love his voice. I try to recall the jokes I've read in books or on Facebook or blogs and tell him. I love his laughter, his smile, his chuckle. 

I can't suffer even a second's moment of our awkward silences. However, when we sit in silence, I love to stare at him, reading his face. Is he feeling bored? Is something on his mind? I know it. 

He's friendly. He always smiles when he's talking. I once told a friend, "You know? He's very friendly. He can make friends easily. Even if you meet him for the first time, his smile can make you feel comfortable." My friend replied, "Yes, I may feel comfortable around him. We may become friends in seconds. But I doubt I can read his face like you do." 

I always want to be with him, talking, laughing, smiling or simply sitting in silence reading his face. I'm kind of person who used to think that every hour had a purpose, who had no time to waste, not even a single hour. I was always having things to do. But when I'm with him, they become secondary. He is the most important to me. I am happy when I am with him. I don't want to do anything else. Just being with him is enough. Please, let me follow my heart, at least for the first time in my life.

Advertising is a form of communication that is used to influence and persuade consumers to buy products, services, ideas. Advertising is most commonly aimed at the manipulation consumer's behavior in a commercial aspect. But at the same time advertising has many features in common with art.

Firstly, art is the expression of  human creative skills and imagination, typically in a visual form. And advertising is a combination of sounds, images and words. Like art it is intended to evoke emotions and feelings. To be successful advertising often uses images from popular movies, catchy melodies, unusual graphic elements and fragments of famous paintings. Often people, who are watching a commercial, do not remember what details or elements of other visual art types they have seen before. Therefore, advertising successfully combines other types of art to influence the subconscious and human behavior.

Secondly, art as well as advertising is such a large part of our everyday lives. Someone designed all things around: a chair, shoes, clothes. It is art. Art is something that is both functional and aesthetically pleasing to people’s eyes. Hoardings and billboards, which are a part of the urban landscape, are art. Visual advertising like painting uses color, value, space and line. There are elements of art. Also it uses balance, contrast, emphasis and proportion. There are principles of design.

Lastly, advertising like art originated a long time ago. Commercial advertising can be traced as far back as Ancient Greece. There were posters for entertainment, small ads for businesses, merchants used town criers, paying for events. With the development of mass media, television and Internet advertising has become the strongest form of communication. Now advertising is a big part of modern culture. 

Advertising has similarities with the art and often combines other types of art to be more successful. Advertising is creative combinations of sounds, images and words. Modern technologies, the development of mass media are allowed advertising to become the greatest art from the 20th century.

Michael got out of bed on the wrong side that day or, at least, that's what he thought when, on his way to work, he was so concentrated looking down at his mobile phone that he didn't see a woman approaching him and they both collided.
She was around fifty years old and rather unattractive although smartly dressed. She didn't see Michael coming either because she had just come out of a Starbuck's coffee shop right at the corner and was putting her purse back into her massive handbag.
On her left hand there was a large steaming cup of coffee that landed on Michael's new shirt when he bumpped into her. One second later, Michael was covered in coffee, burnt and sticky and his mobile phone screen was twinking until it finally turned off with a dying flash.
Michael then remembered how he had overslept that morning, how he didn't have time to have breakfast, how he didn't have any clean shirt ready and had to wear the new one that he was keeping for a special occasion and he blamed that woman for it all. He screamed, shouted, waved his hands into the air, swore and insulted that stranger until his rage faded away. And then he rushed away trying not to be late for work.
A couple of hours later, already in his office, he received a call. The new human resources manager had arrived and wanted to meet every worker in the company personally. It was his turn now.
He jumped off his chair, walked down the corridor and stopped in front of the HR Manager's office. He knocked at the door and when he opened it, he saw, sitting there, the same old lady he had cursed a few hours earlier in the street. Michael closed the door and knew at that moment he had made a mistake.

My article is about a class play. In this article a teacher refltcts on his experiences of creating plays and using them to help motivate students to develop their English. It consists of eight part: Introduction; How to start; Writing the play; I want to be Cinderella; Practise; The big night; Reason for doing a play and A few final thoughts. The author says that the pros far outweigh the cons and it is the main idea of the article. The first thing you need to start with is a deadline to get everything done by. Writing the play: first, you may ask learners to invent profiles and to tell you about their characters; second, learners can write the basic outline of the play or you can adapt a familiar story.
They you should take a decision of choosing roles: start by asking for volunteers; and always ensure that everyone in the class has a role or something to do. Students must learn their lines by heart. The most effecnive way is to practise every lesson for ten minutes at the beginning and end. You can give them the play with gaps to read through and finally get them to perform a number of times without a script. Some learners will not want a spiaking part, you can even ask them to be promters. Reasons for doing a play: learners will learn whole chunks of language in a clear context and they will learn not only their parts. It gives learners the opportunity to demonstrate different their skills at the language classroom. Also they can see how much language they can produse.

In a world of increasing environmental awareness improved public transport represents the way of the future. Although people do enjoy the convenience and privacy of travelling in their own private vehicles, in my opinion they may choose public transport if it fulfils certain conditions. These conditions fall into three broad categories: attitudinal, financial and logistical.
From an attitudinal perspective, people must first be convinced of the benefits of public transportation. An educational or public relations campaign must be launched to sensitize those who might have disregarded this possibility before. People should be familiarized with the environmental, social and personal benefits for present and future generations. This is one step.
From a financial perspective, public transportation must be a clear and viable benefit to consumers. In other words, it must be more affordable than driving to work every day. For example, if people know that by using bus and subway, they can save enough money to take a free holiday each year, many more individuals would be persuaded to travel in this way. This is another critical step.
From a logistical perspective, public transportation should be convenient for commuters. City planners and transport officials must ensure that frequent and reliable public transportation is available for each citizen. For people to make the habit of travelling by bus or subway, they must know that they will be able to get to various places on time. Transport vehicles must be well maintained, subway and bus drivers should be customer-oriented and service must be punctual and efficient. This is an additional important step.
In conclusion, through a multi-pronged approach, it is possible to increase the use of public transportation. City officials and politicians can lead the way by utilizing these forms of transport themselves and bringing about change through personal example. Then, more citizens will follow suit and we may all hope to live in a cleaner, less polluted environment.

My favorite sport is cycling.
I enjoy this sport because it allows you to take care of your health by using almost all your muscles while you can also enjoy the scenery and visit the places you come across. Like every sport, it is also a good way to meet people and make some new friends. You can ride at your own pace and go increasingly far. It makes you see the road and your environment differently. Furthermore, it is better for the planet to ride a bike instead of a car because cycling doesn't produce any pollution.
When you start riding a bicycle, you first need to check if your bike follows the security instructions. For instance, you need good brakes, lights, a bell and reflective stripes on your wheels or reflectors. You also need to know some basic rules such as putting out your arm to indicate when you turn and of course, you need to know the highway code. A lot of people are afraid to ride a bike in cities because they fear the massive presence of cars and think they will be crushed. Indeed, some places still need to improve the structures for bikes: sometimes they don't have a lot of bicycle paths. But if you learn how to obtrude in the circulation while remaining polite with the others, there is no reason to be afraid.
Let's get on our bikes and discover new places!

I was alone in my bedroom and a young good looking woman entered the room. She swiftly came beside my bed and gave me a letter. It looked quite simple, I had no idea who could have sent me that letter. When the woman left, I opened it eagerly and when I read the first sentence my heart stopped. It was from the most dangerous and terrifyng gang of the village. It said that I was now one of them.
I met those boys next Friday and they told me that I had to pass the test initiation.


I felt extremely nervous, I was about to commit a crime and my heart was beating uncontrollably, really fast. I went into the tiny shop and the shop keeper looked through me.

“Hi”, he groaned drumming his fingers.

“Do you have ice-creams?” I asked nervously.

The shop keeper nodded and pointed at a grey fridge at the end of the shop.

“Thank you”, I mumbled and went straight to the fridge. My hands were sweating and the other boys were waiting outside ecstatic.

A second later a child entered the shop and began to move around quickly. He was quite small, about seven years old and he was beaming, smiling from ear to ear. 

I thought it was the perfect moment and at the speed of light I put a whole box of sweets into my old bag. Silence. I walked forwards and stared at the shop keeper. I was going to leave when the bitter and loud voice of the man surprised me.

“Hey little boy, what are you doing? He yelled angrily.

My heart nearly stopped beating. I turned and noticed that the man was not speaking to me, but to the child.

“ I don´t know”, he answered confused.

“Where has the sweet box gone little thief? He rasped and crossed his arms.

“I have not taken anything yet”, the boy whimpered.

“Dear me! How can you be so cheeky?” he uttered dismissively taping his feet. 

The boy began to mourn. After watching this, I returned to my house hoping the man forgives the child. Feeling horribly guilty, I fell asleep. 
That was the first crime I comited and here I am now, in jail.

A day at the races.

This text lead us into the (for me unknown) world of horse racing. In a few sentences we can get an idea of what it is. And we can find different reasons to be interested in this type of events.

I think that horse races are a fun entertainment if you like one of these three things: animals, betting and fashion. If you like animals you'll ejoy seeing that beautiful horses running and vaulting as fast as they can.
If you like to bet and you're not used to doing at horse races, maybe you're looking forward to trying to bet on the nose or each way.
And if you love fashion and you have the chance to go to Ascot, you may run into the Queen and greet her, and at the same time enjoy the fabulous view of all those extravagant hats the ladies wear. Meanwhile you can have a good time drinking some bubbly.

But you can also have a "horrible" day at the races: if  you're not savvy enough to know the differences between the bets, you can end up skint, penniless. And of course, if you're not an it-girl, you can spend a lot of money and choose a wrong dress to attend Ascot and perhaps you'll have to view the races from behind a curtain.

Anyway, if you knew beforehand your odds of winning it wouldn't be so thrilling. That's the raison d'être of horse racing: lose or win money. And if you want to admire the wonderful world of hats, you'd better buy some magazine where you'll find all the photos for just 2€
