For today's teenagers it is hard to imagine life before mobile phones although it did exist only some decades ago. Few technical inventions have had such a deep impact on our daily life as this little thing .
However, there are various advantages and disadvantages to a mobile phone and everyone has to decide for him- or herself in which way to use this medium. 
First of all, the mobile phone is a great way to "stay connected" all the time. Chatting with your friends, staying informed of the latest news, ordering online, etc - you can do all these things simultaneously, wherever and whenever you want. This aspect has also enabled employees to become homeworkers as they do not longer need to be present in an office to get a job done. Furthermore mobile phones allow last-minute-changes very easily. No need to make a fixed appointment with a friend in advance, as you can always agree to call each other once everyone is on the way.
However, the biggest strength of the mobile phone is also the biggest risk in my opinion: being connected all the time creates a lot of stress for people, as you are always available for everyone. Therefore you don't have any time to relax, which is essential, even from your leisure duties. The same is valid for business life: if employees are available all the time, they take the worries of the daily business with them to their home which means a lot of stress. Last but not least, the mobile phone enables worried parents or suspicious partners to track the child or the loved one nearly permanently. This can be seen as loving worry about someone but also as a sign of distrust. 
Finally,  the mobile phone offers both disadvantages and advantages in daily life. However, I personally think that it should not be regarded too critically but should only be handled responsably, according to one's personal needs.

I recently saw a film called Passengers. It's about 2000 people that want to go to a new planet to start a new life and their trip was going to take approximately 120 years. Before the trip started, the company who decided to make this trip said that everything was perfectly calculated so that it was imposible to have any kind of problem with the spacecraft. But they were wrong. The first 30 years all was going good, but suddenly something bad happened. One of the cabins broke down and the person who was inside it waked up. These guy was called Mark and he was engineer. Once he realized that he was the only person awake he knew something was wrong.. He was going to be alone for the next 90 years. He couldn't continue like that so he hacked one of the cabins of a woman that he loved. The first 2 years all was perfect until the day number 734. She discovered that she didn't have any problem with the cabin, it was Mark who hacked it. Since then, they never spoke again.

It does not seem like years have passed since I first met her, but it was some time ago indeed.

Although we were in the same school, we hadn't talked before. It was nearly August when we decided to meet. I was really excited. 

Irene was taller than me, brown-eyed and dark-haired. She picked me up to her house. And what a beautiful house it was! She had a swimming pool, a little garden and a lovely bunny called "Suki". Although it also needed to be flexible it needed to be tough. It needed to be this way. If not, the consumers of this product will end buried.

Introduction

The purpose of this report is to outline actions taken by the authorities of Mińsk Mazowiecki in the sphere of preserving the environment.

What happens to the rubbish

The local government of Mińsk Mazowiecki has recently implemented new laws which concern rubbish segregation. It is obligatory for the inhabitants to put their different types of garbage into separate bins. Although citizens usually obey those rules, in some cases they are completely neglected. However, people who have bigger houses tend to compost the organic waste and that makes up for the disobedient. The situation with household litter looks much better rather than what happens on the streets of the city. Waste is thrown on the ground and very few people are concerned about this problem.

Town's actions

As not all inhabitants are sensitive about the environment, it is the local government's responsibility to decrease the harmful effects of people's actions. Authorities make sure that rubbish bins are placed in small distances since this is the most common reason why people throw litter on the ground. There are many workers employed so that the waste is picked up. Not also does it give job to people, but also has a good impact on the town's scenery.

One of the most challenging issues in modern cities is transportation. Cities have been planned to satisfy people's needs to travel all around the city. Now we can observe people moving around the city using bikes, underground, public transport, and cars. Although there are many people who suggest that public transport is no longer a suitable option because cars are considered a more convenient option to transport, there are more benefits using public transport than travelling by car, such as reduction of traffic, saving money, and decreasing of pollution.

Firstly, a car could carry only 5 people at a time. A bus or an underground wagon can carry from 30 to 100 people at a time. When referring to cars, we can considerably reduce the number of vehicles on the streets if we use public transport. The less we use cars, the less traffic we shall see in the roads. Secondly, having a car implies different costs to be afforded. For example, cars require petrol to function. If a person constantly uses his/her car, he/she shall need to pay for more petrol. Equally important, a car requires maintenance and it shall be another expense that the owner has to cover. Finally, if every person drives his/her own car, pollution shall considerably increase affecting air conditions.

I was getting really bored. I had to stand because we were shifting our house and had just sold almost all of our furniture on OLX. The floor was very dirty and I could not even go out because all the people who wanted to buy our furniture were standing near our door. My mother said that it would be rude to go at that time. I was so annoyed that I closed my eyes and wished for a chair...
When I opened my eyes I saw a beautiful chair with orange and green stripes. It had four red wooden legs and it looked very comfortable indeed. I immediately sat down and began to feel relaxed. Suddenly the chair jerked up and went straight out of the window while I was still sitting on it. It swerved beautifully avoiding a tree and landed on the ground as softly as a butterfly. Then I realized that the chair had wheels along with a 'nitro & teleport' button on the armrest. I might have pressed the nitro button by mistake when I sat down. I pressed teleport and said, " Botanical garden". It actually took me there! I had a great time taking a stroll there while people watched me with their eyebrows raised. I wanted to explore more about the chair but I knew that I should go home by them. So I pressed teleport and said, "Home". That's where it took me. As soon as I reached there the chair disappeared and I landed on the floor with a thump! My mother came and said, " Get up! The floor is so dirty" and she went.
I guess it is back to normal now so I will have to get up again. I leaned against the wall and thought about my adventure.

Today we had a class discussion about taking one year off between leaving school and starting university.
Different thoughts came up, but my personal opinion is that it could be a wonderful thing.

Taking a year off might help people who are uncertain about what to do next to make up their minds, while trying new things and making new experiences that will be useful later on their lives. 
It would certainly be counterproductive and a waste of time if the time would be spent doing nothing and just passing the time like it were a long vacation, but if it is used to make new experiences, a year off can change the future of a person.

It can be a great opportunity to travel, meet new cultures and people, or it can be a chance to work to save up money for being able to afford the cost of the university planned on attending.
Or maybe during the year off somebody could also decide that they don't want to continue their studies, because they already found what they want to do or be.

Personally, I would love to take one year off, and I think I would spend it travelling around Europe.

Sale promotion, which is the set of marketing activities undertaken to boost sales of the product or service, has become a vital tool for marketing and its importance has been increasing significantly over the years. In spite of some controversies, sales promotion has already demonstrated a mass of positive impact on both sellers and buyers. The aim of this presentation will be to analyse the aims and approaches of sales promotion as well as to evaluate both benefits and drawbacks sales promotions provide. For this purpose, the presentation will be divided into four sections. The first section will show the definition of sales promotion as an introduction. The second part will provide the aim of sales promotion as well as the analysis of some key sales promotion techniques in detail. Then the presentation will focus on a specific case study------the utilization of Flybuys loyal reward program. Finally, there will be an evaluation of its advantages and disadvantages as well as the present situation.

With any new course, there are some certain expectations one will have. At the beginning of this course, as a first year postgraduate student, I was ambitious for creating a new mechanical product or at least part of it at the end of this course by applying knowledge and skills that are provided throughout the course.

Eight months working in the industry as an assistant mechanical design engineer gave me the very basic concept of mechanical design. Before taking part in this course, my concept about mechanical design was about applying either self knowledge or working as a part of a team to design mechanical products that are easy to be manufactured, durable and financial reliable. My thoughts about mechanical design were somewhat match with the information that is provided in the first three weeks.

By attending the first three lectures, I soon realized that my general concept about mechanical design is quite simple as my thoughts about mechanical design is purely just creating new products. I recognized that mechanical design is not just about creating mechanical products. It can be seen in many aspects ranging from producing a maintenance process, improving performance for a specific part of the mechanical system to creating the whole new product. This is because despite having experience in industrial design, I was never taking part in the design process from the initial stage. Therefore, my knowledge about mechanical design is rather limited. 

Being placed in a project team working for Sydney Water about producing a maintenance excellent standard, I started to read the course outline and lecture notes more carefully to find out where to start and what I should do to deliver a good outcome. The first thing I have noticed is the importance of clarifying all the requirements with the clients. This was demonstrated during the Project Introductions session as well as lecture notes, client interview task and client feedback (which is worth 25 points in the total mark). As soon as I met my group, I discovered how far behind I am in terms of using English to demonstrate the ideas and lure the attention from other group members. However, this also is an opportunity to meet up and work with them every week, whose English is their first language, to improve my oral communication skills and persuasion. Because in order to deliver a successful industry project, I not only have to make a good product, but also have to be good at introducing my idea and persuading customers. The final consideration is the self-calibration, which also is the point that I have never considered before in a design process. This is such an essential activity that allows me to gauge my performance, keep pace with the group and not to be left behind.

To sum up, at the end of week three, my expectation for this course are to be able to apply my reflective thinking in any further design process, to be able to deliver a persuasive technical presentation, to be effective in verbal communication skills and presentation skill. Last but not least, I hope I can learn to work effectively under any circumstances as a team member or a team leader by the end of this course.

In today´s world, due to the fact the great comfort of cars, public transport is likely to disappear. 
Firstly, is it true that cars are the faster way of transport. After all, there are many people who can´t afford a car.In addition the car is one of the means most used not only its quickness but also because the cost of public transport is increasing every year. From my point of view, many people use cars owe to the awful quality of some buses, trains… 
We should also consider the fact that nowadays life is so busy that we can´t waste our time taking public transport. However, cars can cause some problems like traffic jams and accidents that could be avoided using public transport. 
To conclude, it seems to me that it is fine to use cars sometimes but whether the quality of public transport was better, the amount of pollution and accidents would decrease.

In recent years, many regions of the world have faced an issue about water scarcity that may affect their development, especially for those countries undergoing poverty. Due to the increasing population of the world, countries are likely to need more fresh water to irrigate crops to satisfy their population. Therefore, water scarcity may pose a threat to people’s living standards. This essay will analyse the problem of water scarcity in Australia and recommend some viable alleviation solutions. It will examine responses including the recycling water, the development of technology about purifying ocean water and multinational sharing about water resources.

Recycling wastewater is an effective method to solve water scarcity problem. This is because there is a huge number of water usage presenting in people’s daily life, they just need to be collected to filter waste parts. However, the use of recycled water for daily routine is less common, because many people are repelled by the thought of water that comes from our toilets or drains. For example, those recycled water can be utilized to water plants in a garden, but if they are clear enough, residents only need to heat them to wash dishes or even drink. Thus, states should make it possible to purify the wastewater to an enough safety level.

Moreover, developing latest technology about purifying ocean water can be regarded as a viable alleviation strategy. As is well known, about 70 per cent surface of earth is covered by ocean water, so every region surrounded by ocean like Australia makes the most of ocean water resource to release the pressure of fresh water need. Although, governments are likely to face economic stress initially, which means they have to invest more money into upgrade technology instead of other field such as education, infrastructure and medical care, this strategy could affect dwellers’ physical health and promote their living standard.

Sharing different water resources with neighbouring countries can be another strategy which can help to alleviate the problem of water scarcity. Countries with abundant resources can give assistance to nations with water scarcity. In this way, those states of drought regions will obtain enough time and technical aid to overcome water problems. Despite over shared water resources could lead to violence and even international tension, few countries suffered these problems.

In conclusion, water shortage has presented a challenge to individual life and global environment. This essay has discussed three alleviation strategies with the potential to resolve the problem of water scarcity, including the use of recycled water and ocean water and international aid. While these approaches are likely to solve the problem partially, they might have a positive impact on water shortage in a long term.

Nowadays we watch the perfection of actors all over the world. The range of techniques they use to strike the audience is colossal. Facial expression is said to be more important for the film actors,  whereas body language and voice intonation are paid more attention to in the stage acting. Besides, camera work, props and special effects deserve to be called silver screen features, while staging implies actors to convey their play through body movements and energy.
It is evidently that those types of acting are different and the actors should adapt to the conditions they work in in one way or another. But let’s take a closer look at what performance capabilities they have and might use during the acting. The stage actor is armed with props, costumes and light as well as the film actor. The only preponderance of film acting versus stage acting is in camera/editing work and special effects. But those are justified by the presence effect stage actors might render active in comparison to film actors. So I would say those types of acting are even in the sense of external factors.
Regarding acting techniques, stage actors do use their body languages as much as film actors. The only thing that differs is that film actor has several takes opposed to stage actor who has to play perfectly at one dash. And controlling your voice is also important for the film actors, in spite of having the support of audio operators, they still have to deal with the same problems as stage actors that is keeping your voice expressions in compliance with the acting, resonate moving, communicate emotions and feelings of their model character.
The key point is that the whole range of techniques makes that acting pieces perfect. I would say, it doesn’t matter are you performing on the stage or in front of the camera, you should use your facial expression, body language, intonation and timber of voice as if you’re acting as your main character, embody all their treats and features appropriately to the situation. In other words, no matter what kind of performance it is, the only thing that matters is using all your abilities to model yourself on your hero, get the feel of their role.

I live in Moscow, the capital of the Russian Federation. There are different types of public transport that people use in major cities in my country, including Moscow: bus, train, tram and metro. Furthermore people actively use private transport such as cars, motorbikes, scooters and bicycles.

Tourists can encounter with difficulties such as a traffic jam. Sometimes it is very difficult to come home in rush hour because of traffic jams. Banning cars from the centre of the city solves all these problems. 

There are some disadvantages of banning cars. For example, it is difficult for some people, including the aged and invalids, to use public transport. I suppose that banning cars from the centres would be a big problem for them. This idea also would be unpopular because it limits a freedom of choice.

Some people believe that cars should be banned from the centres of all major cities but I am against this idea. In my view the best solution to all problems would be limitation of private transport in the centre but not absolute banning.

Recently I read two articles, they were called ‘predicting dyslexia – even before children learn to read (Zimmerman, 2014)’ and 'Innovative' Intervention helps babies at high risk of autism (Geggel & Writer, 2015) ’. However the first article was more motivating to read, because the author substantiated important suggestions. All I can say about the second article is that it has rarely proof of the intervention.
Firstly, the article ‘predicting dyslexia – even before children learn to read’  shows a new research,  in which it’s possible to pick up some of the signs of dyslexia in the brain even before kids learn how to read. In addition, using this identification may assist parents, educators and clinicians to tackle the learning disorder. Most importantly, this early intervention can help many kids with dyslexia to overcome  their educational failure . 
Secondly , the article ‘'Innovative' Intervention Helps Babies at High Risk of Autism’  is based on a video-therapy, which improves the interaction between parents and autism-related babies in a way that would help develop the children’s communication abilities and social engagement. In my opinion, the findings need to be replicated in larger studies before other people turn to video-based therapy as a potential treatment. What I can tell from this text is that the research is an innovative idea, but needs more attention to improve their success.
All in all, if you want to read about an effective research with very strong proposals, I recommend reading  ‘predicting dyslexia – even before children learn to read’.

It had been a very long and tiring day, but Tom felt he had achieved something really good. Tom has joined a volunteering team at St. Michael's Hospital and this was his first day. He was assigned to a task in the rehabilitation center. He will deal with temporarily disabled people who come for a rehabilitation session every other day. Tom's role was to conduct a focus group once per week to explore the people's experience and perception about their illness and the service given to them at the rehabilitation center. The ultimate aim is to get a feedback for service-improvement purpose. Tom has prepared a set of questions to ask. He started with a group of six who signed a consent to participate in the focus group. He helped them after they finished their session and took them to the meeting room. He then introduced himself and made a clear statement about the objective of the focus group and assured them that their identity will not be revealed. He started with some jokes so that they would feel at ease and disclose their experiences. In the afternoon, he analyzed the content and wrote a report with some recommendations for achieving patients' satisfaction. He felt he had done a great job trying to serve the disabled patients.

Brands ¬ pay more for better quality?

We all know the situation, when we are in supermarket standing in front of two products which are the same, but one of it costs much more than the other. Here we have brand products and no name products.
Now the question is, if it is really justified that brand products are much more expensive than no name products.

Most people associate brand products automatically with higher quality or better taste, while they think no name products are just cheap and without any quality and a bad taste.
In surveys, it was asked if consumers would rather buy brand products or no name products. Most of the consumers said, they would buy brand products. When they were asked why, they answered with "because it tastes better".
After that the consumers made a blind taste test. The product without brand tasted better to nearly everybody.

As a result you can say it is not always justified that brand products are more expensive than comparable other ones. Only the brand and the good marketing makes it that expensive, not better quality or better taste. The effect of media on people is clearly noticeable here. A product which everybody is talking about and which is advertised a lot is automatically considered to be good. It is like "Everybody has it, I need it too!"
In some cases it may be true that brand products are better than no names, for example technology products, but products like Red Bull or others like that, are definitely not always better.

Brand and good quality are not always the same. Here it is said, try and find out which is really the better one and do not trust on advertisements.

My wife and I got a nasty surprise when we were checking in at Vigo airport yesterday with our baby Pedro. We had won three free plane tickets to Rome in a competition, and we were looking forward to our trip for months. But, unfortunately, we had forgotten to get a passport for our son, so Pedro couldn’t fly. Luckily, we had arrived very early for our flight, so we still had time to do something about it. We ran to the police station in the airport to apply for an emergency passport. My wife went with Pedro to the photo machine while I was filling in the forms. The passport was ready in an hour, so we were hurrying to the gate and got on the plane.

To do the same thing in the same place, people should do it in an organised manner. That's why I think that waiting in queues is essential at any place. Otherwise, the place would turn into a mess, especially the crowded places.

It may seems boring and time wasting to wait in queues, but it isn't. Actually, it is time saving because everyone eventually does what he wants without wasting time pushing other people. In addition, employees don't get confused by receiving several requests at the same time. That saves time because they receive each request only once and in an organised manner. Also, that make them do their jobs efficiently.

Also, some people would never do what they want without queues. Old people and other weak people wouldn't be able to push and fight to get their turn. That would make them feel disabled.

Being crowded in front of the employee makes people uncomfortable. First, they wouldn't have privacy because there would be many people surrounding the one dealing with the employee. In addition, everyone would feel rushed to finish what he is doing.

In conclusion, people will do what they want smoothly and politely, if they wait patiently in queues.

Michael had always been a good boy: responsible, quiet, always on time and always the first of his class. But recently he had started to think that it was time to change. The summer that year had been exceptionally warm, and Michael had found himself wondering if there were better ways to spend it than preparing for his University entrance test.
The truth was that he hadn't rested since his graduation day and he was starting to feel tired, but he also knew that he couldn't afford to fail.
He closed the window not to hear the laughs and yells of his friends, playing soccer in the field in front of his house: "I never liked soccer, anyway" he kept telling himself, but the more he tried, the harder it get to focus on his book. 
He felt like a character in a cartoon, with an angel on a shoulder and a devil on the other, giving him opposite pieces of advice, and exactly like such a character, he didn't know who to listen to.
Suddenly the doorbell rang, distracting him from his inner struggles, and he heard his Mother opening the door. 
"Michael" she called "your friend Tom is here looking for you, could you please come down?"  
He stood up, hesitating for a few seconds, then glanced at his book once again and finally got out of his room and said "Please mom, tell him I can't go out, I have to study." 
Michael closed the door and knew at that moment he had made a mistake.

By a wide definition, teachers are the people who teach you. For many people, parents are teachers in our life. However, are parents the best teachers in our life? Some people might agree with this statement, but I do not. I think the best teacher is a person who has professional knowledge and good teaching skills. In addition, the best teachers, by their teachings, are the people who we most agree with and appreciate. Many parents may not satisfy all of these conditions.

First of all, for many parents to have professional knowledge or good teaching skills is very difficult. Most parents have special skills, but these skills may not be suitable for their children. Compared with professional teachers, they have specific teaching abilities. If parents want to get these abilities, they need to spend extra time to learn. Most parents are not willing to do so because of limited time. 

Good teaching skills are based on patience, training and passion. However, not all parents have that kind of personality and most of them are confused or use the wrong ways to teach their children.

Parents undoubtedly play an important role in our life. However, we may not be greatly influenced by their teachings, but by others’ teachings. Because everyone has their own talents, values, and judgments, we learn more from those with whom we agree and appreciate and get significant influence from them. These people can be deemed as the best teacher in our life, even if these people perhaps are not our parents. 

Although parents teach a lot of things in our life, because they don’t have professional training and we may not agree with them and learn more from them,   I think parents are not the best teachers in our life.

PREPARING THE REVOLUTION IN FRANCE

If I could travel back in time, undoubtedly I’d choose to take part in the French revolution. The reason for my choice is simple and clear: the French revolution was the turning point in the European modern history and, thanks to its achievements, people in the twenty-first century can enjoy civil rights such as freedom of speech, assembly, worship and, the most important one, freedom of thought.

It is difficult to think about Paris without its Eiffel tower (it was built several years after the revolution), but I’m sure it was a gorgeous city as it is nowadays. I fancy its streets crowded by workers and peasants that have been called to support the revolution. They meet at midnight to listen to the speechs of the leaders. They trust in them, and are willing to fight for the freedom, fraternity and solidarity they proclaim.

I also imagine aristocrats fleeing Paris at their earliest convenience, leaving all their expensive dresses and impressive houses unattended. They are frightened by the social movement, and prefer  to look for a safer shelter in the countryside.

But, if I could be there, I wouldn’t waste my time walking down the streets or laughing at the ridiculous aristocrats. I’d try to meet the poor king Louis the sixteenth and his wife, Marie Antoinette. I would do my best for making their imprisonment less hard and, above all, I’d try to convince the Parliament not to sentence them to the death penalty. Because no revolution is worthier than a human life.

Throughout my undergraduate studies, my professional skills were recognized at the internships at the Federal Court of Law and the most famous fiscal law office in the State. At this period, I was the intern coordinator and I created a manual on the procedures employed by the entire Court. At the law office, I supervised the ISO 8003 procedures. On the other side, in recognition to my academic performance, I graduated with a Bachelor of Laws with Great Honors in 2007. I was placed in the top 10 with a GPA of 8.73 out of 10. My bachelor thesis, founded in Economic Law, was unanimously awarded by the Jury with the maximum score of 10. This first success as a researcher contributed to my interest in global regulation of trade, that conduces me to this LLM and the international business transactions domain. 

Since my Law school graduation, many achievements encouraged my professional development. First, upon graduation, I immediately joined a highly recognized firm, performing a double role of legal consultant and sub-manager, when I was only 22 years old. On the same year, I succeeded the strenuous Brazilian Bar exam with a remarkable score of 9 out of 10. After almost 2 years working in complex litigation, I had acquired the maturity to pursue an international career to work within  and cross-border contracts. Therefore, in order to acquire the excellence extent demanded, I specialized in Economic law with a master’s degree at the University Paris 1 Panthéon-Sorbonne in 2009.   

Following my LLM graduation with magna cum laude in the top five, I enrolled in a PhD in International Economic Law at the University Paris 9 Dauphine in 2010. I profoundly comprehend the theoretical ascertainment for this career, which is that international trade requires rational economic decisions with legally binding consequences. Thereby, new regulatory sources are created in response to the globalized legal context. In conclusion, as an international legal professional, I must be prepared for alternative methods of dispute resolution regarding cross-border transactions, giving the increasingly requirement to look beyond domestic law to find appropriate solutions. 
 
Furthermore, I already profoundly understand the importance of linguistics in an international sphere due to my experience as a foreign lawyer and as a teacher. Henceforth, I aim to consolidate my career by mastering the legal responses to the developments shaping international trade today. The LLM in International Business Regulation, Litigation and Arbitration at New York University is irrefutably the postgraduate program that I need to ensure the outcome aimed.

Man has evolved over the years, since the invention of the wheel, to space craft expeditions. Our specie has achieved great things, but despite all the great discoveries, there is still one problem we have not been able to suppress, a problem that has been haunting us since unmemorable times: racism.
In the 19th century, slavery had been eradicated from America, but soon another problem originated and took its place. The movie “The Color Purple” displays a variety of situations from Afro-American people who suffered because of their skin color, known as racism, which can be defined as the prejudice or discrimination from one race to another.  In this period of time, the Caucasian race felt superior to the Afro-Americans, they had the control and they were in charge of the political and economic activity, while the Afro- Americans did the hard work; as shown in the movie, most of the men where in charge of the crops. They did not have a chance to receive any kind of education at all, it was absolutely forbidden, and that is why they could not aspire to more important jobs.
Afro-Americans were completely segregated, Caucasians found it impossible to live among them, that is the main reason why each race had their own church and their houses where separated to.
Afro-Americans were afraid of raising their voices to express their inconformity against the oppression they were suffering, and to fight to obtain equality was not an option because any sign of rebellion was cruelly punished.
Moreover, women in the Afro-American society where threatened in the most denigrating ways, men were the undisputed authority in the house. Women were in charge of the household chores, some of them could get a job as a servant of a Caucasian family.
It makes me feel sad to realize that racism is still a problem from which society suffers. I wonder, Why do we have the necessity of feeling superior to other people? We are all equal to God’s eyes, and I believe we all have the same right of living a peaceful life based on mutual respect.

It had been a long and rainy day; Tom had been working all day and was very tired and hungry. He decided to go  and have dinner at a restaurant which was very near his office. He put his raincoat on, took his umbrella and headed to the street.  He walked briskly to the restaurant, and tried to be as happy as he could.

The restaurant was almost full. As usual, he decided to sit on the bar and order some fish and chips. The waiter, Anthony, knew him and they talked to each other about how their day had been, while he served him the usual beer. Tom had a first drink and looked around the place. He suddenly recognized someone, Molly. Surprised he thought he hadn't seen her for a long time.

Tom and Molly were classmates at secondary school. She seemed to be having a drink with a friend at the bar. She was calling the waiter, and unexpectedly saw Tom sitting at a table alone. They both smiled at each other, and Tom went over to her to say hello. It was an exciting encounter, and they were both very happy to see each other again. As they talked they came to realize that they had been working at offices which were very near for almost a year. They felt really happy together, and Molly asked Tom for a date. It had been a very long and tiring day, but Tom felt he had achieved something really good.

Public transport is more useful and better than travelling by car. Many people would disagree, but our future depends on public transport.
First of all, our environment is polluted and if we are determined to save it we should definitely stop using cars. Since cars produce exhaust fumes which slowly destroy our planet, we should start using public transport more often. Although there are many other polluters, such as big industries, people should start with the easiest resolutions.
Although many countries do not offer a good public transport service, once people get rid of cars there will be more money for the improvements. For instance, Copenhagen and Vienna are good examples for this.  It seems like cars are losing the battle in this case because these cities propagate the idea that riding bicycles can lead to better future. As more money is being invested in the infrastructure, people tend to use more bikes and public transport.
Unfortunately, not many people are prepared to renounce all the advantages car provides. For example, it is claimed that it is more convenient to travel by car than bus because you can make breaks whenever you want to and they are more spacious. Moreover, it is faster to travel by car than by any other public transport - planes are an exception to this rule.
In conclusion, I think that public transport should win this battle. It is a fight for the better and healthier future. The aforementioned representative examples of Vienna and Copenhagen prove how easy it can be to remove cars from our lives, and I believe that more cities should follow their examples.

It was a cold winter night and the moon was fighting the clouds for freedom, much like any of us fighting through our life and it's obstacles.Michael however, made a living off his fights, at a young age Michael was attacked and mugged in the street so he started taking martial arts lessons lest he be bullied again. With his shaking hands he popped the box of pills he was holding the whole time he was walking, walking towards his home, the place he always felt at ease in. "The hell with it! If the demolition crew camp in front of my place again tomorrow I'll just show them the form..." he  said taking a pill. "But then again what good is a useless piece of paper?" he panicked , putting the box on the night stand he didn't even understand the passing of time! All was lost to dear Mike and he wandered the house anxiously. Until he had calmed enough to go feed his dog, his one best friend, the dog he and his fiance' bought before it broke off. The Labrador really took him back to his engagement... Before the death of his dearest Mona. He was doing well despite his sad life. He fed on the frozen lasagna his mom had sent him a few days earlier.He exercised and went for short jogs in between workouts. His anxiety caught up to him every now and then but the good doctor had prescribed him a good remedy! Lost in his thoughts and unaware of what was going on around him, he heated the plastic bag filled with leftover food for Baxter. Suddenly Michael heard a thud from his upstairs bedroom, Called Baxter and took a bat with him upstairs. Michael rushed to his bedroom with a fatal mixture of fear and adrenaline in his system, only to see his box of pills on the ground and the sound of muffed but heavy breathing coming from behind the door. Michael closed the door,saw his dog gasping for air and knew at that moment he had made a mistake.

It is well accepted that whenever you become a famous person you lose your privacy.
But does this mean that the whole of your life becomes public? Whether they like it or not, right from the beginning all you do becomes attractive for the mob: what you eat, where you go, who you date to, your possible marriage, your holidays, etc. 
I agree with the fact that as soon as your life is not private anymore, famous people have to face journalists with a smile they do not have. I mean by this that for sure there are some days in which these famous people are in a bit of a mood, they have to visit the doctor, or they have to solve mishaps with lawyers, and they have stuck those journalist following till the door or awaiting them stationed in front of their houses. In these cases, jounalists themselves should realize that they are taking it too far and that they should respect them a bit more.

The map shows changes that have taken place in the town of Eastminster since 1999.
During this period, the town has seen extensive growth in residential areas and local amenities, and a modernisation of leisure faclilities.
Parks in the north-east and south-east have been reduced to make way for larger housing estates the one in the north dramatically increasing accommodation in Eastminister.
As well as woodland in the north-west being remodelled into an adventure park, a hotel and golf course have replaced a historic house and gardens in the centre of the town.
south of the river, an industrial area has been constructed next to the existing railway while residential streets have been converted into more modern apartment blocks.
With increasing housing has come a bigger hospital and more shopping facilities the existing shops being built on the site of the old school, with a new school opening on the north bank of the river.

Thanks for sharing! I really enjoyed reading your blog about shadowing students. I like the way you gave examples how you felt and how you would change your own lessons. 
I live in the Netherlands and at our school it’s the same. Our pupils have to sit for many hours a day, and they find it hard to sit still and to be silent. I also think that a lesson went well if they didn’t talk and did their work. However, when I was reading your article I felt ashamed due to the fact that when every teacher teaches the way I do it is logical that our students can’t be quiet and can’t sit without making a move. Moreover, when we as teachers have a study day, I get tired myself by sitting all day.
Your key takeaway #3 was shocking for me, the feeling of being a nuisance is dreadful. In my opinion I am very patient and willing to explain difficult topics over and over again. I really hope my students feel the same, otherwise I have to change my attitude! I get paid for being a teacher and , as I see it, it is my job to clarify and help my pupils to understand. 
Your experience gave me food for thought especially when you wrote that our pupils are sitting passively and listening during approximately 90 per cent of their classes. I am going to look at my lessons again to see if I can change those lessons and try to make my pupils active. I teach at Basisberoeps level and I have already started to use some activities were they must use an Ipad and make pictures or short films. For example, my pupils had to learn the difference between this and that and I let them make a short film about pointing at things in school saying: this door, that window, this is my teacher, that is a chair.                                                                            
However, I find it difficult to use activities every lesson because they are time consuming. Although the main reason that prevents me from using them are my colleagues. I don’t see them doing activities, it looks as if they are just doing their lessons and want to use a book and that is it. For instance, when I hear that another English teacher finished Unit 5 and I am still at Unit 4  I feel incompetently. It gives me the feeling that most important of teaching is doing all the exercises in the book and getting all the work done. Maybe you understand this discrepancy between activate pupils and the pressure of the school board for the best test results. In other words, how can we convince school board and colleagues that it is better for pupils to learn in an active way?

Maybe the only one she'll ever have. She was walikng around the city thinking about the job she just lost. Yes, she should accept this proposition. She felt butterflies in her stomach. She slowly started to smile. The sad music that was playing in her earphones made her feel even more confident. She passed next to the bar where her boyfriend was getting high with some, unknown to her, boys. She wanted to stop him. She really did. But then something gone wrong and she just walked away. As he did when she was hurt. He made her feel bad so why would she don't do the same? He didn't realize that she was going to leave him for ever. BUt it was okay. He never deserved her. She was a good person and he was an asshole.

Michael knew he was fading away, ever consumed by a feeling of apathy. He hardly knew who he was anymore. The dark clouds above the sky, full of life, seemed to mock his little desire to live.  He could heard the thunders shouting with rage, a rage he wished he could feel again. He stared at an object on the beside table, the object that could free him from this hell like existence. Thinking about it relieved him, made him feel excited about the unknown, the unexpected, maybe all the questions ever asked, maybe, finally, they would be answered. Could bliss we found in dead? Had he seen it all? Was it the best part life could offer? its own end?. A tear started running down his face as he looked at the clouds. The door was wide open, inviting him to take the offer. He leaned over and grabbed the object. He placed a hook over the door, tied the object to it and standing on a chair put the object around his neck. He looked at the clouds, they were still grey, and then for a moment, he saw a tinny fragment of a rainbow. Michael closed the door and knew at that moment he had made a mistake.

The members of my family are my best friends

Family is any group of people closely related by blood. This is easy word to understand, but it hides more than defination says. Behind this word I see my brother, parents and grandparents and feel very warm feelings.

I think the most important things in the family are love and support. All the people need these things and the best givers are family members because they give unconditionally. My family members all the time expression their warm feelings with hugs, kisses and beautiful words. For example my parents hug me every day. My mother makes me breakfast every morning and my brother brings me cookies, when I have a bad mood. These small thing gives me a lot. Also they always support me no matter what I do or think.

The second important thing is that I can always count on my family. Usual friends can often say "no" or let me down, but my family never does that. They are always ready to help me, they never let me down.

The third very important thing is trust. My family knows most of my secrets, they know my worries and joys, they know that I am thinking about things. And I like to trust my thoughts and secrets to them, because I know that my family is loyal to me, and their mouths are closed.

To sum up, I can say that the members of my family are my best friends. They fulfill all the functions that my friends has, and they fulfill them even better.

Nowadays, our environment is really affected by the great deal of progress that technology has made in the last century. As a result, some sources of energy like nuclear power are used for our daily life. But, is nuclear power good for us?
Let’s begin by considering the arguments in favour. Huge amounts of energy are generated by nuclear reactors. Moreover, they only need a small quantity of fuel to be produced. Fossil fuels are our most common energy source, even though, they produced a terrible effect on global warming on account of releasing gases into the atmosphere. They won’t last forever and this will increase the use of nuclear energy. Just look at oil, nature takes millions of years to form it and we have almost ended it.
Let’s turn to the arguments against. Nuclear power plants have a high risk of pollution in case of accident. In addition, they produce nuclear waste which is a major problem for the environment and public health. 
All things considered, I believe that renewable energy will be the most common energy in the future as it doesn’t damage global warming although it is expensive to afford.

No, it is not rational because according to the economic theory, you should spend your money on those goods which yield the maximum utility per dollar. MUx/Px must equal MUy/Py. If MUx/Px is less than MUy/Py, than it is the consumer’s duty to buy more of good Y. If MUy/Py is less than MUx/Px, than the consumer must use more of good X. When you work more, you can consume more, each additional unit yielding additional, marginal utility, so you continually increase the sum of your total utility. Following the tradition of economic reasoning, more is better. She may be right about that treadmill because there is a cycle in which consumption results from work which necessitates further consumption, but theory would indicate that this is a positive, self-perpetuating cycle because increased consumption yields increased utility, therefore maximizing utility.
The book says that the rule to follow is to vary consumption until the marginal utility for every dollar for one thing that you are consuming is the same as the marginal utility for every dollar for another thing that you are consuming. Ms. Luhr’s dissatisfaction from her current status in our society must come from her failure to vary her consumption of a variety of material goods. For goods, the marginal utility may start to be less than it was before after a while, and then we are advised to switch our buying to other goods. Ms. Luhr needs to find the goods which work for her. Then she wouldn’t be talking about the negative aspects of work because it is work which allows her to consume and maximize her utility. Her utils are at their highest the more she consumes.
In my view Ms. Luhr is succumbing to her emotions rather than her logic because everyone knows that increased work yields increased wealth and increased utility, and this is the ultimate goal of a rational person who is acting selfishly which is how economists think people act. If Ms. Luhr were truly being selfish and self-interested, she would obtain greater satisfaction from greater consumption, but her statement is defying this tenet of rationality which is so important to economic reasoning. She doesn’t want more. She must be irrational.

Hans Feurer is a mainstay of fashion photography since the late 1960s. The peak of his career was in the early 80-s, after the legendary Kenzo Takedo’s advertising campaign. Feurer’s campaign for Kenzo was one of the most popular and it defined him as a successful photographer.
Hans Feurer was born in Switzerland in 1939. After studying art in Switzerland, he worked as a graphic designer, illustrator and artistic director in London. Traces of his previous career are evident throughout his work in his careful compositions and precise styling.
In 1966, Hans Feurer travelled to Africa, during which trip he decided to become a photographer. He returned to London and began to compile a portfolio.
1967 Feurer’s career went up like a rocket. At the same time he worked for the Pirelli calendar in 1974 he also featured shots that appeared in Elle, Vogue, Numero, etc.   
More than 30 years ago, in the remote deserts of North America, Hans Feurer was given free to photograph Kenzo Takedo’s 1983 advertising campaign. The career of a Somali-American fashion model Iman also began after this pioneering shooting.
These images became the subject of Feurer’s eponymos book, lavishly illustrated with 175 photographs, illustrating his five-decade long career. The book includes Feurer’s photographs for the 1974 Pirelli calendar, for Kodak and for fashion magazines such as Vogue Italia, Elle France and Nova.

The two competition lifts in order are the snatch and the clean and jerk. Each weightlifter receives three attempts in each, and the combined total of the highest two successful lifts determines the overall result within a bodyweight category. Bodyweight categories are different for women and men. A lifter who fails to complete at least one successful snatch and one successful clean and jerk also fails to total, and therefore receives an "incomplete" entry for the competition. The clean and press was once a competition lift, but was discontinued due to difficulties in judging proper form.

Dickens and the Bronte sisters wrote in very different ways. Dickens’s style is full of sentimental realism: he describes reality with a sentimental tone and he mixes comedy and pathos. Conversely, the Bronte sisters are influenced by the preceding Romantic  works, and their novels contain Gothic elements such as ghosts and the dark ominous atmosphere.
 
If  their themes are considered, it is immediately clear that Dickens builds an extraordinary image of the Victorian society, with a wide range of characters and stories  which reveal the conditions of children and the poor; instead the Brontes’ novels contain the Byronic hero, a male figure with a dark past who wants to find some revenge, as Heatcliff in "Wuthering Heights"  or forgiveness as Mr Rochester in "Jane Eyre". In contrast with Dickens, the Bronte sisters deal with love and psychologically complex women as protagonists.

PROPOSED IMPROVEMENTS FOR OUR ENGLISH COURSE

The aim of this report is to inform the committee about the wishes of the students who took part in the survey that was conducted lst week in our school.

NEW FACILITIES

Generally speaking, our school is well equipped. However, there are some defficiencies that could be fixed. Firstly, there is a great demand among our students of a computer room with broadband Internet connection. It is well known that this kind of facility help students make the most of their time while learning English. Secondly, we are in need of a conference room. This will be useful to practise both speaking and listening skills. Finally, it is also recommended to update the books in the library: most of them are quite old and outdated.

ACCOMMODATION

One surprising outcome from the survey was that students do not feel comfortable enough in the residential building. Not only the bedrooms are rather small, but also are they quite cold, because of the lack of a heating system. This is a great problem during the winter: almost every student has suffered from illnesses during that time of the year. There are also numerous complaints in regards to the quality of the food offered in the canteen. It will be advisable to change the catering service.

CONCLUSION

We will be grateful if any of these problems were solved by the committee. In case you need further information regarding any of these issues, please contact us and I will be glad to respond you as soon as possible.

Introduction

The purpose of this report is to suggest ways which will contribute to increasing the number of foreign learners in the school and to make recommendations for future improvements.

Town's entertainment

Although my town is not an enormous industrial center, people are fascinated by the leisure activities provided here. Variety of cafes and clubs would appeal to a great number of foreigners owing to the fast service and the proper attitude to clients. They would also enjoy our museums and galleries which can bring them closer to our history and traditions.

New teaching approaches

More students would be attracted when the school government made some changes in the learning system. I recommend that a more common teaching method should be one-to-one lessons, namely teacher with only one student, as that will contribute to increasing the range of their knowledge and will be also beneficial for students who need more help in a particular subject.

Array of facilities

Dissatisfaction with the school equipment is occasionally expressed by the students. Therefore, it is needed to provide new facilities in the classrooms. Computer-based learning would be a great idea of attracting more foreign students because that will maximize their technological capabilities, so that more work will be implemented.

Improvemnts on socialising opportunities

The school government should offer more extra-curricular activities, including organising excursions in the local area and giving students a chance to choose the school course which appeals to them the most.

Recommendations

I would recommend implementing all the suggestions listed above because these improvements will increase the number of foreign students making their accommodation in the town more pleasant.

However much Roman law, Mosaic law, and rabbinical law impacted lives of Jews living in first-century Israel, many people who followed the religion of Israel lived outside of Palestine and beyond the borders of the Roman Empire. Thus, many of these laws would not have played a big role in their lives.
At the same time, however, anyone professing to be a follower of the God of Israel would have adhered to the Ten Commandments.
The Ten Commandments provide Israel with the moral framework for maintaining it. The metaphor is the Bible uses to express this relationship is covenant. While the metaphor comes from the sphere of international law, it is wrong to understand the commandments merely as a summary of Israel's obligations toward God. . . . Israel obedience to commandments was not a matter of submission to the divine will as much as it was a response to love

Some experts say that public transportation is a crucial part of the solution to the developed nations' economic, energy, and environmental challenges, helping to bring a better quality of life. In increasing numbers, people are using public transportation and local communities are expanding public transport services. Every segment of society - individuals, families, communities, and businesses - benefits from public transportation.

But, in fact,the car provides much better mobility needs, both in the big cities as on the countryside.

Many of us live in a hurry. Our daily life is thoroughly planned, from the morning to the night. We must keep doing our day-to-day concerns at work and at home, and, at the same time, keep holding our social life and entertainment activities.

Modern life orders our days and weeks in a packed schedulle of activities: job, children, housework, fun, free time...
We have to go fast from one place to another, just to be in time for fulfilling next task or activity.
It's for that we need to improve our mobility skills and private transport, as a car, allows us to achieve more efficiently our goals.
Public transport has its advantages: we can say that a lower cost, less pollution and more free time and rest for doing anything else during the trip could be public transport's main positive points.
But, on the other hand, travelling by car gives us more comfort and saves time, and it offers a wider range of choices of departure and routes. 
Every day the science and the industry are developing new materials, technologies and clean energy sources. As industrial and technological development progresses, public transport will lose passengers and the use of private cars will spread anywhere around the world.

Lost for Words?
Have you been studying English for years, but still can't say a word? Do you suddenly lose confidence when you have to speak to someone? I had the same problems, but I've managed to find some ways to overcome them.

First of all, adopting a positive attitude is essential.  You should never be afraid of making a mistake or worry that people will laugh at you.  only then can you really start to speak.  Most people listen for the meaning of what you are trying to say, and do not notice your mistakes.

Secondly, you should try to get as much speaking practice as possible.  In class, answer as many questions as possible, and try to participate in class discussions.  When you are on holiday, try to make contact with other English-speakers, and who knows?  You might make some good friends in this way.

My problem has always been vocabulary.  i find watching TV programmes in English and reading increase my exposure to new words, and help me recycle words I know in new contexts.

I hope that you will find my suggestions useful.  Don't waste any more time! Get speaking English now!

This is a very common argument: the true genius stands out so much that can not be misunderstood, so if he is not recognized then he is not a genius. But this is faulty reasoning: it accept the idea that a genius is always recognized on the basis that in history geniuses have always been recognized - which is not true, or at least is not demonstrable. They take for granted that historically geniuses have always been recognized, but in reality they are only talking about geniuses that, in fact, have been recognized. They know nothing of those who have not been recognized and that may have been completely erased from history, and therefore cannot be used as an opposite example. To sum up, because the geniuses that we have decided to recognize as such have been recognized, they argue that all the geniuses are always recognized: pure self-referential nonsense.
In the 19th century for some, such as Cesare Lombroso, geniality resembles mental illness. For Lombroso exceptional people are independent, away from the banality of life, isolated, impatient, asocial, often considered crazy.

The time in the university is the most important time in our lives because, we learn lot of things and it prepares us for our future career. Some may think that it is better to have classes with discussion of professor and student .Others may disagree. They prefer classes with lecture and almost no discussion. In my opinion classes with discussion are better.
First, classes with discussion between professor and student had an advantage for the student because they learn how to interact with their fellow student. Doubtlessly, such interactions with other people will help you to broaden your mind and learn new things. This will enrich your personality. For instance, a year back I was in north Texas university in USA, there was a health management and policy class with almost no lecture but with lot of time for open discussions. In the beginning, I thought this was disadvantage but this was not true. On one day we spoke about medical treatment cost in different country and one of my friend, Wole was from Nigeria. Consequently, he was able to tell us how the cost of the treatment are less, how doctors are dedicated, and how everybody has access to primary health care. As a result we all know what to be done so that we can make little changes in the reform to lessen the cost of the treatment. As you can see, open discussion in the class are really important since they broaden your horizon and help you to understand different nation’s policies.
Second, open discussion in the class help you to develop certain skills in order to become an independent thinker and speaker. It is evident that independent speaking and thinking skills are valuable for your career. For instance, I was really afraid of speaking in front of many people. However, this health management and policy class with open discussion was helpful for me insofar as I learned how to speak in front of others. In order to get good grades we are forced to participate in   discussion. As a result I overcome my anxiety and started speaking in front of those students and I found its not difficult as I expected. This experience taught me that it is better ti participate in a class with open discussion because it provide you with speaking and thinking abilities which are imperative for your career.
All in all though some may oppose my opinion, it is clear that classes with open discussion and almost no lecture are preferable because interaction with other student will broaden your mind and you become  a better speaker and thinker.  That is why every university should offer such classes.

Tom woke up as a beam of sunlight slanted through a crack in the wall of the old cabin. He stared at the clock hanging in the wall and frowned. It was late, and there was a lot of work to do, so he'd better catch up.

By the time he arrived at the rivershore, some of his colleagues were already digging the ditch.
The river was flowing down with great noise, and its level was slowly rising up, as it had been happening for the last few days. The crops might be flooded very soon if they didn't do anything to avoid it.

Everybody was there: the Smiths, with their three broad-shouldered sons; the Newtons, who even brought some of their stallions to help us remove the earth and the stones; and the slim guy who lived in the farm in the northern hills of the valley and whose name nobody knew.  

They worked all day long, restlessly, until they were breathless and their hands were bleeding. Then, they worked a bit more.

Finally, Tom could hear Matthew shouting from the other side of the field. They decided to stop until the next day, as the dig was almost finished. He gazed at it, a bit worried about the possibility of more raining during the night, but proud of having put the farm in shelter.

It had been a very long and tiring day, but Tom felt he had achieved something really good.

We human beings are highly socialized creature in the world. Therefore, it is inevitable that we have to learn to be part of the society. Parents, in some cases, are mentors to children. However, considering the complexity of the society, I believe it better to learn in schools rather than from parents.

First of all, there is no denying that parents may teach their children enormous fundamental living skills, on which their progeny count. Nevertheless, the skills are not diverse enough for children to deal with specific problems when living in a complex society. For example, one of my senior high school's classmate had encountered communication problem involved in the other's family. As a consequence, they never talk to each other since then.

Following the previous paragraph, there will always be people of different living styles, attitudes, and beliefs in every aspect of one's life. Have we not lived and learned the skills in a group, especially in school, we will not be skilled before entering the society. 

The society as a whole is a place where both competition and cooperation take turn continuously influence every member. If we only live in our original family, parents will probably forgive us when we make mistakes. In contrast, living in a society is another story: people might blame, compete, or even hurt others no matter who you are. Learning in schools, however, provides valuable opportunity for children to learn not only from teachers, but also from relationships between peers, and as a result, proves the way for being independent in the future. 

In a nutshell, there is a great deal of knowledge needs to be gained for children in order to live in a society. School, a place with diverse students along with their attitudes towards lives, might be better than learning merely with the parents.

The best sport in the world.

Have you ever tried unsuccessfully more than 5 sports in only one month? I have. Although it's true that I don't actually love sports, once I found golf it totally engaged me! 

By playing golf you can enjoy a wonderful journey in touch with the nature and even with some friends, while you do some healthy, constant and not too tiring exercise! If you like the great views from a high hill, as well as having a relaxing time with yourself or sharing it with other people, golf is the perfect sport for you.

The only disadvantage I could find is that golf isn't such a cheap sport to do, as it requires a lot of expense and also a good mental and psychological health, which is the first thing I recommend to work on if you want to enjoy golf from the beginning. 

However, as long as you can afford it and you're provided with patience and enthusiasm, you shouldn't miss the opportunity to play this amazing sport. I totally encourage you to try it at least once and I'm sure you will desire to repeat!

Sometimes it seems to me that there is an ocean outside. It slowly rustles and clatters and it’s pulsing waves attract so much that you can’t stand sitting still much longer and you are ready to throw up everything and run towards it. However, at the last moment, you understand that the ocean is there, in eternally beloved Spain. 

Long before our journey I knew that I would love this country, I would fall in love with ocean and sea once for all. I was wrong only about one thing: I had loved it long ago. I had been adoring the sea and dreaming about it when I had never seen it before, never heard it before, but definitely felt it not by skin but my heart. 

We spent ten days on the Atlantic seaboard, in a small town – Cádiz. The main advantage of it is that the ocean is always near at hand, no matter in what part of the town you are. Like in all the seaside towns, it’s always windy there. The wind is often strong and cold, and it blows off hats and tousles the hair in such a way that it can’t be combed any more. So, that’s why I gave up the idea to do it and decided to be a shaggy-girl=)

Also I remember sweat perfume of Spaniards (and Spain itself), spreading through the streets of old town and mixing with the smell of fried fish that is ready to be served in numerous bars, cafes and restaurants. I remember the warmth of twilight wnich lures you to the heart of this town. I remember the laugh of people, sitting at the tables and chatting. I remember children, running about the small squares in fronf of the cathedrals; elderly people in wheelchairs...

All these memories are always with me, and to go through them again I don’t even need to close my eyes, everything in my mind heart is too vivid to forget.

Today I am writing about learning another language. It could seem something very useful, with no drawbacks, but each coin has a head and a tail.

Learning another language is a wonderful way of learning about another country. Check the languages you know and compare them to the people from those countries. A language it is the capital thing to learn because it is the way people communicate and organize their thoughts.  Furthermore, it gives you the chance to enjoy the works done in that language. That's an incredible opportunity.

Nevertheless, when you are learning a language, it brings confussion. You need to change the way you organize your thoughts in order to master it. On the one hand the old one could be hard wired into your brain. On the other hand, the new language needs an additional effort. It also has another negative effect, you have limited time on this planet. There are an incredible amount of things to learn. Why would you waste your time learning a new language, when you probably do not know enough about your own. 

In summary, learning a language is something beautiful, useful and entertaining. It can be hard and it has its downsides. But, as a learner of my third language, I am a firm believer it is the right choice.

Is change always good?


 Change is always good. But sometimes the pace of change, the direction of change or the consequences of change can make it no good at all.
   Life implies change. No change, no life. Nature is life and death, construction and destruction. No change, no Nature. To stop the change is impossible That would be against Nature and against ourselves. Every human action provokes a reaction. Every single word causes a gesture, a thought, a change in the others. Every step marks a footprint in the ground. The smallest work changes the environment. Any decision changes future.
   Life is change. But this change has a rhythm and it is better to respect it. 
Life and change have also a direction, an aim: growth. Everything that doesn’t grow is dead, and death is the opposite of life.
   To inhibit the growth of a living being is a cruelty, but sometimes it happens. Think of those Chinese women obliged to constrain their feet. Think of  the Olympic Champion Nadia Comaneci ,artificially stopped in her physical development   to preserve her graceful childish body.
   Equally cruel, it is, in my opinion, to accelerate the pace of growth by forcing .children to work like adults or by inducing little girls to dress and behave as femmes fatales in video-clips or magazine covers.
   Nature is also change, but in a cycling direction, and in a natural rhythm : the movement of celestial bodies, the rotation of Earth, the alternation of days and nights, the sequence of seasons…, in short, the wheel of life.
  We lived in a time of accelerated changes. Technology allows us to do and learn in one life’s time more things than our ancestors were able to in several generations. But at the same time we are working against Nature – let’s think of pollution and climate change – and against our own human nature: distress, allergies, strokes and heart attacks are nowadays more and more frequent.
  I think we should readjust the rhythm of change in order to be able to reinterpret, in a positive sense, Lampedusa words “everything must change so that everything can stay the same”.

Shopping is very important for people. It helps to cope with stressful situations. While shopping, you are doing what you like and enjoy. But some people can get annoyed by this kind of activity. They may be irritated by loud music in the shopping areas, long queues at the cash desk and crowds of customers everywhere. Some people can be called shopaholics, as they can't live without new clothes and furniture. I don't belong to any of these groups, because I am not addicted to shopping, but I do love the process of choosing clothes, shoes and accessories. I hate going shopping with my father as he is always advising stupid stuff. However, I find shopping with my mother pleasant and easy, as we have the same interests and tastes. She helps me to make the right choice and never looks at the prices. Actually, this is a wrong idea, because I must not waste money on things that are not worth buying.
