The European Union is created and meant to be an organization that helps all of its members to develop economically and socially while contributing to the common good of the whole union itself. It works towards allowing all the EU citizens to travel and work freely no matter which country they are from. Migration is a factor all countries must consider in order to move forward. Everyone must be accepted and integrate in a specific society. All current 27 nations must work both individually and together for the best conditions of immigrants. There should be a working network for providing suitable jobs and standard of living to those, of course, who are looking to work and contribute to society, and do not simply expect to lay on the back of a more economically developed countries.
Many non-EU citizens live and work in Europe but for this to be successful they have to be able to integrate into their receiving society. They should be able to enjoy the same rights and responsibilities as EU citizens. Europe needs  bright young people with an urge, with a wish to be productive, to create a better future for themselves and for their children.Migration brings all the cultural wealth and diversity in Europe and integration is an expression of civic cohesion, contributing to political stability .

First priest to realize that church wine is not real blood.
"The taste of my blood was completely different from the Sacred Blood".

In 2015, after 30 years of service in the Church of the Sacred Heart in Peluzuchampa, north of Bolivia, the priest Inocencio Raudales, 66 years old, realized that the wine drunk at the moment of communion is not the truly blood of Jesus Christ, as he has thought for his whole life.
"I realized about this fact last December when I cut my finger while I was cooking and I sucked the blood that was flowing from the wound". Inocencio, surprised by this discovery, asked to his partners in the Order of Saint Bartolo about the taste of their blood, incredibly, after a needlestick in their fingers, all the priests from the congregation agreed that their blood did not taste like the wine converted in Holy blood at the church.
At that time, the Order sent to Vatican an urgent message and called the press for making the announcement of the discovery. At this press conference Inocencio assured that next year he will try to prove if pigeons truly represent the Holy Spirit.

Hello, Alison!

 I´m glad to hear from you again! I have to say that you should write in your work that the traditional Portuguese food is delicious! What can I say? 
 Usually my eating habits are similar to the most Portuguese; I have my breakfast around 7.30 and 8.00, I eat bread with cheese or jam and I drink a large glass of milk with cereals. At lunch many people eat a lot! I start with a small soup and then I have the main dish and the desert. If I have some time before 14.00, I love to have a coffee with friends – in Portugal everyone drinks an espresso! In the afternoon I eat some cookies. Finally, I have dinner with my family - always at 20.00! We eat a light meal and fruit. 
 What is my favourite Portuguese meal? It's pork which is seasoned with red wine and, then, is well braised. But the most famous dish uses cod.

 Good luck! Best wishes!
 Andreia

He had a long day ahead of him. Tom was the kind of person that is always there for his friends. He was always doing things for them or anyone who asked him. He lived in Toronto, which is cold city, but which is even colder at 5 am, the time when Tom`s day began.
 Tom had a series of things he had to do for his friend Rob before 2 pm and had to start as fast as he could. His first stop was the car garage where he had to pay and take his friend Rob`s car. The price was supposed to be 10 pounds, but they end up being 25 pounds, so Tom had to put money from his own pocket. As a concecuence, he had no money to pay for a sod, so he was thirsty all morning. 
 After taking the car out of the garage, he had to drive all the way to the airport and wait for Rob to come. But the plane had a delay of 20 minutes. Tom was getting really anxious , worryng that he would never make it back to his job at 2 pm, the flight arrived. Tom drove  back to town and then walked really fast to his work. 
 It was a quarter to two, so tom laid back in his chair, took a big breath and waited for his workmates to come.
It had been a very long and tiring day, but Tom felt he had achieved something really good.

Welcome to Russia! Everybody visiting this country would like to see the most important sights, and I might be helpful there. How about Red Square? It is one os the most significant places in our capital, Moscow. First of all, I would like to make it clear that "red" is not related to the colour only, this word also means "beautiful" in Russian. Then, this is the spot where all-nation celebrations take place, like civil and military parades or seeing the New Year in! Moreover, in Red Square one can see the Muasoleum, which is also can be called one of the symbols of our capital and the country. The amazing Saint Basil's Cathedral is located nearby. If you visit my country one day, I will certainly be pleased to show you Red Square and everything I've told you about. I am proud of my country!

What is cultural literacy?
I was researching some definitions of cultural literacy. It seems to me that the following definitions show an overall context of what is cultural literacy. 
Cultural literacy is the ability to understand and participate fluently in a given culture. Cultural literacy is Knowing about and respecting the cultures of others. In order to be culturally literate, you need to be familiar with all manner of things, from Waterloo, Hamlet and “Call me Ishmael,” to the Wife of Bath, the Magna Carta, Tutankhamen, the Pythagorean Theorem and 1066. To be familiar with something is far different from being an expert in it, and it’s entirely manageable.
A literate reader knows the object-language's alphabet, grammar, and a sufficient set of vocabulary; a culturally literate person knows a given culture's signs and symbols, including its language, particular dialectic, stories, entertainment, idioms, idiosyncrasies, and so on. 
The culturally literate person is able to talk to and understand others of that culture with fluency, while the culturally illiterate person fails to understand culturally-conditioned allusions, references to past events, idiomatic expressions, jokes, names, places, etc.
According to UNESCO literacy is at the heart of basic education for all and that creating literate environments and societies is essential for achieving the goals of eradicating poverty, reducing child mortality, curbing population growth, achieving gender equality and achieve sustainable development, peace and democracy.
My personal opinion cultural literacy is the way to understand, learn and know about other cultures. Also you can be understood by other cultures.

Nowadays, the majority of teenagers are not so close with their families as they used to be and mostly they are farther apart from their parents. The age between 13 to 19 is the revolutionary one. It has been shown that they get along better with their siblings than their parents.
    I share this opinion with the revolutionary ones. I get along with my siblings very well but we do not see each other very much. As a result, we often communicate and we do not exchange opinions as much as other families do. I do not consider them to be my best friends because I cannot speak with them as freely as with my friends. Not to mention that when I am trying to talk to them they always space out and then say that they have their own problems. That really gets on my nerves. A friend will stay on and listen to you in patience. 
    To sum up, I do not consider my family to be my best friends and neither they do.

I think it is fair to say basketball is one of the most popular sports on the planet, both in number of viewers and players. There is probably an array of motives to explain such phenomenon but for me that happens for one particular reason; the shot clock. The shot clock is a timer that dictates the amount of time during which one team can maintain possession of the ball. The idea behind it is to quicken the pace of the game and preventing it from becoming stalled. A corious fact is that out of the five most popular sports in the world only basketball keeps track of possession time and to me that's exactly what sets him apart from the others.

While watching or playing any kind of sport, there's nothing worse than a team or a player trying to waste time untill the clock runs out, the game becomes dull and boring and you can't enjoy the excitment that only the uptempo style of play can provide. The bottom line is; a fast paced game is a much more exciting experince for players and viewers as opposed to a slow paced one and that makes the "shot clock" fundamental to the dynamics of the game.

And for anyone trying to become a good basketball players the two most important things to understand (as it is for most sports in general) are the values of practice and awareness. Practice is the one thing that can increase the probability of desireable results and awareness is what gives you the ability to adapt to different situations, and the combination of the two is the only way to success, so if you want to be a good player you need to put your energy and focus on practice and stay alert and surveing the court at all times so you can be aware of what is happening around you.

Some people claim that the youth of today is less healthy than they were two decades ago. Although several causes for this problem can be found in the modernisation of our society, this modern society can also provide solutions for the amelioration of the level of fitness of young people.
One of the reasons for the worsening of the health of young people is the increasing use of cars. Nowadays, parents take their children everywhere by car, whereas they would have to go everywhere by bike or by foot twenty years ago. This is a result of the decreasing price of cars due to innovation in the car industry, which enabled more and more people to buy a car (and use it).
However, possibilities to make the youth healthier are also provided by our modern civilisation. For example, commercials can be used to stimulate youngsters to take up exercise by showing the positive effects.
In conclusion, I feel that not only the ground for the low level of fitness of today's youth, but also the clue to get youngsters fitter, lies in the modernity.

Good thriller movies have become increasingly rare in the last few years, and to find some among big productions casting famous actors is even harder, if not impossible. Most of these, in fact, have very predictable plots, are full of cliches and since it's so easy to figure out how they will end, they are usually very boring. This is why I was very surprised when I came out of the theater after seeing "Looper" and thought "Hey, I just saw a thriller with Bruce Willis in it, and it was actually a really good one!" 
The story is set in the future, about thirty years from now, when time travel had been invented but was used only by criminal organizations who sent those they want killed in the past where a professional killer, a looper, was waiting for them and for the silver strapped to their body. The main character is Joe, a looper who has to face an older version of himself sent back in time to be killed. By letting his older self go Joe changes his past, and therefore his future, leading to a series of unexpected events, and to an even more unexpected ending!
My expectations were not very high, but I have to say the movie was surprisingly good, in fact it was not boring at all, and had a few big twists which took me completely by surprise. 
Time travelling is only a means to the development of the story, and the future society is quite similar to the present one, so even if you are not big science fiction fans, I suggest you give this movie a chance, I am sure you won't be disappointed.

text:
In the competitive world that we inhabit, dominating a technique and having a deep knowledge of a given field is essential for both academic and professional success. We've reached a point where this training starts at an early age in the form of extracurricular activities, such as music classes, learning languages and playing sports. The inherent tendency to provide the best to our offspring catalyze parents to invest in their kids as to prepare them for an unpredictable future. The haste that results from this process doesn't allow parents to think over some potentially harmful myths that they take for reality, regardless that it may compromise their kid's motivation and self-confidence, all because of their  "is talent innate or can it be acquired?".

Contemporarily, the most wide-spread belief is that some people are born with a talent and some unlucky ones simply aren't. This assertion may boost the confidence of parents whose children show a remarkable ability in the early infancy, as though this capability could be the celestial sign that their toddler is gifted or going to grow as child prodigy. The adepts of this idea usually mention extraordinary people in order to reinforce their own believe in their child's potential to become a known genius. One of the most common examples is Beethoven, known for composing high-quality piano pieces as a young child. Little known is what was the role played by music in his life and how was his relationship with it previous to his first deed. Admittedly, I don't know it myself.

Any one who challenges the aforementioned common-sense isn't immediately drawn to embrace and believe the less common, but still popular and not scientific, concurrent idea. Many do believe that a talent can be taught, although not so easily. The "10 000-hours rule" is said to have a scientific base, in spite of the fact that most of its defendants have never read the study that stablished it. According to this rule, any person can develop a talent after 10 000 hours of training. This amount of time doesn't fit normal workers and students' tight schedules and busy daily lives, therefore being labeled as unpractical and unachievable. The normal response to this conclusion is, as I and many people who gave up learning a language simply because fluency is out of reach if you don't have this time available, is the loss of motivation.

The main problem of having these two perspectives on talent is that both of them are basically negative. Either of them put a heavy burden on parents and on their children. One asserts that talent is a matter of luck; the second, of pure time demanding and presumably expensive dedication. Clearly, both rely on the common beliefs to be sustained. As any other unscientific "truth" that circulates and cause harm to our society, this one can only be eliminated through the reading of scientific and specialised  publications on the topic, so that the effective manners of becoming talented in something can be adopted, before the popular believes take our motivation and self-belief away.

This research project will provide us with better understanding and insights into this area through the EM trainees’ narratives and experiences of clinical reasoning development in ED and add to the scientific discourse in clinical reasoning. As discussed, clinical reasoning is still poorly understood and a variety of ways of articulating and conceptualizing clinical reasoning can provide  richer means of understanding what is involved in clinical encounters (Loftus, 2012). A narrative approach to explore and investigate clinical reasoning development can provide a vocabulary that encourages us to integrate insights from different frameworks in ways that combine the strengths of each.

Dear John,
I live in Italy and you should know that food is very important for us! Many people do breakfast in the bar with an espresso or a cappuccino and a croissant. In the morning we're not used to eating salty food like salami, eggs or cheese.
Working people usually have lunch at about 13.00 and they have something simple such a pasta or a sandwich and a coffee because the break is short and they have to go back to work and need to be concentrate and don’t get asleep!
During the day Italian people drink a lot of coffee and everyone has a coffee maker at home!
Young people do not drink coffee: they prefer to drink Coke while eating junk food, which is cheaper and tastier than pastasciutta.
The time for dinner is not the same in all parts. In northern Italy people eat at about 19, whereas in southern Italy they eat at about 21. I get home late and I have no time to cook elaborate meals so I usually cook a  steak with vegetables. Sometimes I give myself a slice of homemade cake. Italian eat also a lot of fruits like apples, oranges and other fruit of the season.
On Saturdays or Sundays we don't have to work, so we have time to cook and we prepare typical Italian food with two or more courses.
I really like the lasagna, made with a flat and long pasta with bechamel, tomatoes and meat and I love the pasta Amatriciana made with spaghetti, fresh tomatoes, bacon and a typical Roman cheese called pecorino. Another typical dish from the northern Italy (it comes from the mountains) is pizzoccheri which is a wheat pasta topped with cabbages, butter and typical cheese.
Every region has a typical food and a typical cheese. I once read that in Italy we produce 450 different cheeses and I don't think a foreigner would try them all!
I’m talking about Gorgonzola cheese, which tastes really strong and isn't very nice because it has a blue mould inside. 
I remember having tasted the "casu marzu", a typical Sardinian cheese which has some little worm inside!
However, eating is for us a tradition that puts the families together and recipes are handed down from generation to generation.
I hope I've helped you!
Best wishes,

Roberta Trentino

What happened to me is not the reason for my mood but I'm sure it contributed. My first night here I was invited to a dinner mainly for scientists who are up here doing a radio show. I'm placed next to Brain Cox and something inside me wilts because I know I am sitting next to a superior being and he will soon find out I'm a two-celled worm. I am next to someone who knows what happened to make the big bang, he sees atoms and electrons and even knows what they are. He doesn't think about things that I, a mere mortal does, like whether or not there is food on my teeth, and death. To me he is greater than any rock star squared.

Dear Sirs,

I would like to apply for the job you advertised last week because I am quite sure I would be perfectly suitable for the post.

First of all, let me introduce myself. I am 30 years old. I am an English teacher here in my country, Spain, and I have worked with children aged 5-14 for five years now in different educational centres. I am quite enthusiastic about being with kids. I guess that is why I am a bit workaholic. I love playing sports, singing, swimming, doing handcrafts, and cooking as well. I enjoy teamwork, and I always share new ideas and good experiences with my colleagues. I am a sociable and supportive person. I have a great character.

Now, in relation to the job tasks I would have to perform, I feel totally capable of doing all of them with enthusiasm and effectiveness. I am an excellent cook. I am quite good at organising sport events and games. Moreover, I will not have trouble taking care of children -I will be a great companion for them. Students always love the activities I design for them. They have so much fun!

Thus, I think I am the right person to work at any of your summer camps and I am sure you will be satisfied with my work. Working there would be a great opportunity for me. I could learn more about American culture and people. I know I would benefit a lot from the experience.

I am looking forward to hearing from you soon.

I am also a Spanish Red Cross camp leader, as I fancy all kinds of sports such as swimming, sailing, kayaking, rock climbing, etc.  I also have a high level of spoken English because for 8 years I had been attending a summer camp in Scotland, where lately I was asked to carry on as instructor. 
As a result, I have some relevant experience for this job since I have been working for two years as summer camp instructor for a company in Scotland where I have been in charge of fifteen children aged eight years.
I would be suitable for the job advertised because I am extrovert, easygoing, hardworking, thoughtful, and love children and practising outdoor activities such as camping, fishing and cooking, I also enjoy teaching children new skills and helping them to develop their self-confidence.
I would welcome the chance of being part of your company's team since it is a world renowned firm and I am available to travel and change of residence. Because of this, I would be grateful if you could send me information regarding incorporation to the organization (date, conditions, etc)
If you require any further information, please contact me at +34 622 22 22 22 or rTD6hJ@gmail.com.
Looking forward to hearing from you.
Yours faithfully,
Laura Smith.

Although educated people in the past had the same desire to learn as educated people today, those who were considered educated in the past would be considered less educated today. That's because there're many scientific facts have been revealed. Furthermore, information about these facts have become much more available. Also, people today tend to get higher degrees than people in the past.
The great expansion of knowledge makes people more educated than before. Today, people know more about phenomena that were considered obscure in the past. For example, people today know more about space, genetics, and diseases. That makes them more educated.
Furthermore, it's easy to know about these valuable discoveries. There're many more libraries and learning courses available than before. In addition, information about anything can be found easily on the Internet.
In the past, graduating from high school was considered an achievement; today it's not. To be considered well educated, people should graduate from a college. Also, there're more people who continue their education after graduation from college. 
In conclusion, the average level of education in the past isn't enough today to be considered educated.

This winter, I may be able to travel to Cornwall, UK. Going to the UK has been a dream of mine but going to Cornwall, however, might be a little of an escapade during the winter, considering that I'm only used to the relatively hot Egyptian weather. I have read that Cornwall is usually flooded in winter, and that the weather might make transportation a pain. However, I'm interested & excited about the journey because it will allow me to have a myriad of new experiences. On the other hand, I hear people are generally convivial and  nature is beautiful in Cornwall.

I hope that my fortitude will help me during this short sojourn. My life has been on a boring plateau for a while now and I was looking for a change as well as more personal burgeon.

A historical place of importance in my country.



There is a place, in my country, which played a very important role during World Ward II. This is a forest, crossed by the border between France and Switzerland. As it was full of spruces, it was easy to hide from the German patrols and people from both sides of the border helped Jewish, spies and English, Canadian or American pilots to flee through Switzerland.

A net took place from South of France to Switzerland, espescially to try to save thousands of Jewish children. People who participated to that "way to freedom" never asked anything in exchange. They did it freely. They never spoke about it till a few years ago, as they were considered like criminals by their countries as they had broken the law during that time.
But now, they told the whole world about it, some of them are now considered as heroes in Insrael for what they did during these hard times.

Their story was written and folks finally could discover what happened there between the years nineteen thirty-nine and nineteen forty-five.

Last month a monument was erected in their memory so that nobody forgets what happened in that large forest where - as the people would say in that time - German soldiers cannot guard all wood, unless they stood behind each spruce....

Nowadays, public transport is a useful and convenient way of travelling, especially for students, people with low socioeconomic status or for everyone who wants to go to work or school by bus, train or by subway.

It's also true that more people have cars than maybe 30 of 40 years ago. Cars are a good way of saving time especially when waiting for public transport, mainly, buses. But a disadvantage it that cars maintenance and gas is more expensive than paying for public transport.

On the other hand, cars are always there when you need them and you don't have to depend on anything when you have a car. Airplanes are becoming more and more useful for people who travel for work or even want to get to another place quicker and safer.

I also think that there would be fewer people using public transport in the future but some will still be available because it won't be possible for everyone to afford to have a car or travelling by plane.

As in all educational processes, assessment of the programme planning must take place. There are different ideas to be considered as far as assessment is concerned. In the first place, we have to know why we evaluate. The function of evaluation and assessment must not only be the recognition of the results of the learning process itself, but also how this process took place, therefore we will need to use different instruments of assessment. After the assessment and evaluation we will be able to adjust the necessary pedagogic help to individual students, know up to which point the proposed aims have been achieved and we will be able to judge the programme planning as a whole.
Assessment and evaluation will provide information, as well for the teacher as for the students. The teacher will understand the student’s difficulties better; s/he will know the level of assimilation of the different kinds of contents and be able to modify future programme planning. As far as the students are concerned, they will be able to correct inadequate strategies or behaviour, know the difficulties they encounter in the learning – teaching process and evaluate their proper process.
Secondly, we must be sure of what to assess and evaluate. As to the students, we will have to consider the knowledge and skills they have acquired, their attitudes and their social behaviour. As to the teacher, we will find out whether the programme planning was adequate or not and if s/he was sufficiently implied in the learning – teaching process. Thirdly, we have to keep in mind the instruments for assessment and evaluation we are going to use.

Society is continually changing, ever since we create the first civilizations. However, it has a special importance nowadays, in a world that moves so quickly.

The first thing that comes to mind on this subject is technology. It has such a quick growth that it's impossible to predict how much transformation it will suffer. It should make a lot of tasks easier and more efficient but, apart from that, I don't expect it to have a deep impact on our lives, considering other aspects that will certainly overcome this one.

That brings us to second point: resources. As the population grows exponentially, the resouces fail to go along. We have just started worrying about that but the actions in course are far from enough. The hard truth is that until somenoe has to face the situation himself, it's quite difficult to restrain from wasting energy, food, materials, water... But in the near future most of us will have to deal with it and therefore be forced to make dramatic changes in our lives in order to survive.

Finally, and on a more positive tone, we´re walking towards a global world. This means borders are getting thinner and thinner, and cultures more and more similar. As this may cause us to lose traditions and cultural identity, it will definitely bring more opportunities for everyone.

The pupils have been taught English since their very first meeting with the English language in school so they are completely familiar in using English as classroom language. In this course design we have also chosen activities that we consider suitable to be taught about in English. The only place where we could imagine a challenge in sticking to English as the classroom language is when the group works. 
The evaluation starts by unfolding the brain storm from day 1, and then it continues by the pupils applying all their new words and knowledge about America. Hereby we want to create consciousness in the pupils`minds about their new knowledge. The end of the evaluation is that every pupil writes a post-it note that answers the following questions: What have I learned from this course? What did I like most about this course? How could the course be improved? Hereby we both want the pupils to reflect their learning and bring the teacher valuable information for the next time.
In this class there are strong wishes about certain areas regarding America that the pupils want to learn: 10 pupils would like to learn about American High School Life, 4 pupils would like to learn about National Parks in America, 4 pupils would like to learn about Native Americans and 1 pupil would like to learn about American Motor Industry. 
Taking the importance of learner autonomy and the importance of the pupils`motivation into consideration we have decided that they can follow their interests in this course. This also gives the pupils the possibility of presenting their classmates to new knowledge - and the communicative situation is authentic.

Kyiv is a good destination for the shoppoholics. Here you can find well-known brands as well as locally produced items. For those interested in top fashion brands I would recommend visiting the shops in the main street. The best manufacturers of clothes, linnen, accessories have their shops there. Jewellery and watch shops can also be found nearby. For those who are looking for cheap, but practical clothes I will recommend to go to one of the shopping malls of the capital. Mass market clothes, bags, cosmetics, children toys are represented there. There are also supermarkets in each shopping mall, where you can buy food and beverages as well as housekeeping items. If you are interested in local design, vintage clothes and remarkable souvenirs, go to the historical center of the city. Different shops will offer a wide range of goods and impresse with interesting design ideas and unique style. The main shopping mall of the city is under reconstruction at the moment, but in one year it will be open for visitors and will surprise them with high tech design and exclusive brands. And if you try to find a good product for a reasonable price visit the city's outlet - collections of the previous years are sold there with significant discounts.

Peace and fulfilment of humankind's potential.

Why people become homeless? One of the reasons is they are poor because they cannot get a job. I believe we can decline the number of homeless people in Japan by providing them with information and skills.

 Those who become homeless usually do not know that there is a system to help poor people. For example, if they do not have enough money that is needed to have home and to buy things necessary to live, they can get a financial support by government. However, those who do not know about it cannot get such support. Homeless people tend to unable　to collect information because of lack in means to do it.  We need to let them get information. 
 
 Skills are also needed to get a job. The skills include the ability to communicate with people and to conquer hardships. I have seen a TV program about homeless people. In the program, one homeless man quit his job because he could not have a good relationship in the office. He tried several jobs but he could communicate well in none of them. He was tired of himself, lost interest in working and became homeless. Then, he came to know that there was a class that provide homeless people with skills of cleaning floor for free. He decided to join the class. Sometimes the lesson was hard, but the staff there praised him when he did well. Little by little, he grew interest in working. He came to know how pleasant it is to overcome hard situations. He also learned to how to build a good relationship with people through talking his fellows. He finally wanted to find a job again. If more lessons like this are provided and more homeless people get the skills, the problem of homelessness will become less serious.

 To conclude, giving information about support that they can receive from the government, and skills is very helpful way to solve homelessness in Japan.

At the moment, all governments around the world argue about climate change. Some of them think global warming is the most significant problem, despite others believe deforestation has a higher impact on our world. Now I will discuss both sides.

On the one hand, global warming is a result of many emitted toxic gases. These are, for example, carbon dioxide and methane. As we all know, trees store carbon dioxide. So, we can say, with less deforestation there would be less global warming. But what are the results of global warming? The primary outcome is the increasing temperature, and this leads to melting glaciers. These glaciers are habitat for polar bears and many other arctic animals. The melting glacier will bring a higher sea level. That means coastal cities will be flooded. This flooding leads to starvation because of fewer harvest yields and this creates many refugees.

On the other hand deforestation is, as said, another part of global warming due to less carbon dioxide storing trees. But incinerate a huge part of the rainforest means a destruction of the habitat of wildlife. Global warming is a primary cause of starvation but also does deforestation. Because the roots do not hold the fertile soil, and now, it will be blown away by the wind. 

To sum up both issues have enormous impacts on our world. In both animals and people are affected. But in my opinion, you can stop global warming by stopping deforestation first. Then you can focus on global warming.

Michael and Cecilia had been married for 6 years. 
Even though their couple was of the quarelling type, everyone around them, friends and family agreed on the fact that the pair was as solid as a rock, and despite the ups and downs, love had always won in the end.
But sometimes, Michael had a tendency to go too far with his words. And each time it occurred, Cecilia burst in tears, and Michael had to rock his sobbing wife like a baby. 
They had kept trying to have a baby for years, but despite their attempts, no child ever came.
Michael grew bitter. He was torturing Cecilia with reproaches.
One night he went away slamming the door, still cursing while running down the stairs.
It took him three days to calm down and put the things in perspective.
When he finally came back home, his wife was nowhere to be seen... Michael rushed to the bedroom.
Going straight to the wardrobe, he opened its door. It was empty...  

Michael closed the door and knew at that moment he had made a mistake.

Nowadays, experience is more important than academic knowledge to gain a job. Employers try to find employees that have practical skills rather than formal qualifications. However, experience is extremely important, I disagree that the academics are not important.

First of all, formal education is essential for employees, it is considered as a fundamental basis of any practical job. Success in a job depends on the amount of theoretical knowledge that a person had in academic institution. In addition, every phenomenon is based on theory. When employees face any problems or difficulties in work, it must be referred to the theory that explain this phenomenon, without knowing this theory employees can’t overcome these difficulties, for instance, engineering science seems practical, but each part of engineering science is based on theories. Thereby, engineers must take demanding knowledge to be successful in a career. 

Second of all, theoretical qualifications are crucial for employees, as it helps t people to think and solve all problems in a fair way. Scientific approach is more important to deal with problems, beginning with determining problems and then studying all factors and related information. Then employees are able to suggest the best solution, this approach is  developed in formal education. Moreover, studying in a university provides an opportunity to interact with a wide range of people and thus build unique communication skills that are very important for employees. Finally, knowledge could make an open-mined person who has ability to deal with problems in fairway. 


To conclude, theoretical knowledge is more important than practical skills. It is the main part that helps employees to be successful in careers. It is certainly true that markets cannot abandon the formal qualification in future.

Some people are convinced that public transport has no future because the car is so much more convenient.  There  is more than one way to look at this statement. The use of  public transport has a lot of advantages, but on the other hand, some disadvantages can be distinguished. It depends on where and what kind of place you want to reach and it depends on the time of the  day
 In this article both sides are discussed. First what are the advantages of using the bus, or train? When traveling to city centers, choosing public transport is to be advised, because parking a car in the city is really expensive and it is very hard to find a space.  When in the center and wanting to enjoy various sights, by car it is hard to get from on place to the other, because the circulation is dense. IN that way it will take a lot of your time, while the bus or tramway have their own bus lanes, and hence are running smoothly. In that case the choice for public transport will be preferable. 
When  traveling to rural areas, it  is quite difficult by public transport, because sometimes there is hardly any no train or bus  for the far out places and the tiny villages. Another problem might be the timetable. Because not may people going to these places, the schedule will be very tight and the bus will only leave once every hour. If there  is a bus or train available, it will stop at almost every village. Most of these buses will make many stops which makes it even more time consuming. 

In the end of the day you should choose public transport or car according to the purpose of your trip. And sometimes public transport is better and sometimes using the car is better.

The Jirga is a ‘traditional system’ of justice, which is actively practiced in, Khyber Pakhtunkhwa , Baluchistan as well as in districts of Sindh bordering with Baluchistan as to resolve legal cases and disputes. The system, which was in practice since the British rule, was modified under the ‘Special Provision Ordinance (Criminal Provisions 11) of 1968’ . Besides dispensing justice and dealing with judicial cases, the Jirga also covers all important aspects of monetary, political, and communal life of tribal society. 
 However, in its present form, the tribal Jirga especially in Sindh province has generated heated debate about its legal position as well as conflict of its rules and codes with the constitution of Pakistan, law of the land or formal justice system as well as international human rights standards and conventions. Strongest allegation on the Jirga system or ‘informal justice system’ has been its unfairness against innocents during the course of decisions and execution on variety of its rules and regulations.
This informal system of justice is being practiced in rural areas of Sindh and Baluchistan. In fact informal justice system is directly proportional to the Jirga that originally owns its roots to Baloch culture and had been transferred to Sindhi society progressively.
“Historically, the Jirga System dates back to the days of Naseer Khan of Kalat, Baluchistan. He was the Khan of Kalat from 1741 to 1795. Naseer Khan was an able General, trained at the court of Ahmad Shah Abdali, the hero of the third battle of famous Pani Pat.”

In recent years, many nations are developing their own economy rapidly, and it takes that many areas of farmlands and forests are being cut down to build a better and bigger house and a more convenient transportation system. However , many countries have become more aware of the environmental issues each nation faces. In my opinion, we need a more convenient life but also to maintain a certain balance.

Frist of all, the biggest problem is that the world's resources are extremely unequal. For example, Japan is the world's third largest economy after the United States and China, its economy is so developed, but food, oil, and other resources are all imported, and it put a lot of heavy industry into developing countries in order to protect its own environment. This has led to a growing gap between the rich and the poor, while the environment is also getting worse and worse. 

Secendly, with the increasing of the earth's population, the area of farmland is also decreasing. People in economically developed areas are in the pursuit of the perfect life and the people in the undeveloped areas are strving. So I think that the government must do something in this respect. 

The government should find a balance point between economic development and agricultural development . I think that it would have to develop science and technology such as Yuan Longping's hybrid rice, or after the food can make people's great and then vigorously develop the economy. As part of the same planet, protecting the global environment is not only the task of the government but also the task of each of us.

I had never felt so nervous before in my life...! I will never forget this particular day.
It was a lovely day. That is why my parents decided to go on a bike trip to the forest outside our city. I had never been there before, so I thought - why not?
We set off at 6 pm and reached our destination an hour later. Suddenly, it got so dark, that I could not see a thing. I started shouting as my parents were out of sight, but nobody answered. After a while I started shaking - I was alone in a forest! I tried to call my mother, but while I was typing her number on the keypad, the battery ran out of power... So there was nothing better to do but stay in the same place and wait for someone to help me. Luckily, it was quite warm, so there was one thing less to worry about.
I did not have to wait so long, though - after a while I saw our car's lights glowing in the darkness. I felt relieved. Next time I will be going on such a trip I need to make sure that I have a fully charged mobile with me.

It was a rainy afternoon, and I had discovered the letter that ruined my life. I would never be the same again. I was at home looking out of the window, when the phone rang. I could never have guessed what was about to happen. While the phone was ringing, I felt shivers down my spine. 

"Hello" I said, feeling like something was wrong, while the person on the other side kept talking. 

And then I heard those three words: "He is dead." 

I rushed to his house, not believing what I had just been told. I got into his bedroom, and there it was: the letter. I suddenly knew what had happened, he took his own life, and my heart broke. I had never expected that. I had lost my best friend, and I could not do a thing about it. 

From that moment on, my life changed forever. There are no words to explain how much I miss him.

Crazy Grandma


Grandparents are the best. I love my grandpa and grandma a lot. Since grandpa passed away I started loving my grandma even more. Grandma is so sweet, but at the same time crazy as well. She does amazing things . I admire her very much. That woman knows how to put a smile on kid's face.

 Granny has grey straight hair, deep blue eyes and tiny nose. She also has pale complexion and black dark circles under  eyes. Grandma's wrinkled face can be horrofying at night. That is why I avoid going to the bathroom at night . 
Fear of seeing granny at night is stronger than anything else . She has a really skinny body, and her hand are long and covered in brown spots. Nana talks in such a peaceful way. Tone of her voice is so gentle and so calm. It calmes me down and freaks me out at the same time.



Parents told me that grandma is a very sick person. When I go to sleep she is constantly sitting beside me. And also she is watching me with eyes wide opened. Lately I couldn't get enough sleep because of that. Nana gives me feeling like I will get killed in my sleep. It feels just like a horror move . Reality is killing me. I love her but she scares the hell out of me. While sleeping I can feel her rubbing my feet  and touching  my head. It is creepy feeling. She doesn't want to leave me. I don't know why. Maybe she is afraid of dying alone. I know she is ill. But I never thought that it can be that serious.



I love my grandma. She might be crazy, but I love her. Feeling scared all the time will not stop me from loving her. Understanding is the most important thing in this world. We will never stop loving our grandparents!

My favourite TV show is "Pretty Little Liars". This show is about four girls, called Aria, Emily, Spencer and Hannah. I love the show, because it is completely thrilling and scary.

If you are a famous person, people believe you have a wonderful life. Nevertheless, being famous has both its benefits and drawbacks. 
First of all, celebrities are usually wealthy, so they have an easier life than other people. Luxurious homes, cars, expensive clothes and other pleasures of life are then available when people become famous. Moreover, they travel all around the world and spend their holidays in expensive resorts, get the best hotel rooms and the most efficient service. 
On the other hand, lack of privacy is a major disadvantage in a famous person's life as their personal life's boundaries are constantly trespassed by paparazzi and journalists. Besides, the more they succeed, the more their fans expect of them to achieve. Owing to this state of constant stress, many of them are bound to have alcoholism problems, drug-addiction and depression.
 In conclusion, fame may be nice but it´s not an easy path to walk on. You have money but you do not feel safe, you have friends but you can never be sure if they like you or your money.

It had been a hot, summer day. Michel’s parents were out so it was the perfect excuse to have an amazing party in the living room, even though they forbid him meeting with friends.
 When the night fall and all the guests had arrived, Michael started to lose control of the situation. Suddenly, a deafening noise coming from the dining room stopped the party but nobody knew what happened. Almost immediately the house was empty, and music turned off, letting Michael realise that his grandmother’s vase valued in £2000 was broken down.
 His parents finally came back after three days but it was obvious that something was wrong. Michael decided to blame the dog for the unfortunate incident and when he told his father what had happened automatically he put the dog up for adoption as it wasn’t the first time, despite of Michael’s attempts to avoid him doing it.
   Once they had arrived to the shelter the family started to say goodbye to the dog crying out loud. Without looking back and getting into the car, Michael closed the door and knew at that moment he had made a mistake.

Very often people say "Family is the most important thing in life" or "My family is my biggest support", and I agree. When something important happens, the first person I will call is a member of my family. But then, every once and a while, one can also hear stories of brothers fighting over the inheritance, or a parent not speaking to their child for making a wrong life decision. In the majority of cases, members of a family have the same blood and genes and they also share living space. This results in common opinions,support when there's a problem and mutual understanding without many words. On the other hand, we tend to have higher expectations and less patience when it comes to our loved ones. The members of your family in deed are your best friends, but only if you don't take them for granted, if you respect them and their space and opinion. One should also bear in mind that sometimes it's necessary to compromise, especially when it comes to material or financial issues. Once you accept that your sibling, although similar, isn't the same as you, or that your child has a different view on their future, it's easier to embrace the differences and be a supportive family member. And at the end of the day, nothing can beat homemade comfort food and a laugh with your family.

I have been asked last week to write a report about the best places for young people in my area. Those are my findings and my recommendations.

1- Facts and Findings.

- The unrivaled place for young people is the municipal center for youth. This innovative center has a lot of first-class facilities for young people. It has a professional rehearsal studio that local music groups can just rent for pocket money, they can also rent instruments by paying a small refundable deposit. A small cinema, a library, games rooms, a TV-room with an enormous flat screen TV where teenagers usually watch football matches, a basic gym, and a little arena.

- The second best place is a private disco for youngsters. It was renewed last year and regulars like it a lot. The main problem is the high price of the tickets. Kids have to pay 10 euros just for the entrance getting anything else.

- There is another place where local youth spend a lot of hours the new and magnificent mall. It has 150 stores and about 40 fast food shops. They especially like the music store and a magnificent t-shirt store owned by two local designers, there you can design your own item and collect it the following week.

These are the main places where young people usually go.

The importance of cleanliness around us is not understood till it takes a toll on our health. An individual must be aware of the result of his act on the environment, be it due to personal or professional act, in order to maintain it in healthy state. In Clayton, my hometown, people are fond of maintaining the environment and they actively participate in encouraging the ones who try to work towards its progress as well as in protesting against the ones who tend to cause harm to it. 

The municipal board of Clayton conducts meetings fortnightly to communicate about the improvements that have been made and that have been planned to be implemented in future in the town. Representatives elected by respective communities attend the meeting. It is then their responsibility to communicate the message to all members of their community. These meetings are organized according to their planned schedule and the results were surprising. Earlier, regardless of whether the rubbish was recyclable or not, it was disposed off in the same bin. Later, people were educated regarding recyclable, non-recyclable and organic waste and were also informed that the rubbish was to be disposed-off in respective bins. This rubbish was collected by the municipal board on a daily basis and proper disposal methods were employed. 

Development was also happening at the same time which was good for our town, but, lots of trees were also cut down as a result. People started protesting against them to avoid any further damage to the environment. Hence, the municipal board decided to invite the developers as well in the meeting that was scheduled in a weeks time. In the following meeting, it was decided that on the following Sunday everyone will be planting a tree that will be provided by the municipal board for free. On the following Sunday, as discussed, trees were planted and before we realized, they started adding beauty to our town. 

Taking care of environment is everyone's duty and it must be performed responsibly. The municipal board of Clayton does an excellent job in educating its people to keep the environment in a healthy state. I hope people must take them as an example and introduce similar ideas in their own towns or villages. After all, it is the place we all live in.

Peter looked at his watch and knew that he had to do something immediately. He was in a deep forest and a young woman he had just met was about to give birth to her child. Peter had already called an ambulance 30 minutes ago but it seemed that they couldn't find them. He knew he had to do something in this moment because otherwise something bad may happen...
  "Please, do something. I'm scared" sighed the woman whose name was Mindy. Peter took out his mobile, dialed 112 and told the dispatcher about that whole situation. The dispatcher told Peter to calm down and check if he had scissors, towels and water in his car. Then she tried to calm Mindy down and helped Peter to deliver the baby. The dispatcher told him every little thing he had to do. After an hour Mindy was holdin her baby- girl and Peter was trying to realize what had just happened.
  "Never would have I thought that I'll go out of my house and come back as almost an accousher..." thought Peter when he was driving back home.

Computer’s have become an essential part of our lives in the last few decades. They have replaced many things like books. It is true that because of computers, we do many things fast and easily. However, they stopped us from  doing many fun things as well, what are those things, do we really need computers, are they really helping us?
	We use computers to help us with so many different types of things. To begin with, they help us solve really complex mathematical equations. They were invented to help us calculate things in the first place anyway. Computers are an essential part of  NASA, since they try to calculate really complex equations to help them solve the mysteries of space. But us, ordinary people, don’t use computers to solve equations, we use them to type things, print things, design things, make games and to do much more... We made programs that make computers do very interesting things, like graphics. And we use graphics to make all kinds of things, like games or 3D house models that help engineers. Furthermore, the major thing that computers made easier for us is, communication. Humans are social animals, we communicate because communication is in our genes, if we don’t communicate we go insane. So computers help us do that, they help us share our thoughts and feelings with other people easily. Finally, while doing this they actually save us from using a lot of paper. So computers help us with so many things and also save trees.
	In the other hand, computers have very bad effects on both to us, and the environment. For example, research has shown that not computers themselves, but the things we use or play on them are addictive, like social networks or games. Also looking at a screen is tiring for your eyes and if your eyes get too tired they can get damaged forever. Despite the fact that computers decreased the use of paper, they’re still harmful to the environment since they consume tonnes of electricity.
	Computers made our lives easier without doubt, so it is normal that they have some bad effects. There is a saying in Turkish saying ‘If you love a rose, you have to withstand against it’s spikes.’. So it is normal that computers have bad effects on us and the environment. In my opinion computers might be the best invention ever made, since they’ve become an essential part of our daily lives and since we rely on them so much.

Schools and working life: a report
To the Italian education authorities

In this report, I will describe the school system in my country, point out its flaws and conclude giving suggestions about how they could be addressed.

The current situation
In Italy, students have to decide between grammar schools and technical institutes as their secondary school type. Most people think that choosing a grammar school is the best option, because it opens the door to university, while technical institutes are put in a corner. That is actually a mistake, because the schools who best prepare students to working life are technical institutes, who emphasize the real world applications of the studied subjects through laboratories and industry experiences. Conversely, grammar schools extremely focus on theory. In fact, students learn lots of formulas and principles without actually linking them with one another in order to use them in real life. I think that problem should be addressed.

Suggestions
What I would suggest in order to deal with this problem is to integrate more laboratory experiences also in grammar schools, like chemistry experiments or bacteria observation with microscopes. Furthermore, schools should offer a year in industry for students in the last two years, which would not only teach them a lot more than school only would, but it would also attract more people to the school itself.

Conclusion
People should get used to the fact that most companies will also care about your previous work experience, and the idea of gaining that through school would be really appealing.

Subjects that should be taught at school.

Nobody can argue with the fact that education is a relevant period in the development of a child. 
Learning new languages is very important, but also studying subjects related to computers and technology like computer programming is becoming more and more useful than ancient languages like Greek or Latin. This is because technology has become a relevant tool for work and study in particular and an important instrument in life in general .

It is quite evident that learning ancient languages today is not as relevant as it is used to be in the past. 
On one hand, it allows the students to understand and translate ancient texts and helps them to learn about cultures from the past. 
On the other hand, this does not bring too many employment opportunities.
 Recent surveys proved that the study of these languages does not add much to the students future success.

Related to learning computer programming, it guarantees a good living.
It is a known fact that there are very few computer programmers. Furthermore as technology changes more and more, there will be a greater demand of these skills in the future.
It is evident that technology is in every aspect of our lives. 

In conclusion, there are a lot of subjects that might be taught at school, but there is no doubt that Computer Programming should be included as a highlighted subject in the syllabus of any school  serious programme.

Groban: All that echoes
  'All that echoes', by Josh Groban, is the sixth studio album of this American singer and songwriter. It contains twelve tracks to enjoy that you wait impatiently for the next song. That fascinating album surprises not only the variety of subjects but also the strength of instrumental sounds.
  The first single, 'Brave', is a chart-topping song about emotions such as fear and fight. The arrangements are simple and effective and the powerful voice plays harmoniously with the rich sound. It is bound to be at the top of my list. False alarm, which is the second track, is totally different and mysterious because of wealth of musical instruments. Groban sings well-known from the film 'Once" song called 'Falling slowly' in his own fantastic way but listeners get used to the first version might be disappointed. Musically satisfying 'Happy in my heartache' tells the story of tragic love. 
  Once again, Groban fascinates audiences from all over the world with his mature voice and catchy tunes. I definitely recommend that album to your collection. It's a must!

Those days, travelling by car is becoming more popular among urban people. This kind of transport is regarded as a covenient way. Government build more roads and more families are able to afford cars. As a result, some people hold the opinion that in the future, there will be no public transport. However, I disgree with this idea. Instead, I suppose that public transport will play an essential part in future life. There are three advantages of public transport over private cars that I want to explain.
   On one hand, it is enviornmentally friendly to use public transport rather than cars. Nowadays, buses using electronic power instead of petrol have appeared in urban cities. They produce no gas to the air, leading to little air pollution. In the meanwhile, if people prefer to take buses or subways, there will be less noises in the street. On the other hand, buses and subways can accommodate more passengers while a car can only contains 4 to 5 people totally. Compared with cars, public transport has larger capability of conveying, which saves space and costs less. Last but not least, fewer car accidents will happen if people choose to use public transport so traffic jams will be avoided especially in rush hours. Thus, it will be more smooth and pleasant for passengers to travel on the road.
   In conclusion, public transport is a cost-effective way for people to travel, which also contributes to the sustainable development of society.

『Educational institutions have a responsibility to dissuade students from pursuing fields of study in which they are unlikely to succeed.』

The statement claims that the educational institutions are responsible for convincing students not to put too much effort on fields or subjects that they are not good at, which I cannot agree with. This statement fails to consider the main function of education, which is not training superstars or perfect robots but teaching students how to face and solve the problems they are confronted instead of escape. The responsibility of education institutions should be helping and guiding students to make their own decisions, not making decisions for students.

Among various purposes of education, in my opinions, the most important one is teaching students to solve problems. Confronting the challenging instead of turning aside, trying to think of possible solutions instead of giving up at the beginning, always being positive to unknown instead of negative and retreating, all these are the main reason why the humankinds can keep improving. Transferring these knowledge and experiences to young people is the meaning of education. If the educational institutions always stopped students from trying just because they have less chance to be successful, we’ll never have people such as Thomas Edison or Albert Einstein, who were considered as stupid kids in school but didn’t give up trying. Convincing students to take a more comfortable road by giving up the possible risk is definitely not the proper attitude the educational institution should have.

One may suggest that everyone need to learn to assess the risk before invest, however, teaching students how to assess not assessing for students is the responsibility of educational institutions. Truly that knowing one’s limit is the first step of bringing out the maximum value of one’s talent. It’s not smart to encourage people doing what exceed their ability. Nevertheless, the ability of identifying limit of oneself can be best learned from experiences. One would never know he/she can swim or not without jumping into the swimming pool. The responsibility of the educational institutions is to make sure that he/she won’t be in danger in the swimming pool instead of dissuading him/her from getting close to the water. Educational institutions should guide students to have better self-understanding and self-assessing, not persuading them to follow the pre-decided road.

Last but not least, what is the definition of “success”? How do the educational institutions judge a student being likely to succeed or not? What if a student would rather to do something he/she likes instead of he/she is good at? Not everyone is living for the kind of success which most people agree with, such as wealthy, fame or power. For some people, living a life which enable them do what they like and like what they are doing is enough to be considered as a successful life. They might not be the top, but they are self-actualized and satisfied, and only in such situation they can provide most to the world, just like Albert Einstein has said, “Try not to become a man of success but rather to become a man of value.”

Considering all the above, I cannot agree with the statement that persuading students not to pursue field of study in which they have less possibility to be successful is the responsibility of the educational institutions. In my opinions, the purpose of the education is to teach and guide students how to facing the problems and making their own decision properly, not force them to accept what have already been arranged for them.

Contribution

The most popular TV programme in Germany is definitely the news programme „Tagesschau“ which is airing about three times a day on the channel „Das Erste/ARD“. It is a news programme based on well researched facts and offers a wide range of all the important information you need. Every now and then they even air an extra reportage on a certain field like the European election or the crisis in the Ukraine.

The main reason for its popularity is its accuracy and funded research which makes it more reliable than other news programmes. Moreover they try to be interesting for all ages so they post on facebook and twitter as well which draws the attention of the younger generation to the programme. Nevertheless they always inform about the latest news on their website and in their TV show as soon as possible and in addition they give a great overview of the necessary background information you need.

In my personal opinion I strongly believe that this TV programme earns its popularity. The way they present themselves in the media and the well funded research are truly unique in German news programmes. Although I am rarely watching the show on TV I like the way they are trying to keep up with modern technology and that they are always making boring nes so vivid interesting through short video clips, pictures and their choice of words. If you ever get to watch TV in Germany you should definitely try out this interesting news programme.

Dear Emma, 

I was so glad to read your letter about your new job. How is it? Have you got friendly colleagues? Do you get along with your superior? 
Last summer I finally managed to change my boring job and that tiny clothes job for a better one. I worked at the local cinema where Fred was also working. It was amazing!
We'd get there at about half past eight every day and started cleaning the main room and proceeding with the smaller rooms in the cinema. It was a lot of fun mainly because it was just us two. We'd make jokes and chase each other with the brooms, trying to smack the other on the head. 
The main advantage of working at the local cinema was the free popcorn and getting to enjoy the newest films. We got to see the new Bond movie and also the blockbuster Spiderman 3 there. My job was cleaning the cinema, but Fred's main responsibility was to roll the movies for the clients, so I'd make sure I finished cleaning earlier, so I could enjoy watching movies with him. 
But enough about me! Tell me about you! Have you finally asked Mark out? 
I can't wait for you to answer.
I'll write soon! 

Love,

For last ten years Michael had been working in a well-known company in London as an accountant. He did like his job but as we all know, sometimes people suddenly feel they have to change something. They don't know exactly what they should do, what to change - buy a new pair of shoes or maybe do something more - move to a different city or even to a foreign country. Michael had exactly the same problem.
One day he woke up much earlier than used to. He prepared a coffee for himself and turned the TV on to watch the news. He sat on a sofa in front of a television and suddenly he realised the fact that every morning was exactly the same, nothing has changed since such many years! "I won't stand it any longer" - he thought. But what to do? A crazy idea came to his mind.
Since Michael was a child he has always dreamt of moving to Australia, where he could practise kitesurfing for all day long, meet open-minded people, chill on a sandy beach and drink a good Australian alcohol.
"Why shouldn't I give myself a chance to make my dreams come true? People have only one life, not more!"
At that moment he was pretty sure what to do now. He took a sheet of paper and a pen and started to write. After 10 minutes a resignation letter was ready to bring it to Michael's boss. He arrived on the company as quickly as the crowded London's streets allowed him.
"I need to talk to boss" - he said to Jane, the main secretary of the company. Without waiting for her answer, he just went into the office, gave to Mike, his boss for 10 years, an envelope with a resignation letter and left. It all took about 3 minutes. Michael closed the door and knew at that moment he had made a mistake.

Sometimes we do things we don't want for no apparent reason but some other times we know exactly where we are getting into. Michael had cheated on her and he did it consciously. There was no way to shine a different light to that fact. He tried in his mind to go back to that moment, when his lips were getting closer to Jane, to that last look before the embrace, to the previous smile. There was no one else to blame but him. Regret had been filling up his soul since last Friday. He could not keep his betrayal inside any longer so he entered the living room and told her. The words coming up from his mouth like a litany, almost mechanically as he realized that there was no turning back. Tears ran down Rachel's face. No words, not a single comment. She just stood up, took her purse, and left. The relieve of telling her was instantly replaced by a bitter hollowness. He now realized. He didn't do it for her, he only did it for himself, to get rid of his burden but it was far too late. Michael closed the door and knew at that moment he had made a mistake.
