Nowadays students need to learn both language and mathematics until go to university, even some of them still need to study them in the university. A large number of examples prove that some of them are good at language whereas others are skilled in mathematics. This essay will discuss the differences and similarities for learning a language and learning mathematics.
  The ways of learning a language and mathematics are different. For studying a language, people need to communicate with others to improve their speaking and listening levels and read variety of overseas book to increase their reading and writing skills. Furthermore, people need to have a good memory to remember a large number of words. In general, studying a language focuses more on a large account of individual effort and little talent. However, for learning mathematics, students need to listen carefully in the class and find some rules to solve questions. Instead of rote learning, they should remember different types of formulas by practicing in a mass of examples. To sum up, teachers, skills and talent are more important for learning mathematics. 
   However, there are some similarities for those two subjects. Firstly, both those courses need to do a mass of practices, even the ways are different. People need to spend a huge account of time on doing exercise after class. Secondly, associability is important for both languages and mathematics. For example, when people learn a new word or a formula, they need to think about how to use it in real sentence or exercises. 
  In conclusion, people need to find a right way which can save much time and energy to study these two subjects. It is the most important thing that they should think about carefully before they start their study.

Shenzhen—China’s largest migrant city and a neighbor of Hong Kong—is a remarkable place that I call home. Most Shenzhen residents come from different cultural backgrounds and speak various regional dialects. Meanwhile, we embrace a superordinate Shenzhen identity, which is characterized by a culture of openness, tolerance, and creativity. Our differences, it seems, do not make a difference.

However, the young I soon discovered that some dimensions of difference do carry social significance. As a child who did not play with “boys’ toys” and identified as gay later, I was often subjected to disdain and hostility from peers and adults. Ironically, the marginalization comes not only from society at large, but also from within the gay community. A feminine gay man is considered as lesser than his masculine counterpart, because femininity is regarded as weak, unattractive, and second-class. This experience of amplified minority stress prompted me to think about intergroup and intragroup interaction early in life. It has led me to believe that masculinity should not be an indicator of individual worth. Nor should sexuality, skin color, and other identity markers—whether visible or invisible.

Anna knew that was going to be a very special day for her. That morning she woke up in a very good mood.
It was the day of her birthday, so she decided to go out with friends. She chose little, cosy restaurant near her house.
She did not suspect that it will be such a wonderful evening.
              As soon as Anna and her friends came into restaurant everything started to go perfect. Then all got special clothes and dressed up in colourful, old-fashined dresses. 
              The moment the door opened was the most exciting in Anna's life. She jumped for joy. She said to friends: 'This is best party ever! Thank you so much!'. She started to dance with double Presley, laugh and  appreciate every single minute. 
              As it turned out later, to Anna's surprise, it was her boyfriend dressed as Presley. She was embarrassed that she did not recognise him. But immediately she realize that it was one of her friends' tricky plan and she started to laugh with them.
              After a few exciting hours of the party she said thank you to her friends and boyfriend and promised she will never forget what they did for her. She went to sleep with belief that she is the happiest girl in the world.

The Alhambra

The Alhambra is a beautiful palace which is situated in Granada, in the south of Spain. Its historical importance lies in the fact that this place represents the fall of the Muslim kinddom in my country. The Catholic Monarchs, Isabella and Ferdinad, had tried for several years to defeat the muslims, who at this time, only remained seated in the city of Granada. The Alhambra Palace was the residence of Boabdil, the last Muslim king, who was defeated in 1492 after delivering Granada to the Catholic Monarchs.

Nowadays, this palace is one of the most visited places here in Spain because of its beauty and its impressive courtyards. You can see the history of the Reconquets in its walls and towers. Its surroundings are also wonderful, and the city invites you to spend more time in the Alhambra, one of the last Muslim palaces in the word.

Hi Paul,

How are you doing? I haven't seen you for almost two months but, as you know, on November I had a one of a kind possibility to help at a concert that took place on airport runway and it was simply amazing experience!

I'm sure you do know that I'm obsessed with rock music and that is why I couldn't miss the boat. An event started at 7 p.m. but all the volunteers who had signed a contract had to work from 8 a.m. Everything has to be perfect during such events so we had no time to relax or even eat a decent meal! The whole process of selling the tickets was fascinating because of the demand for them. People looked like aggressive monsters and I realised that they are close to kill their every single 'rival'. Security guards had a lot of work to do but thanks to them we stand a chance to deal with other problems, as for example regulating the quality of sound. I was incredibly overjoyed when the culmination came. A band was playing, we were enjoying music and it seemed that there will be no more complications. What you actually think in such an extraordinary moment is that life couldn't be more beautiful.

Take care, Paul. When you come to my town, we'll go out to a rock concert together! Can't wait!
Warm regards

Adam

Hi Paul,

just a quick answer to your request. I don't have much time, because I'm taking off in 10 minutes to help at another concert. 

So, the deal is, I met this guy in the bar, Ron, and we started talking. After a few drinks I told him that I'm currenly looking for a job, nothing big, just a couple of hours during weekends to gather some money for my journey to Netherlands. Remember, I told you about it last time, when we met Jenny. Anyway, it turned out that the guy works in this agency, they organise concerts, parties and stuff like that, and he offered me the job! The perfect one! It's literally 10-15 hours on Fridays nights and Saturdays, stuff like carrying instruments (which means hanging out with musicians), tyding after (finding things, like wallets and cellphones) and generally speaking - helping.

Last week I worked most time with the manager of The Kooks. I went to Krakow and spent all day "planning" their stay in Poland. In fact I had to be everywhere with the guy, just hanging and helping him not to get lost in the city. He's a really nice guy, during the concert we had a few drinks, smoked some fags together. I tell you, I meet so many people nowadays that I don't even remember their names.

The salary is nice too. Usually I get 12 PLN per hour (yeah, I know, It's like 2,50 pounds, but here it's quite good) but sometimes I get some extra money for staying after hours or when I do something unusual to help. Last time it was for example delivering my drunk boss home ;)

I have to go now. Take care and call me on Skype tomorrow - I'll tell you so much more, I have plenty of unbelievable stories!

Cheers,
Arek

Peter looked at his watch and knew that he had to do something immediately.
He said to himself: What have I done?
 Why have I killed him? 
I'm a chemist I can't kill people becasue I wanted to.
He had to take the man's body and hide it somewhere.
The police was gonna come in any time.
He grabbed the body and put it on the car's trunk.
He went to his lab and showed his partner the dead body.
His partner said: Man, we have to do something and quick.
They grabbed the body and soaked him on fuel.
Then they went to the dead man's car and put him in there.
Later, when they were sure that there were no one near they burned the car.
The killers partner felt guilty for a moment but then the killer told him: 'He earned it. He tried to kill me after killing lots of other people.'
Saddly the police found out that it was them.
Thanks that the judge's best friend had been killed by the man the chemist killed so they went out free and without bad feeling.

A modern interpretation of Austen's Classic Love Story

The glorious world of Jane Austen is brought back to the silver screen in Pride & Prejudice, a 2005 British film based on the novel of the same title, published in 1813.
Joe Wright directs this uplifting adaptation, which depicts the five Bennet sisters, who have been brought up to get married. The enthusiastic and clever Elizabeth stands out among them striving to put everything in a broader perspective. However, their whole lives will be turned upside down when an elegible bachelor and his friends set up home in a close mansion. Surprisingly enough, sparks fly when spirited Elizabeth Bennet (Keira Knightley) meets single, rich, and proud Mr. Darcy (Matthew Macfadyen). All in all, will each one be able to overcome their own pride and prejudice?
Keira Knightley, in the lead role of Elizabeth Bennet, delivers an outstanding performance. In fact, the film, well cast from top to bottom, is highlighted by a compelling soundtrack and a set of beautiful English locations, as in many British productions.
In this adaptation, the screenwriter makes some substantial alterations to the novel. Therefore dialogues, settings as well as politeness, costumes and hairstyles are meant to give it greater public appeal, sacrificing historical accuracy. Thus, overlapping dialogues are introduced in a mixture of modern idiom and archaic sentence structure, several scenes have been shifted to more romantic settings, and the proximity of the Bennets to their rural life is stressed to illustrate their relative poverty in contrast with the rich characters of the story
To conclude, Pride & Prejudice is an amazing adaptation which completely bewitches you with an exquisite blend of emotion and wit. In fact, in its final minutes, it makes you believe, for one misty-eyed moment, in true love and in order reigning in the universe. By the way, if you haven’t seen this romantic, funny, well-acted and well-scripted film yet; give it a try!

Dear Sir/Madam,

I am writing in order to apply for the position in your Film Club for students of English.
I am 45 years old man and I have plenty of experience in working with people. I used to work with young people in primary and secondary schools teaching Spanish language. Although I still have not passed the FCE exam I am currently working hard to fulfil the goal very soon. Above all I am interested in films. Science fiction are my favourite type of films because I like to leave behind normal life nevertheless, I enjoy all kinds of them such as comedies, thrillers, westerns, horror films and even silent films.
I think I am right  for the position because I think I can boost the motivation of the people about movies and push them up to share their particular point of view.
As far as the job is concern working on Monday and Wednesday evening would be perfect for me because I am currently unemployed.
Please feel free to ask for further information if you need it.
I look forward to hearing from you very soon.

Yours faithfully,

Juan

Dear James,
Thank you for accepting our invitation to give a talk at our club. Our club members are thrilled knowing that an international sports star like you is coming to see them.
In reference to the speech date, the best would be June 12 in the evening, when all the members will have finished their classes at school.
The children are aged between ten and sixteen and they enjoy playing football and swimming.
I'm sure we'll all enjoy your speech. What about talking about fair play at sport and how to become a sports star? We believe that fair play is a very important topic because children must learn to behave properly when playing a sport. Also, we think that becoming a sports star is difficult and it would be a good idea to talk about it because some of the club members wrongly think it is easy to succeed playing a sport.
Looking forward to seeing you on 12 June.
Kind regards,
John

I love to write. It is a method I use to relax, unwind and revive myself. Our mind is always full of thoughts. Some of these thoughts make us smile, some frown. But all these are addressed through writing. Writing should be done naturally; only then it serves its real purpose.

I have written many poems, few articles and even a few stories. It is certainly a pleasure to write and also reading what I have written, after a long time. Many times reading my own poems and articles is a surprising experience. "Am I the same person who wrote this?" I ask myself, wondering how did I come up with some ideas and words that seem just so good and uncommon right now. 

Other than myself, I have had few people reading what I have written; very few, I must say; maybe only 2 or 3; and they were not critics or experts. So, I have yet to submit myself to some serious criticism (well, calling my writings literature is a huge joke in itself...anyway); but yes, I would like to place my written works (however small and few they may be)for qualitative discussions in front of people who really can identify the good and the 'not-so-good' writing. I would like getting good advice about how can I make myself a better writer. Let's see when and how that happens...!

It´s very common to hear people talking about friendship, but are we sure about the real meaning of it? Do we know what does it mean to be a friend? Firstly we ought to consider that friendship is not uniquely a human emotion. Friendship is overall an acto of will.

Friendship is a type of love  which is characterized by being incondicional, reciprocal, and ready to forgive each other. A friend is a treasure, as the title of that adventure-comedy film, somebody you can share your problems with. Somebody who listens to you talking about your dreams and wishes, your expectations and your efforts and sacrifices to get them, your plans for the future, and moreover pays special attention on times of crisis. 
This is  why the members of my family are my best friends. My family loves me whatever I think or whatever I do, no matter if it is correct or not.  They love me just because I am me, for who I am.
They are always  going to tell me the truth although this truth could hurt me, because they always want me to be happy.  Finally, they warn me of danger but they let me do, even if in the end I´d make a big mistake. They´d keep always  close to me and neither would fail  . They feel happy when I am happy, they are sad when I am sad, they enjoy themselves with my success. They are, definitely, my best friends.

The painting is an amazing one and one should definitely take a look at it in order to appreciate its full beauty. 

The Mona Lisa is perhaps Leonardo DaVinci's most famous of paintings. It is an oil painting, painted on poplar wood. The painting is most famous for the smile of the woman, which people have been trying to decipher for a long time. Many believe that the portrait is that of DaVinci himself, while many also place a lot mystic connections with this painting.

The portrait depicts a woman's bust, with a distant landscape that is visible in the backdrop. Leonardo used a pyramid design to install the woman in a simple and calm manner within the painting. The woman is shown with her hands folded, with her breast, neck, and face painted the same color as her hands. The light is diffused so that the various curves and geometrical shapes on the painting are made visible through it.

Perhaps the most interesting thing about the painting is the woman's smile. Many believe that it is innocent and inviting, while others believe it is that of smugness and is a smirk. Many scientific studies have been undertaken to determine the exact nature of the smile and the real reason remains a mystery. It is believed that every person sees the smile differently because of the changes in the lighting that Leonardo presented.

The woman is shown seated in an open area, and behind her is a vast landscape, which recedes to an icy mountain. Some winding paths and a far away bridge is also perceptible in the background.

The painting is an amazing one and one should definitely take a look at it in order to appreciate its full beauty. The painting is currently on display at the Musee du Louvre, in Paris.

Over the past few years, the Internet has become an important part of our lives. We use it to communicate with friends, to play games, to watch series, the list is endless. Unfortunately, it is not perfect. Because the more people use the Internet, the greater the chances are of people misusing it. Luckily, the government intervenes to preserve the safety of the Internet. What it comes down to is, should the Internet be more tightly controlled by governments?

Without the interference of the government, criminals may see their chances to take advantage of internet users. They could get into our computers and steal our information. They could use that information to get into our bank accounts and steal our money.

However, if the government were to monitor the citizens actions more closely, it would be considered an invasion of our privacy. Nobody wants to have their private data to be exposed to the eyes of the government. 

This brings me to the next issue. The reason why the government even take action is to ensure people are able to enjoy the internet, but a more tightly controlled internet would destroy that purpose. Everybody likes to have the freedom to explore the internet. So they would not appreciate it if there were suddenly restrictions put on them.

To sum things up, the government should not control the internet more tightly. It is fine the way it is right now. That way, the most of the trouble would be kept away from the internet while at the same time, the internet users would still have the freedom to explore the web.

Are people born violent or do they become violent because of how they are brought up? How did we become the person we are?  Is there something that makes us unique? Is it the genes we are born with? Or are we a product of our own lives? 
It is clear that genes play a very important part in the person we are. Family characteristics such as eye and hair colour are inherited by children from their parents as well as some diseases and mental disorders. Therefore, what we need to consider is whether our personality and personal skills are born or made. 
Those who hold that nature has a stronger influence than nurture on developing our personal identity will claim that certain personality traits are also determined by our genes. Nevertheless, identical twins that were separated when they were very young and have been raised in different environments show differences in their personalities. This provides evidence that life experiences and surrounding where you grow up have defined the kind of person you are today.
Regarding personal skills, there are a large number of cases in which children were born gifted for the same field as their parents having great potential for a specific art or science since early childhood. However, nature doesn´t always endow us with inborn abilities. For instance, parents tend to instil their own passions in their children and, consequently, they will likely be interested in the same academic or artistic field. According to this fact, parents often shape their children´s lives encouraging them to follow in their footsteps. Likewise, some people put their success in life down more to their parent´s training than to their innate talents. 
So, to conclude we would have to argue that both nature and nurture make us who we are. As I see it, personal identity is the result of the interaction of our genetic structure and the environment which surrounds us. The problem is how to separate these two influences and how to find out which the strongest is in each case.

Dear Ira!

Thanks a lot for your letter. It was fun to read as always. Your new friends seem to be crazy guys, in a good way, of course. 

I was so surprised to hear you signed up for a new interior design course because it’s such a coincidence that I’m planning to do something with my bedroom in the near future. As I’ve got some extra money at last, I think It’s high time for me to think how to make it cozy and comfortable. I hope you don’t mind if I ask you some questions.  

First, I think about painting the walls in warm colors (apricot, salmon or warm beige). I thought you might add some more interesting colors to the list. Do you think a wall mural is a good decision for the bedroom and what other «special effects» would you recommend? I completely rely on your taste as we’ve always been on the same wavelength.

Now, the toughest questions. I’ve got no clue what to do with  the ceiling. The idea of  painting it white seems too boring to me and I’m completely out of my depth with all this new stuff for ceilings in shops, but I’m sure you’re an expert! The floor is also a problem. I want it to look beautiful, be easy to wash and not expensive at the same time. I’m wondering what you would suggest.

I hope I don’t bother you too much with my redecoration, knowing how busy you are. 

Can’t wait to hear what you’ve been up to this weekend.

All the best

Natasha

edits: is a great adventure for sure
text:
CONVENIENCE IS NOT THE MOST IMPORTANT

Nowadays, every one of us travels a lot. We do that for work or to finally get a rest. I, as a young women, usually travel just as a hobby. Since the technology has improved in recent years, we now have a huge variety of different ways to travel. Is it possible to choose which one is the best?
The most common answer would be probably the plane. There are so many advantages. It is the fastest and the most comfortable one. Of course, for these facilities you have to pay a lot of money and that could be a problem for some people.
The next one is boat. It could also be really comfortable but we don't use it often. It's more for exotic trips. Travelling on a boat for sure is a great adventure. But there is also an inconvenience - it is also expensive. And it is hard to plan a trip like this.
What about the train then? This is the best option for me. In my country trains aren't really fast and there could be problems during the trip but that's for me makes it more interesting. During the trip you can do many things - from sleeping to meeting new people and making fun. It is also quite safe so you don't have to worry about the accidents.
I wish I could travel every day. The trip is an adventure and the ways you can travel are a big part of it. Even though any mode of transportation is not bad, for me the train is the best option.

back in 2010, I traveled from Porto Alegre to Sao Paulo by car, a course that took 18 hours driving straight, surely very few people would consider it convenient. 
cars are handy and driving can be pleasant, but only when the driver is in good mood, with no traffic jams or craters on the road( really common situations in Brazil). Since ancient times exist public transport, and it suffered numerous attempts of assassination, in China for example, the dynasty Yuan prohibited public transport (at that age, charriots) because of fear that Han people could plot and riot against mongol's dictatorship in it; the situation inverted at early socialist regime when, in 1960, Mao considered personal cars as instrument of opression and symbol of devilish capitalism. Of course, none of these radical measures last long against the very basic human instinct: laziness.
we have cars so we don't have to walk, in the same fashion, people who can't afford a car will want public transport, even if a bike could be the solution. The convenience has litlle to do with the fate of public transport, countries with high HDI(convenience to be drivers), like Germany and England, are those with better public transport system, and they are even boosting it. 
Unless some extraordinary mutation happens and change us to some labor-lovers, personal cars and public transport will rule side by side for all eternity.

USA SUMMER CAMPS APPLICATION.

The diagrams vividly show us the process of making banking notes. The process can be divided into three sections.
Above all,it's a significant step to make a good design,in which background colour, artwork and security are the main considerations.Then it comes to the preparation of metal plates and that needs skilled machinists.Only after all the work above is completed,can printing step be carried out.
The second section is printing.Each sheet contains 50 bank notes.There may be several colours on both sides of bank notes.To make sure of the printing effect,special ink has to be used.Besides,The images can be slightly raised.
After printing,there is much more work to be done.The most important step is inspection manually.After that,good quality sheets and bank notes separated from partially damaged sheets will be packaged and distributed.Bad sheets and bank notes will be securely destroed.

Introduction:
The aim of this report is to give some information about the range of exciting activities that people can do in our area.
Water sports:
There are lots of places where you can do water sports like scuba diving, windsurfing, surfing, go on a banana bus, kayaking… The Costa Brava is the perfect place to do water sports because there is a lot of wind and good weather.
Winter sports:
In winter you can go skiing or snowboarding in the Pirineus. There are near to France and Andorra. There are lots of ski stations with good ski slopes of different levels with different colours, the greens are the easiest and blacks are the most difficult. 
Montmeló: 
In Catalonia there is an important race track where the cars of Formula 1 race. When there isn’t any race you can go and try different racing cars or if you want you can go and race a bike on the race track.  
Conclusion:
To sum up I think that if you want to do exciting sports Catalonia is a good place where you can find lots of different sports and you can choose what to do, but if you don’t want to do sports you can do another activities or go on interesting places.

Michael had already woken up when his mother's alarm clock started ringing. He got up as quietly as he could and waited until he stopped hearing his mother talking to herself, which meant she had headed to the kitchen.  
Michael knew his mother had planned on baking a cake. He hid near the door, where he could watch for a chance to try the cream without being noticed. He waited for what seemed like an eternity until he saw her leaving the kitchen with Michael's father's breakfast. It was his chance.
'I must keep an eye on the door' he muttered as he entered. 'If she finds out I was here, she'll kill me'. Michael tried the cream and thought that her mother wouldn't notice it if he ate another bit. 'After all, what I had was so infinitesimal that I could barely taste it.' Before he could notice, the cream was all gone. It was time to escape, even though his mother would find out who ate it eventually. Michael closed the door and knew at that moment he had made a mistake.

Chapter 9: The KM-3J: The second confrontation
That night the time flew by, but things started to get weird, Marcus was talking with an Australian guy about the proofs that he had found related to dinosaurs, he was interested in them, but Marcus didn’t like his point of view about those species, the guy told him they were bad creatures with no feelings, and Marcus thought they were awesome and the most lovely creatures he had never heard about, the guy thought Marcus was crazy, so he flew from the Federal Palace. Meanwhile, Mark and Michael were talking with Russian ladies, they were beautiful and flawless, the scientists started talking about science and that sort of thing, and suddenly the ladies vanished, the men started crying. Jack, was arguing with an officer about Mexico conquest (the officer didn’t understand anything because Jack was drunk), and suddenly, the officer took off his costume and a strange mask, and in that moment… Jack was astonished because the officer was not an officer, he was Brad! Jack tried to confront him, but as soon as he tried to do that, he snapped his fingers and a lot of people came around him, he had a new team, he decided to name them “The KM-3J”, a villains team, their names were Karolina (she decided to change his name like that because he used to say that that letter was her favorite one), Melanie, Miley (they were both twins, the most beautiful ladies of the world), Max, who was an expert in the military field, and Brad Rowley J., nobody had known his last name until that moment: Junior, he was embarrassed about it, he was descendant of a weird woman, however she was her mother.
The KM-3J put Jack into an immense bag, they were planning to kill him and place his dead body in a grave, in that way their friends would find him buried, but they were not that evil, they just put him into a dark room and tied his hands in a chair, it was exactly the same thing he was dreamed about. While Jack was there, he heard Brad talking with Max about their new plan, it was related to a gigantic weapon that would shoot toxic wastes at New York city, so in that way, everybody would become a zombie. The bulk of the population from New York was homeless because there has just been a horrible war between New York City and California, however, increasingly refined body technologies allowed New York to win the war. Jack was frightened, but suddenly he heard the door opening and saw their friends rescuing him, they had used some weapons from The King of the Sky, they got into the room and started shooting while Michael was unleashing Jack from the chair, accidentally, Mark killed Miley while he was shooting, all her body parts were scattered on the floor, he didn’t care about and flew with the others. Jack fainted while their friends were rescuing him.
When they arrived at mainland, Jack woke up, there wasn’t anyone around him, there was just sand and the beach…

Comfort, time and internal peace are required to make learning efficient. Hence, it is not possible to do job and study side by side. Occupation and education disturb one another. I strongly oppose this statement because handling both these together is easily possible with strong willpower. I will elaborate points to support my opinion in the further paragraphs.

Firstly, there are a lot of people in western countries, who do a part-time study and work full-time or vice-versa. It all depends on the preference of the individuals. If they want to bear some hassle and become more productive in their life, they can manage both things side by side. This not only makes them knowledgeable but increase their potential as well. 
 
Secondly, there are a few parents who cannot bear the expenses of their child’s education. Resultantly, they put their children into some labor so that they can earn money for the family. But it does not mean that the child has to abandon his dream of acquiring education. With firm determination, they can continue their education and work to feed their family as well.

Finally, sometimes people think they have completed their education, but when they get a full-time job, they realize that diploma or degree can increase their chances of promotion. Moreover, some employers select the potential employee from colleges while they are studying and pay for their Masters or Advanced Diplomas because they see their profit in that investment. Hence, studying and working side by side helps candidates to grow professionally.

In conclusion, working and studying is very much possible. It just depends on the dedication and determination of the person. People should do both study and work side by side to make themselves more skilled and capable.

March 21st, 2007

Mrs Kate Ashby
Manager of Green Pepper Cafe


Dear Mrs Ashby,

I write to you to express my interest to apply for the weekend worker job that was posted on your cafe door. I believe I am a good fit for this task since I had previous experience working in similar jobs. I am good at dealing with people. I demonstrated  courteous and professional attitude and achieved a high rating in the customer satisfaction survey. I am also interested in different kinds of food and different cuisines. I am prepared to work long hours and take shifts late in the evening since I live nearby. Moreover, I have education in the field of customer service since I finished a customer service training course at George White College. I accept feedback from peers and management and improve my performance. I am also a quick learner and adapt to different working environments. Please find my resume attached to this letter. Thank you for your time and consideration of my resume and I look forward to speaking with you.

Sincerely yours,
Tom

How did this happen? How can I be here at D’el Arte  wearing a suit and tie with my beautiful wife?   The day hadn’t been planned to end with a date night.  Then it all dawned on me.  I’d been set up.  Duped, so to say, into this unlikely event, a date night.  Her plan was so clever and deceptive as to escape detection until the last card had been played.  
Oh, my wife is clever.  When exactly did the deception begin?  Was it the party which lasted until 3am the night before? Was it at the invitation to the wedding three weeks ago?  How far back could it possibly go.  When was this seed planted in my wife’s brain to have a date night with me all dressed up and formal? 
So many twists and turns-she played her cards well, I never suspected while sitting in the pews next to my wife that when she leaned forward with a pained expression on her face that the evening would end at D’el Arte.  Nor when her condition appeared to worsen and I decided to go get the car to take her to the doctor’s office, nor when I returned to find her lying on the cold hard stone floor of the church could I have ever imagined we would be enjoying a quiet evening together sharing entrees and desserts.  Nor could I have conceived after having multiple people help calling the ambulance, which never came, or the friends who called my in-laws to come take care of the kids, that we would be eating a wonderful pizza by the end of the evening.  No, none of these things would have prepared me for the relief I would feel after waiting 4 hours in the emergency room that her pains were probably only intercostal muscle pains and the test for something more serious were all negative.
Honestly dear, next time just ask me.  I’ll say yes.

First of all, I think, to stay young, you need a goal in life. I already had mine as a teenager.  In my teens, I was fascinated by planes. My goal I decided then , was to become a pilot when I grewn up. I have always tried to live for the future and not fret about the past.This has helped keep me young.Besides we all have our close calls in life in one way or another. Like the one I had in 1926 and all because of a parachute.
     It was a foggy January morning and I had gone to renew my pilot's licence.  The weather report said the ceiling was at 180 metres. But at 360 metres, I was still surrounded by heavy fog. Suddenly my plane began to act up, I was losing control. I sent the plane into a deep dive and landed safely. I looked at the plane and realized I forgot to tie the parachute cord to the plane. Thank God I didn't jumped or I would have been a 'dead duck' for sure!

Dear Paul, 

Last month, as you may know, I was a volunteer on occasion of my favourite band's concert in Katowice. It was just a miracle - it had turned out that the band's manager was my good old friend Daniel and he asked me for help when he found out I was a big fan of the group. Although the work was truly demanding and lasted for quite a while, I must say I really enjoyed it. 
At first I had to be involved in it a month before the event was started. I was asked to give some information about the concert to local pubs, restaurants etc. so I was handing leaflets everywhere. 
By the time the event was upcoming, I had to take over the band's equipment. I had to move it from place to place along with boys from the group. One thing leads to another and we ended up having a beer and laughing in a pub. 
Eventually the concert came off just perfectly! Lots of people showed up, everybody had fun and the best thing in the musical experience is that you can make friends with famous people and those who you admire and only see on TV. If you will ever have an opportunity to help by this kind of event, I recommend it to you from the bottom of my heart! 
Looking forward to hearing from you. 

Yours sincerely, 
Patrycja.

Dear Johanna,
I'm very happy to hear from you since both have been quite busy these days with the exams. It's a pity that you have to choose between the activities that you love the most, but I guess that life is full of choices. If I were you, I would give up music and I am going to explain why. You have always wanted to be policewoman (unless you have recently changed your opinion) so you must be very fit since you need to pass the physical tests, which are very demanding, according to my mother. Sport is something essential to get this goal and you can always practise music at home when you have some free time (yes, I know that it happens once in a month). 
Moreover, you wrote to me that you have started to give lessons about guitar so you are not going to be isolated from music and it goes on playing an important role in your life. So I think you shouldn't be upset because now it is a difficult period, I know, but it passes and we can get back our life when we go to university. My cousin, who is studying English Literatura, told me that you have much more freedom when you start university, so don't worry!
I hope you write to me when you make the final decision, I look forward to hearing from you.

James Dashner’s The Maze Runner, joins The Hunger Games and  Divergent as the latest futuristic Young Adult thriller to get its own film franchise.

The Maze Runner manages to feel remarkably fresh. It's punchy, tense and, crucially, original.

The book opens with a boy. He can remember his name, Thomas, but that's all he can remember: everything importanthas been wiped clean. He finds himself in "the Glade", a farmstead and a camp at the centre of a towering stone maze. A group of teenagers, all males, have made a makeshift life for themselves there. Like Thomas, none of them have any real memories of their previous lives, although there's a barely spoken, horrific suggestion that the lives they've come from might have been even worse than the ones they're living now.

At night, the maze grinds shut. Vicious monsters known as Grievers prowl its twists and turn. The priority for the boys is to survive, and to find a way out of the maze.

Lnguage itself also becomes vitally important: the boy's speech is peppered with made-up words that highlight the isolation.

The book ends devastating final twist.

The oldest memory of our relationship is a short skirt and some crocodiles. Two perfect stigmas for a man and a woman in general. The task is unambiguous and seemingly easy. I should be able to describe my view of American man and his behavior because of my experience as an adult, a woman, a wife, a mother and simply a human being with various roles in life who has been million times happy and million times unhappy. However, I am non-American and I live with a man who surprises me every day in a positive and also in a negative way. I cannot describe my own husband. Is it really possible to describe a man at all? No. I think that I can depict this one American man within a certain period of time, but it is impossible to write the truth since I have never seen him alive. I can write subjectively and my observations of him through the Internet will be distorted by my own life, experience and surrounding I live in. Let me introduce one American I got friends with on Facebook. His name is Kyle. A typical American name, right? However, he is not typical. He is special. I like his humor, because he is able to make me smile. His sensitivity is visible through his carefully chosen words and his decency in his grammatically correct sentences. I adore his imagination because he is able to kidnap you on a cloud to a never never land. He is wise and brave, because he was not scared to teach me although he is not a teacher. But what about those snakes and guns in his photos? Would I be able to overcome my own phobias and be fair? And what about those open-hearted quotes, love songs and poetic opinions he shares on his wall? Is he a romantic and a killer in one? He is the man stuck in a generation where loyalty is just a tattoo, love is just a quote and lying is the new truth. He is the man and I am the woman who live in the world, in which the man wears a short skirt and the woman is as tough as a crocodile.
He always writes gentle words, uses cute smileys, Facebook kisses and hugs, but when I ask him in what way he loves me, he answers "as a Christian". Well, it´s all right. I´m relieved. However, the woman inside of me shouts: What? He does not love me as a woman! How come! I would like to point out another his attribute which is his pride. When I asked him, if he had read a book The Little Prince by Exupéry because I am feeling like a fox, he asked me in an offended manner, if I know Larry, the comedian. Kyle is really prideful, but so are all the men. I don´t believe in the friendship between the man and the woman. There will always be some kind of sparkling either alluring or repulsing. 
Next thing I like about him is that he never pushes me into anything. If I want to sleep, he stops his own imagination to let me relax and rest. So he is thoughtful. 
I must be honest for a while. He rose up my own enslaved desires. I have always wanted to fly, to travel, to paint, to write and to love. And I am left to love without any support. He asked me to observe him for a week. However, I am scared a bit of the consequences of this secret adventure. What if it breaks me down? I mean what if he tames me like a fox? He is a hunter. All the men are.
In following section I will write about his sexuality and dealing with an argument. It was easy to draw him into the love affair or to make him horny, but it was quite difficult to start an argument with him. I think that he is a good writer because he is able to describe his sexual dreams and thoughts lively and vividly. However, ask him a question from his real life and he will give you a one-word answer. This could hardly satisfy an ordinary questioner like me, not only an interviewer from a daily journal.
I believe he is tender and careful, but impatient and clumsy at the same time. He forgets of everything when he plunges into his Neverland. No matter what you write, he follows his own lust. On the other hand,he is disciplined, because he is able to stop with his imagery at once. He is cute, anyway. 
As I wrote before it was not that easy to make the argument with him. I tried to use different strategic inputs that could help me to argue, for example: You are totally uninterested to read between lines! You never listen to me!I even called him a lummox and stumblebum. He just kept quiet and begged me to stop. He did his best to calm me down. I was impressed and I find this a good feature of his personality. 
Yesterday I wanted him to tell me the story of his life. He went with the trip from California to Texas and then to Phoenix. If you like adventurers, well, he is the right man for you. 
Sport is a part of men. I should not bypass this issue. So I asked him what his favourite sport is.He likes baseball, but he does not play baseball actively. He likes watching it. He actively does hiking, hunting and camp riding. 
The week has passed, so we are at the end of this adventure course. Kyle is a strong and charismatic individuality and he values his privacy a lot. Honestly, I asked myself, if I would like to be his future wife. I pondered this many times. And surely, I will. However, I am not that crazy to marry the man whom I not know in real life. But I do like him and I loved the course. It surely taught me a lot and enriched my whole life. Thank you, Kyle. 
In the end, I would like to add a quotation by Franz Marc. I do not know who Franz Marc is. But I identify myself with his view of male and female relationship. "Blue is the male principle, stern and spiritual. Yellow the female principle, gentle, cheerful and sensual. Red is matter, brutal and heavy and always the colour which must be fought and vanquished by the other two."

To: The Chairperson
From: Teodora Costescu, Romanian student
Subject: Local Environmental Protection
Date: 13th September 2014

Purpose
As requested, this is a report concerning the environmental condition within my town. The information below evaluates the chief measures taken against pollution and environmental damage as well as the population’s interest and involvement in an optimum preservation of the area.

Recycling
Through a series of programmes and events organised by local voluntary organisations both adults and children are instructed about the importance of waste reduction and recycling. Therefore, in the last few years there has been a great improvement in raising awareness and commitment among an increasingly larger sector of the population as far as the selective collection of household refuse is concerned. This is clearly illustrated by the growing number of recycling facilities the residents of our town have at their disposal. 

Public Transport
Since exhaust fumes are considered to be one of the major pollutants nowadays, the local authorities are doing everything in their power in order to induce citizens to travel more by means of public transport, in the detriment of the ubiquitous private cars. Consequently, there are buses which run at short intervals on various routes, so that people can arrive at their destinations rapidly and conveniently. Unfortunately, only a limited number of people are willing to leave their comfort zone for the sake of the community, thus making pollution by dint of heavy traffic a remaining and inextricable problem of our society.

Public Cleaning Services
Our local public cleaning services are responsible not only for the efficient removal, storage, collection and transport of waste material, but also for the maintenance and good care of natural areas and green spaces within our community. The sole purpose of their activity is to keep our town clean and neat, making it an appealing and pleasurable place to inhabit.

Conclusion
Taking everything into consideration, it would be fair to conclude that there are numerous ways in which one can protect the environment and take care of the area in which they reside. However, as with all issues present within society, a dual commitment from the citizens and authorities should be regarded as a key factor.

Red fire ants originated in Brazil.
  Fire ants are very aggressive. They often swarm on their prey swiftly and sting repeatedly to paralyze it. If we disturb a fire ant nest they would relentlessly sting us, injecting poison into our body. The sting could be fatal if we have an allergy. Even if we don't, stinging will cause a burning sensation, swelling and then a blister at the point of sting. In mild cases, the sting causes itch. In severe cases it causes nausea, vomiting or dizziness. In the US, millions of people are stung annually and some have died from their injuries.
  Fire ants threaten more than human health. In infested areas, they injure livestock, pets and wildlife; damage crops, plants, electrical equipment, and irrigation systems. We should use pesticide treatments to reduce their numbers.

LIFE IS BEAUTIFUL

There must be something very special about a movie  when, after the third time, you’re still getting out of the cimena thinking“ I have to see it again”. That’s only happened to me once, and the film was Life is Beautiful.

Starring Italian comic Roberto Begnini (who also wrote and directed the movie) in the main role of  Guido, this live loving  tragic/comedy it's about a Jewish father trying to shield his young son from the horrors of the nazims in the Italy of Mussolini.   

For that matter Guido creates an imaginariy game for his child once they are deported to a concentration camp.  He tells the boy that they are competing with others to win a tank, so the little Guiosué didn’t realise what it’s really going on around him. 

The strength of the movie relies on the goofy, loving, eccentric character played by Begnini, his exceptional comic talent and his ability as director to deal with such delicate topic like Nazism while  managing to drive through a thick line bettween comedy and drama. The Original soundtrack created by Nicola Piovanni it's also a beautiful,  delicate plus to this masterpiece. 

Life is beautiful was recipient of numerous awards including three Oscars as for best foreign picture, best actor and best original dramatic score.

What strikes me  more was that despite the fact that it’s set on the eve of the II world war,  the film isn’t really about the holocaust but a bittersweet fable about human courage love and hope. If you already haven’t seen it , which I doubt, I highly recommend it;   it will make you laugh out loud but also along the way you’ll find yourself cover in tears, Guarantee.

Football, to me, is more than just a game. I have learned a lot of things from it.

When I joined the team freshman year, I didn’t realize what I was getting into. Football requires tremendous amounts of teamwork and sportsmanship to be successful. We worked all summer in the weight room and ran on the track to get in physical and mental shape before the season. 

See, football is more of a mental sport than anything else, so running on the track wasn't only about getting in shape. We would push our minds by running as hard as we could even if we felt like we were going to pass out. At the beginning, I was immature and only thought of myself, sometimes even giving up when I was tired or hurting. Then after the third game I had a season-ending injury. Imagine working all summer and then only being able to play three games! I needed surgery on my arm and at least five months to recover. 

Needless to say, I was sidelined for the rest of the season, but this actually helped me realize that since you never know when your last play will be, you should try your hardest in football and life.

After freshman year I decided that I would always give my best effort. Playing varsity football has taught me so much more than just what my assignments are on a particular play or how to block. I have learned to think about others first, and realized how important working hard is. Being with all my friends, even sweating and bleeding with them, really made us bond as a group of hard-working young men I know will succeed in life.

High-school football is more than just a sport. It is a learning ground for many to strengthen their personality and character for their lives. One thing my coach always says is, “Imagine that you have just run 100 sprints and a giant bear starts chasing you. Are you just going to stand there and let it attack you because you are too tired?” The answer, of course, is no, because you can always put it in another gear even if you think you need to give up. This to me means that you can always control your attitude and effort. So, no matter what, if you maintain a great attitude and always give whatever you’re doing your best effort, you will have no regrets.

Honestly, I could not agree more, as the website as it is available today is an inconvenient tool providing insufficient informaton.

Before focusing on the topic of technology itself, I would like to mention some aspects related to education.
First of all, Spanish educational laws are in Europe, and probably in the world, the only ones which have changed the most in the last 30 years. This fact leads the teachers to be unsure of what they are doing. Besides, there are no results that can be analysed or checked.
Secondly, there are two sorts of schools in Spain-public and private-, which produces a big difference in the educational knowledge. While public ones must obey governmental laws strictly, private schools have some privileges.
Knowing this about the Spanish education system, we can now talk about technology. I obviously agree that nowadays technology is necessary. So, the schools and the educational institutions in general have to update the way they teach. Technology does not imply a new instrument to be taught but a new tool and source of knowledge (if used correctly). In fact, using technology without changing the contents would be a total failure. 
Teachers must learn how to use these new technological devices in order to get their students motivated. Moreover, they should comprise the past information and the new one. Thus, this would help students know how the world has evolved and how it will be. In other words, technology should be used as a tool for the students be aware of the development of society and its advantages and disadvantages.
This new technologies also help in the teaching development. We can make dynamic classes by being in contact with other schools, in the case of subjects such as English and French, students would improve their skills by being in contact with students from different countries. Also, teachers could replace their methodologies following the best ones and the ones which contribute to have qualified students trained to face everyday life situations.
In conclusion, as a great teacher said, we have 21st century students learning with 20th century tools the 19th century knowledge. Thus, there must not be a technological revolution but an educational one.

To the Mayor

I am writing to express my concern about the smoking ban new law. I fear that such a huge move would damage businesses and many workers would lose their jobs.
At present, I am working for Cafe Noir, a well-known restaurant popular with visitors, many of whom have told me that if such a ban were introduced, they would would not enter into restaurants and instead, they would meet friends at home.
On top that, I think the amount of notice you have given people is unreasonable. There needs to be much wider public debate, and if a majority agree, they should be given enough time to get used to.
To support my argument, I would like to tell you what happened in my country when such a ban was introduced. First, it was almost impossible to enforce it. There were not enough police to go round checking any public place. Secondly, business suffered, with people objecting that they should be given the right to smoke if they wished. In the end, the government changed the law, encouraging people to provide non-smoking areas.
This approach strikes me as much more realistic and I urge you to reconsider it before it is too late.

We will talk about a technology that might soon disturb the world. But first let me explain the process taken to manufacture anything. The manufacturing process follows three main stages: designing then producing then consuming. For a quick glimpse, this technology provides the ability to precisely clone any tangible object. This directly affects the producing stage, allowing more efficient production.
    More efficient production means cheaper goods, and by providing them cheaper the consumer now has the ability to purchase more of these goods. Higher purchasing power means that we can buy more goods using the same amount of money. In other words, money would have more value. So, let's say, you have $100,000 now, you would have $10,000,000 fifty years from now. You then could pay your debt, get a new car, buy a new house, invest or retire, or do just about anything you would do if you currently have $10,000,000 in your bank account. Looking at it through a broader scope, country deficits would be solved, hungry people would be fed, and the homeless would get accommodated.
    But why would the goods be cheaper? This is the effect of a reduction in the cost of production; less production cost allows the producer to reduce the price of his goods while maintaining the initial profit. With competition giving him no choice at all, the producer is forced to abide by the market equilibrium. Surprisingly, the producer get to maintain his profits due to the proportional decrease in price as well as the cost to produce. This automatic, efficient, quick, precise technology reduces the amount of labor needed, saves waste initially caused by human errors, saves time and produce at better quality too.
    In conclusion, this revolutionary technology has potential to vastly improve the way we manufacture our goods, and in the process of doing that benefit the whole world.

Dogs and cats are called "furkid" not only because their bodies are covered with fur, but also because their hosts regard pets as kids. I never realized that a furkid would enrich my life until I met Casino, a smart, patient and handsome Golden Retriever raised by my wife's family.

I can still recall the day Cathy and I brought Casino to Taipei City Hall, walking him along the department store pavement, and playing with him all day long. Four days later, he suddenly passed away, and the day became our last memory together.

His body was cremated and buried on a mountain in northern Taiwan. A sweet olive tree was planted with his ashes. We visited him several times over the years, and decided to take the sweet olive tree home with us this year.

I miss Casino so much. He changed my attitude toward dogs: Casino taught me through his patience and passions. Ever since I met him, I stopped feeling frighten when facing big dogs, and even started to play with them.

23 rd. Mar. 2015
Mrs Kate Ashby
Manager of Green Pepper Cafe

After a Year…

You can never really say a thing is worst unless you have indulged yourself in it. You can never really say a situation is unfortunate unless you have already been to it. And you can never really say a teacher in the mountain is miserable unless you have experienced being one. 
When I knew I would be assigned at Gala National High School, I said it’s the worst thing that ever happened to my career. When I knew I would be teaching at the remotest high school in Ozamiz, I said I was so unfortunate, and when I knew I would be spending my days in the mountain, I said my life would be miserable. Indeed, negative vibes filled my thoughts after having known that I was to practice my chosen profession in the place I feared the most. 
But after a year, I was all wrong. 
My first paragraph aptly expresses my exact realization. To have been assigned in the mountain is never a worst situation; I have never been unfortunate, and misery has never been my colleague. In fact, being a teacher in the mountain is being the best of who I am, being the most fortunate of men alive, and being the happiest I could ever be. 
Yes, Gala National High School has given me thousands of reasons to be happy and to feel blessed. In here, I have learned more than the lessons I have taught. The school as a whole has become my great mentor. It has taught me lessons I couldn’t have learned had I not been here - the lessons that do not only help me improve my teaching profession but also help me become the right person of my ministry. Gala has paved the way for me to become that teacher I long to see. I may have been far yet from being an ideal one, but I know someday, having Gala as my guiding light, I can become one.
As to my colleagues, I am grateful to be in a small group of individuals who most of the time shares the same line of interest with me. We are so small a number, but that does not hinder us to hold any school program and activity at its best. With our sheer creativity and enthusiasm, we always made it a point that every school activity is worthwhile. We never settled for any mediocrity. That is us – the teachers of Gala. And that’s one thing I love the most. Together, we aspire for something beyond better. 
My personal relationship with my co-teachers is the same as that of a typical Filipino family. It’s not all the time that we are in good terms, but we know to ourselves that we care for each other. I may have hurt some of my colleagues in a certain circumstance, and they may have hurt me too, but at the end of the day, it’s always camaraderie among us that dominates. And it’s all that matters. 
As to my students, I feel really so fulfilled. At first, it was an extreme challenge for me to handle students in the mountain. Their needs speak beyond intellectual hunger. Every day I got to deal with students wearing different faces of life’s resentment. As a teacher, it took me much of everything I have to come to terms to every pitiful fate of my students. Hence, the value of UNDERSTANDING the students even beyond what the meaning of such word can express has been dramatically instilled in me. And that’s one of the lessons I consider a gem to keep to myself forever. 
Students in the mountain have a lot of different untold stories of their lives. These stories once heard, can open somebody’s heart to learn to love learners despite everything. That is what exactly happened to me. As I listened to my students, I have come to realize the very essence of my existence as their teacher. Consequently, I have seen the need to attend to their needs. I may have not perfectly carried out my responsibilities, but I know somehow in my one year stay in Gala, I have made a difference to my students' lives. 
My everyday interaction with my students has been my everyday fulfillment. Eventually, the huge challenge I have had has turned into my inspiration to do better in my job. My students have a lot of weaknesses in many aspects of life, but seeing them enduring was motivating me even more to give them good reasons to keep on keeping on. My dear students may have not known it, but really, they are too the source of my inner strength. There were times I wanted to back off from the many demands of work, but I always found myself fighting. I have more than enough reason to do that – and they are again, my students.
In a nutshell, Gala may have been very far, yet it my heart, it’s just within. The place, my colleagues, and my dear students are enough testimonies that in Gala I have found a home… and a family to love, really for real.
