Dear Sir:

It is not an easy task to explain the importance of this exam for me, since I do not have any specific objective in mind that requires a Cambridge certification. Similarly, I do not have any study methods in the sense of systematic mechanisms to learn English. What I can say is that I have been learning English since I was twelve, and it has been a pleasure from the start.

My first memory related to the English language is of lyrics; I love pop music and used to translate songs composed by Elton John and Lennon and McCartney. Next I started to read books such as the Harry Potter series and books by George R. R. Martin. I am also an attentive listener of BBC Radio Four. These are my study methods, if I can say so.

About the reasons to take the test, there is little to say. As I have said, I have been learning English by the sheer pleasure of it; but, having come this far, I think it is time to get some kind of formal recognition about my level.

What do people think about teenagers? Why rather negative?

Lots of people think, that teenagers are stupid, have a small knowledge about life, do not have enough experience, are annoying, difficult to understand. In my opinion we shouldn't think like that. I agree that some of young people behave really badly, they smoke, shout on their parents, drink beer, do not improve themselves. But most  of teenagers are even more intelligent than adults or erderly people. At school, at home they have to cope with lots of problems and try to solve them. I strongly disagree that they are not experienced. They sometimes have to help their friends or even their parents in difficult tasks like psychical problems, give them tips. Sometimes it happens that a couple, which has a child in age from 12-16, querls. The young person has to be strong, try to understand the situation.
Tennagers also have to make serious  decisions like choosing secondary school, future job, which way they will go in their life, if they want to be in relationship with someone. Those examples show that teenagers have to cope with lots of problems. Most of them are able to. Of course it's only my opinion.

Ways to collect and record information for future generations

Finding the best way to collect and store information for the future is not just a problem in our working life but also in our private life. That is the reason why our class attended a panel discussion on this specific topic. Different ways of accumulating and storing information were presented at the discussion. I would like to emphasise two options in this essay.

One way to get the information needed is to interview people from the neighbourhood and either write down what is being said or record it as an audio-file. This way you do not only gather plain data but also emotions from people. Additionally, it happens that while speaking of a particular event suddenly more memories and stories come to the narrator’s mind. However, sometimes the narrator tends to fill in the gaps of his/her memory with imaginary parts or tries to embellish certain parts of the story.

Another interesting way to find out more about the past is to collect old photographs. This is an impressive way to document a change over many years, but on the other hand it is challenging to keep photographs in good condition.

For me personally, the best way to collect and record information for future generations is to interview people and to store the information in an appropriate way because of three reasons : Firstly, I have the chance of not getting just one story from a person but maybe two or three more. Secondly, I can catch the  the narrator’semotions. Thirdly, I do not have to be concerned about loss of qualitiy of photographs and pictures.

When I was in Bali, I had a great night that I always remember. My husband and me went to a dinner on the beach of our hotel.

The weather was very good and we enjoyed having dinner barefoot, sat on the sand. The dinner was delicious and we tasted lots of new flavours of Balinese food. After dinner, we saw an interesting show of Balinese dance and music.

When we thouhgt that the night had finished, we had the perfect dessert. Despite it was very dark, we could see something moving on the sand. It was very big... We couldn't believe what we were seeing. It was a very big and beautiful turtle! But... It was lost and couldn't find the way to the water. We shouted and two waiters of the hotel came quickly. They turned the turtle and took it to the water, where freed it. Then the turtle started swimming and disappeared of our sight. We were very happy because of seeing the turtle and hope to come back to Bali to see it again.

In terms of holidays, some people like to visit their own countries, while others prefer going abroad. I think going abroad is much more exciting.

Visiting their own country certainly has its advantages. 
First of all, you don't have to take very long trips. Also, you can have the opportunity to discover new places just next to your home. Besides, this type of vacation is usually less expensive than going abroad. 

On the other hand, many people prefer visiting other countries.
Actually, they like the idea of visiting an unknown land, where everything is different, from the weather to the habits. Furthermore, they also like going abroad to visit important and famous cities around the world, like Paris, Madrid, New York. 

In my opinion, traveling to a foreign country makes people open their minds to other cultures. In fact, going abroad is a nice way to make new friends , try new things and improve a foreign language. In addition, if you plan your vacation very soon, you can also save money on planes or hotels. 

In conclusion, I think it's important to know both their own countries and foreign lands.

It was three in the morning when the phone rang. I was just about to go to bed when I suddenly heard the phone and I got scared because I was alone at home, and I thought that it could be serious news.
 It was in August, my parents and my brother were on holiday in Mallorca for a week, and that same day my sister and her boyfriend travelled from Yecla to Paris in a package travel.
At that moment I thought that an accident or a similar something had happened to my family but fortunately it wasn´t so. 
A girl was on the other side of the phone and she told me that my sister and her boyfriend weren´t with the other passengers.

They didn't have mobile phones because it happened a long time ago.

The film I'd like to talk about is "Secret Life of Walter Mitty". It is a fantastic film with beautiful views and an exciting story. The main character, Walter Mitty, works in a well-known magazine "Life" as a manager of photo negatives. One day he gets a parcel from a famous traveller. In his letter he says that one shot from the film is the best picture he has ever made. Unfortunately, Walter cannot find the shot, so he has to look for the traveller which is not easy. He has to travel to remote parts of the world and have some very amazing adventures. In the end, he manages to meet the traveller and find out where the shot is. I won't tell you any more as it can spoil the story, but the film is definitely worth watching. In addition, I can say that I'm charmed by the main character who is developing throughout the whole film. If you like complicated stories about dreams and how to make them true, this story is definitely for you.

Free of pocket pain & frequented by the locals, there is a dining gem in Nova Gorica. 

Heading towards Tolmin & after passing the famous Solkan Bridge, turn right and follow the road to the left. 

You will find there a parking area and some ball courts, and on further exploration, just after the courts & walking towards that famous bridge that you can now see much better, a restaurant. 

For seasonal food served by obliging & good humoured waiters, you will find nowhere better. 

In summer that boiler of dark liquid beside the entrance might be Kopriva chai, a summer herbal digestif, favoured by the villagers of the region, or you might be offered a world war one menu such as soldiers may have eaten in this area.

Day, date and season dictate the ever interesting & changing menu at this restaurant. 

The warm interior is the perfect place to eat in winter, while in summer, many diners prefer the exterior tables beside the turquoise Soca river.  

One of Slovenia's qualified somnelliers will help you choose from the good wine cellar,  so this is the place where I recommend our class can relax, eat, drink well & enjoy the happy atmosphere.

I would like to talk to you about a musical which I saw recently. It is called "Les Miserables" and has much to recommend it, including the plot, the cast and, of course, the soundtrack. The film is set in France in nineteenth century. Just after the French Revolution. It is an adaptation from the original book "Les Miserables" by Victor Hugo. 

The idea lying behind the story is that justice and law are not the same thing. The main character, Jean Valdjean, played by Hugh Jackman, is jailed for stealing a loaf of bread, in a try to avoid his nephew's death. Then after being left free, he become a thief again, however this time he is not condemned because of a prier. But do not worry I am not going to spoil the ending. All it occurs during the first part of the film. 

Regarding the soundtrack, I can only say that since I saw the film I cannot help singing every song all the time. All in all I think that it is one of the best films ever made.

Travelling by car is becoming more convenient. Cars are improving, becoming safer and environment friendlier. A lot of effort has been put into reducing the fumes, etc. Moreover, people have become more aware of the environment protection. Thus, more and more people, when buying a new car, also consider its environmental friendliness and the possible impact on the community. Also, cars get more affordable in many countries. For example, in India nd China the technological advances have enabled them to mass produce really affordable cars, which are also imported. Together with that, more people are getting familiar with driving and feeling more confident about driving their own car. Once  you know for yourself how comfortable it is to have a car, there's very little chance you will go back to public transport. However, there might be still room for public transport in future, especially in big cities. I mean the underground in the first place. It is very economical in terms of time, distance and people capacity. As for buses, they might be history in decades to come.

Although I don't quite like watching soap operas, I was started watching this particular show with my family. My mother likes watching soap operas on tv and she got me hooked onto this new tv show - iknmp. The show looked promising through its promos, which were based on a very famous old hindi song. The lead actors were well known tv stars. The show was based on the journey of a married couple, living in India, who get separated due to some misunderstandings. The couple have 4 kids and after separation, 2 kids live with their mom and 2 with their dad. The dad, who is a cardiologist moves to US and starts a new life there. The mom on the other hand decides to stay back and works hard to give her children a decent life.

The show starts with the eldest daughter, who lives with her mother trying to contact her father to ask him to be a part of her wedding ceremony. The father who had vowed to never look back at first ignores her requests, however, upon insistence from his other children and his sister agrees to go back to India. The rest of the show is based on the interactions between all 4 children and how they work together to unite their family. It's a typical Indian soap opera in which love conquers over everything. Although not very practical, the show is fun to watch as it brings out the Indian values and at the same time teaches the importance of women being independent and able to lead life on their own.

edits: other goals that an entrepreneur might have were not taking into account
parents' and friends' opinions as important feedback
text:
Innovative entrepreneurship can be perceived as a special process of creating, testing and implementing of the new products and materials, the new way of resource utilization and the new kind of management in business process to find advanced opportunities for (non)commercial use.
The first test has shown that I am very motivated and my skills almost fit to the possibility to be an entrepreneur. However, the attitude that I have is not very appropriate for entrepreneurship. It is important to underline that the driving factors (motivation) determine behaviour of entrepreneur and show the reasons for acting. In the test were accessed the answers and I was found out as a person that has high control appeal meaning that I have great leading skills and a need to organize and to moderate. In the motivation part I also received high score in need of challenges as I prefer to take difficult projects because I believe that they might develop my knowledge and abilities. Moreover, it is really important for me to be own boss even though it needs much more responsibilities. 
Nevertheless, in the test I received fewer points in "need for achievement/success" than it was required for being an entrepreneur. As I found out there were two problems about lack of points. The first one was based on profit orientation of the entrepreneur in the test. The above-mentioned situation means that during the assessment were not taken into account other goals that entrepreneur might have. For instance, it can be the social sustainability and a need to develop the local employment situation or an entrepreneurship as a hobby/lifestyle. The second problem was based on essential role of getting a feedback. However, the test evaluated as important feedback parents and friends opinion and I do not agree that it might be essential unless they are specialists in that field. Nevertheless, I might take a reasonable risk in case it can positively influence business.

PLANE, TRAIN OR BOAT?

Everyone likes something more or less, even when it comes to little things. 
It is certain that each of us loves to travel, but everyone likes the most comfortable means of transport.
For me, the best way to travel is train, because I think this mode of transportation has the most pros. 
One of the things that is very important to me is the price. I'm not going to spend a lot of money for a ticket, because I'm studying so I just have a part-time job. If we check the prices of air travel, we can be disappointed as well as of travel by boat. Fortunately the train tickets are cheaper.
Another very important thing is the travel time. Plane flies very quickly, but you have to be at the airport at least an hour earlier. In the case of a ship, travel time is immense. Travelling by train is quite fast, and pleasant, I can safely travel to more places worldwide than people taking a boat or plane transport.
After the summary is to certify that travelling by train is the most advantageous, but the most important reason why I chose journey by train a fact that I have a motion sickness, and I'm afraid to fly.

edits: many new and more advanced projects are realised more often
text:
At the end of a decade in which technology has made enormous leaps, I am thinking about how much present vision of house will change in the future.
Despite many differences in the human nature, the present houses do not differ so much between themselves. Most of the homes have walls, doors, windows and are built on solid ground. Furthermore, they have flat or sloping roofs, one or more floors. Some are situated in the neighbourhood of parks, forests or lakes.
On the other hand, recently, more often many new and more advanced projects are realized by daring architects. They often do not use the popular brick but  glass, wood, plastic. But can you imagine that in the near, unspecified future all homes will be like that? Built by using the most modern technology, full of the latest inventions which man can create? Of course, for people to live better, but it would be useful to modern houses to be constructed so as to do not damage the environment. I think quite few scientists still surprise us, and the house of the future will go beyond the limits of our imagination.

DEVELOPMENTS IN THE TEACHING OF ENGLISH IN SPAIN
 There has been major changes regarding the teaching approach in the last few years, but there is still room for improvement. If we focus on the teaching of English as a foreign language, we possibly could see this more clearly. In the early 1980s the activity in the classroom was focused on grammar. However, speaking, listening activities and the massive use of I.T mark the schedule nowadays. All these changes make the learning process much more fun, creative and practical for the students. 
The new teaching approach is based on how students can effectively use the language rather than on the knowledge of the language they actually have. This new outlook on the teaching procedures consists of the use of the so called alternative assessment as a way to evaluate learners´ skills. A grammar test shows knowledge about the language, whereas alternative assessment shows learners´ ability to efficaciously use the language in the context of a real situation.
There are many reasons for using alternative assessment techniques: learners demonstrate things learned, take responsibility, motivation may increase and they have the opportunity to use language for actual purposes.
It is important to notice that the difficulty to carry out the changes towards the new teaching approach- referred to above- lies not with the students themselves but with the old generation of teachers, since they sometimes have trouble applying the new outlook on education methods.
In conclusion: The way of teaching is changing in the last few years all over Spain. The main reason for that could be found by overlooking the matters related to new teaching methods developed recently. However, a smooth transition to the new approach is still necessary to overcome the massive education-related challenges Spain will have to face in the upcoming years.

In the year 2020 there was conflict between Japan and the United states. The conflict was due to trend creation, citizens between both countries wanted to see who created better and bigger trends. This conflict was an incentive for clothing stores to sell new and weird things for a higher price. Law enforcers also wanted for their country to win, and in the United States policemen arrested any Japanese person they saw and sent them back to Japan. The Japanese government made a competition to see which of their citizens was the best trend-setter. The winner's reward was the ability to rule over Japan for a day. After two years, the winner was decided, and he made Japan go into poverty. Once the day was over, the Japanese government tried to reverse all of the damages done, but it was impossible. The winner had changed Japan's landscape, what once was the amazing city of Tokyo now was a sad and dirty city. Japan asked the United states for help, they gladly agreed, and they dragged Japan back up to their normal status. Japan lost a lot, but it was able to get back up on its feet. Everyone was happy for some time and true peace between the countries of the world had been achieved, but then the United States enslaved Canada and tried to enslave Japan as well, but they were able to defend themselves. Japan launched a counter attack and enslaved the United States, and then proceeded to conquer the world. A new era was created, it was the most brutal time period in the history of mankind, it was known as many things most people named it "The Japan Era", but it was so brutal that the official name was "The Dark Yellow Era"

I would like to recommend the following movie: "The perfume".
This movie can be considered a classical thriller, but with several aspects that makes it unique in this gender.
First of all, the historical period is the victorian age in France. Landscapes are really wonderful. The buildings, dresses, and habits of population are displayed in full detail.
Secondly, we have and amazing script that can be considered unique. The story tell us the importance of the perfume in all aspects of our lifes.
The movie´s main plot describes the early years of our starring, a poor orphan, which takes advantage of his powerful smell sense to find out new jobs.
We will discover the importance of a unique fragrance and how to mix the ingredients in the right proportions. This idea will create the atmosphere to tell us a story about crime and passion. Finally we will discover a fantastic ending that we would never imagine through the movie watching.
The overall rate of this movie is really high and it is a movie to remember forever. Nevertheless this is not an all audiences movies, because it contains hard scenes not suitable for children.
If people can rent this movie or watch it online I would encourage watch it as fast as possible. Few other modern movies are so great in comparison. The two hours that you will spend watching the movie will become unique in your life.

Many people believe that public transport will be replaced by private one in the nearest future. The main reason is the convenience of travelling by cars in comparison with using public transport. Apart from that, there are many other benefits in buying a car instead of using buses or underground every day.

First of all, an automobile gives such a valuable thing as privacy. For example, driving a car we can wear whatever we want and listen to the music on any volume. If the car is large enough, it can be even a perfect place for sleep. Additionally, if we are eager to travel outside the town in order to have some rest from a hectic rhythm of life, it will be more comfortable for us to use our cars. Only our own vehicle can provide us with an opportunity to find any quiet and pleasant place outside the city. Public transport can take us just to certain locations. Thus, it is clear that private transport such as automobiles has plenty of advantages.

On the other hand, we can stuck with different problems while travelling by car. For instance, staying in traffic jams always steals much our precious time. Car accidents are the typical reason for this phenomenon. It means that travelling by cars can even be more dangerous than using public transport. Generally, bus drivers are much more experienced than automobile ones, therefore, accidents caused by public transport happen quite rarely. This makes travelling by public transport much safer. Thus, I would argue that driving a car requires much attention and understanding that careless behaviour on the road can make a serious damage to other people.

In conclusion, I believe that public transport will eventually lose its dominance due to the fact that all people want to be independent and travel on their own.

Anna knew that it was going to be a very special day for her. She was woken up very early by the sun coming through her window. She opened her sleepy eyes, smiled gently and got up from her bed idly. She went downstairs to the cosy bathroom and had a shower. After that, she dressed up and went to the kitchen to make a breakfast.
She turned on the music and started to prepare a healthy meal. After aeting delicious salad and drinking tea, she went to her room to do her hair and put the make-up on. Anna was a bit stressed, but she was sure, that everything will be alright.
While she was getting ready, she heard a door bell. She came down and opened the door - it was her mother. They hugged and smiled to each other. Anna's mother looked at her tenderly and hugged her once again. She came in and noticed that her daughter is a little nervous, so she decided to make a coffee, sit and talk for a while. As they were talking, Anna's best friends came up. They looked really cheerful and excited. They quickly took her upstairs to the room.
After some time friends came down and told Anna's mother, that she is ready and she is going to come in a while. She stood up and looked at her daughter coming down the stairs. Anna looked incredibly beautiful. Her mum came to her and hugged her really affectionately. "It's your big day. One of the most important moments in your life. I am so happy" said mother with a tear in her eye. It was Anna's wedding day.

Aiming high!

My all-time favourite sport is basketball. I started playing at the age of seven, when my mother encouraged me to join a basketball club. It was very enjoyable from the onset, and has been a fantastic experience to learn the sport together with other children. Another key factor was the coach, who knew how to convey the skills and techniques to children. 
Moreover, I was fascinated by the feeling of belonging to a team in which each member shares the same goals and values. This is an important feature that will also help anyone in all spheres of life. One also learns to work hard and disciplined in order to achieve success. All these points led to me playing basketball for almost thirty years now and I'm still hooked by it.  
If someone would ask me for advice on how to start playing basketball, I would probably suggest starting with a trial practise and if the person enjoys it, he/she can join the club. When choosing a club, I believe it's important that an experienced coach is present who knows how to teach the basics.
  
Yours faithfully,

F.

One of my favorite restaurants in Málaga is called Sun and Shine.  Is situated in the city center, near the seaport.  It is a different kind of restaurant, because you can find not only the typical Spanish food, also dishes from different parts of the world. 
What I like most of this restaurant is that it offers healthy and balanced food, the flavor is fantastic, the food very tasty and carefully cooked. You can enjoy original food, good quality on a budget.
On the other hand the surroundings are modern, the place is airy and cosy. The waiters are very welcoming and informative so you feel very comfortable. All the ingredients are very fresh and of the highest quality. In my opinion the salad is the best option, with a big range of types from different countries. My favorite one is the Italian salad, because it is healthy and the sauce they use is savoury and strange.
Finally I really recommend this restaurant , especially for couples or friends that want to try something different and newfangled.

Dear Paul,

I hope all is well with you.
I'd like to thank you for the lovely experience you offered me.
I really enjoyed helping out at the concert last month.
Unfortunately we didn't get the chance to see each other that night.
I suppose you'd like to hear about my experience.
I started the evening by welcoming everyone and appointing them their seats.
I enjoyed this very much, because I got the chance to meet a lot of people.
Later that evening, I worked behind the bar.
During two hours I served drinks.
What I enjoyed the most, was helping backstage, where I got the chance to meet the artists.
They were such nice people and really appreciated my help.
At the end of the evening I worked at the parking lot.
All in all a great experience! You can rely on my help next year!

Thanks again for the lovely experience!

Regards,

Camille.

Dear visitors,
welcome to the historic town of Lancaster!You are now in the vibrating heart of Lancashire. Lancaster is situated close to the Irish Sea und just around the corner you will find the stunning lake District with its romantic lakes and peaks.
When you are visiting Lancaster you can discover many historic sights such as the Castle and Priory, the Judges Lodgings or the Ashton Memorial which overlooks the city. However, the city centre also offers just as much opportunities for you to go shopping. Whatever you need, someone in Lancaster will sell it to you. Whether you want a fancy bottle of wine, a secondhand wedding dress or an antique clock you will find it in Lancaster. You are offered the standard big brands like M&S, Next, Waterstones and others, but you can also find little private shops selling all types of goods. If youe are leaving the main roads and turn into the little alleys you will find charming tea rooms and goregeous antique shops with a wide range of ancient goods. However, if you are looking for little goodies for your family members, you should visit the shop close to the castle. Twice a week a street market offers guests and residents a wide range of daily goods which have been harvested in the area and are sold by locals.

Canada is a nation built of citizen-soldiers.  From soldiers who served in the trenches of France to the ceremonial functions in the nation’s Capital.  Nathan Cirillo is remembered as one of those soldiers.  A member of The Argyll and Sutherland Highlanders of Canada, he was killed at the Tomb of the Unknown Soldier in October 2014.   He was standing guard, at the memorial, when he was shot dead from behind at point blank.  One year later a commemoration of his passing was celebrated.  His death shocked a nation.  Unarmed, at attention, and protecting the memory of those who gave the ultimate sacrifice, his last moments and those who came to his assistance, exemplify the true meaning of being Canadian.  Canada is a peaceful nation always ready to wear the uniform when called upon by its country.  Events like these confirm that Canada is no longer immune to attacks on home soil.

Dear Sir or Madam,

I am writing in reply to your advertisement in the European Observer of April 7th for a post at USA Summer Camp.

I am aged 44, of Austrian nationality, married and hold the Cambridge English Advanced certificate since last summer. I would welcome an opportunity to work in the USA this summer in order to practise my English.

Cheerfulness is in my nature and I am used to working hard. I would be happy to support the USA Summer Camps team in every aspect.

I am also experienced with children, having looked after my sister's daughters aged 9, 11 and 14 for years now. Whenever possible I take the girls out for a swim or a ride on their bikes. It is also a good idea to play badminton and minigolf with them. In the evenings, singing, dancing and torchlight walks are a good alternative to watching TV. Further, I worked as an au-pair in France and Canada, where I watched over 3, respectively, 2 children.

Finally, cooking is a hobby of mine and I would be happy to work in the kitchens too.

I look forward to your reply at your earliest convenience.

Sincerely yours,

Patrick

Eating with  strangers.

In the growing "sharing" economy, online communities are offering peer to peer for almost anything. One of my favourite is eatwith.com.                        
It's a website which allow me to taste food from around the world without moving from my city, at the same time that you can speak different languages and meet new people.
The best thing about this web  is that very easy to use. First, you have to select the city New York, Barcelona,etc. Second, you choose a menu and make a reservation.
You can use this web if you are a tourist or just someone who wants to enjoy a dinner in your own city. On the other hand, if you are a professional or an amateur chef, you'll earn an extra money. 
There's nothing like share a meal with local people, it offers you the possibility to glean from someone who lives in the place.

The wedding of my niece was celebrated in Barcelona last weekend. It was the most exciting and beautiful party I have ever been to.
First of all, my mother, my children, my partner and I took the train in Zaragoza to go to Barcelona. It was a pleasant journey that lasted only two hours. When we arrived in Barcelona we went by taxi to the hotel, which my brother had previously booked, and there we met with other relatives: my brother, his wife, my nephews and of course my niece (the bride). My brother's wife's close relatives were also there.
We all went together to have lunch to a nearby restaurant. After lunch we could have a nap or start to prepare for the wedding. I managed to make my mother have a siesta, so that she was more energetic for the party.
The marriage ceremony took place at a wonderful church, there were flowers everywhere, live music, three hundred guests and of course, the bride and the bridegroom, the most beautiful and happy couple I have ever seen as far as I can remember. Hundreds of photos were taken before, during and after the wedding.
The party was held in a large garden near the bridegroom’s fathers’ house. A historic building in one of the most luxurious places in Barcelona. There were delicious snacks and drinks before the dinner.
The dinner was a three main course meal which had been carefully chosen by the new couple. The party continued with a splendid dancing until seven in the morning.

Taking a break between leaving school and starting college seems unnecessary. If you are wealthy, or you come from a family where your father can provide you with most of the things you want, I suggest going to college straight away will be a good idea.  Some of us are afraid to travel because of the newborn cases of ISIS. Terrorism is everywhere. Mass shooting, bombs, hacking into security system can happen any time, any day. Not many of us are going to risk our lives, especially when we all know we are going to have a fresh start in college. However, for those who really need to fork out money to pay college loans, it is best for them to take a year off and work part time at a cafe, or somewhere remotely interesting. It is wise for them to find some time to save some money so they would not need to struggle during college. 

However, some just want to have some fun, after years in high school, after so many years of break ups, after so many years of eating cafeteria food, it is time to find some enjoyable time with quality friends and with mouth-watering food. They just want to forget about the past and focus on the present. In their minds, it is all about having fun but is it really what it is? What if they forget themselves? What if they changed into some monster they cannot suppress? What if drugs, alcohol, cigarettes took over their lives? Is that how they want to start college? The real question is, do they want to actually be an alcoholic and a drug addict when they enter college? Look, they are still very young and they are all prone to bad influences through parties without parental control. 

Hence, if there is no reason to take a year off, just go to college and start studying. There is absolutely no time to waste your youth on drugs and alcohol.

2 years ago, I was a bad guy who wanted to fight anyone, so no one wanted to be my friend. One day in the post, I had an argument with a man who studied in the same university as me, and I challenged him to fight with me: I thought it would solve the problem between us. He did not want to fight with me because he was smaller than me, so he just ignored me and walked away. That made me get crazy and angry, so I knocked him down with only one punch. After that he told the teacher who was responsible for that class, and called me into her room and asked me questions. At that time, I was really proud of myself that I could beat him so easily. The day after, I was thinking deeply and just realized that I was wrong and should not hurt him because I was angry. I decided to talk to him and asked him to forgive me. I felt relieved he forgave me. This story tells us that sometimes we cannot control ourselves, but we should be alone and think positively or take a deep breath, and these will make us calm down.

Hi, my name is Priscila and I just realized that I am a writer, too. I am Brazilian and I started to learn how to write in Portuguese when I was 7 years old. I think this period when we start to write is magical, because we can access an entire new communication world. 

From 7 to 18 years old, I mainly wrote for school during classes, homework, and tests. When I was 16, I lived in Nicholson – PA – USA. I was an exchange student and attended high school there. That was the first time my work was assessed by the way I wrote in English. This experience was very important and made me more confident about my English skills. 

Back to Brazil, during college I started researching and writing about economics. I love economics, so I kept studying and I have got a masters and a PHD degree in labor economics. I had to write a dissertation and a thesis and, I will not lie, these writing processes were very hard, but I learned a lot about academic writing.

Today, I work as an economics professor at the Federal University of Goias, in Brazil. Because of my work, I have to write all the time to my students, to my colleagues and to the academic community in general. I want to discuss the results of my research with everyone that is interested in it, from Brazil or from any other place in the world. Therefore, for me, writing in English, now, is more important than ever.

I expect that this course will help me develop my English skills, so that I can write my papers, communicate and discuss my research in more effective way.

In modern world, public transport become less important as travelling by car is said to be more convenient. Travelling by car also reduces their time of journey and they don't need to wait for a particular bus. It may also because as people are getting richer they don't need to go for a public transport as more comfortable option is always there waiting for them.
  Though public transport is more advantageous to the environment, people just want to get their personal needs satisfied. The world is moving faster and everyone has to be fast enough to compete with this modern world. While comparing the drawbacks of public transport with  modernized vehicles,public transport may not seems to be a better choice. But this is not true.
  More usage of vehicles may cause serious problems such as depletion of natural resources and environmental issues such as pollution. Although the maintenance cost of car is quite expensive, it does not stop people from using cars since convenience matters to them the most and not money. Many people think that public transport is only for poor and not for rich. If it continues, no resource will be spared for the future generation.
  Everyone should remember, "Nature has enough resources to satisfy our needs, not our greed."

Nowadays, many people around the globe are trying to acquire a second language, when it comes to decide between learning in our own country versus learning abroad, we can find several pros and cons that might get us fairly confused.
On the one hand, an advantage of studying in your own country is that you would be able to share with people with the same problems during their learning process as you. However, a major drawback would be the lack of exposure to the language that is intended to be learnt.
On the other hand, the most important advantage of studying abroad would be precisely, the exposure, which would help you understand the language from native speakers’ point of view and be aware of how some expressions or words are actually used. However, as a disadvantage, we must consider the cost of studying abroad, because it can be rather expensive.
To sum up, the best way of learning English, or rather the best place to do it depends on each person’s means and learning style, but definitely it is possible to acquire a second language both at home and abroad.

People try to skip Good Friday because, there is no feasts in that day. Moreover, it is the sombrest day in a year, which recalls people the Crucifixion caused by people's sins. People prefer to meet happiness and positive thinking then talking about a death and a suffering. They want to skip this day and move to Easter Sunday- the day of happiness and renewal. Accordingly, the author compares the Easter to a pagan spring festival, where people were joyful because of spring coming just as a Christians's cheerfulness of the Resurrection.

2. We flinch from consideration of Good Friday because we do not like thinking of a sad situation. People choose pleasant entertainments instead of talking about a death, a suffering and a self-sacrifice. Today people are not willing to sacrifice themselves for other people. Everyone is individual and worries about themselves, because it is easier way to live. Above all, people are not used to undergo suffering and what is more brutal death.

4. The author mentions the origin of the word 'compassion', in order to remind people the meaning of that word. It refers to 'suffer with'. Nevertheless, people make this compassion tided away, because it is too painful for them to stand that. Not only they run away from uncomfortable situations  but they also prefer to see them on screens. Actually, they choose the Good Life, because they cannot cope with their own suffering without cultural understanding.

I want to write about the best vacation I ever had. It took place about two years ago. My school friends and me went to Dominican Republic, it's a Caribbean country with amazing beaches. Even though I don't like places like that, I rather enjoyed this trip a lot. Maybe it was because I was with my friends and I could find many ways to spend my time with them or it could also be the great environment. I remember we got there the first of October on a Saturday night, and I will never forget the rush of warmth I felt as soon as I stepped out of the plane. First, I thought that it was something else causing the warmth, but later on I learned that the weather was like that all the time and I just had to get used to it. When we got to the resort we all checked in and went to our designated rooms. I was sharing a room with my friend Emily. After unpacking we left our room to see the rest of the resort. We found a club, 3 big pools, sports fields and, of course, the amazing beach, though we couldn't see much of it because it was really dark at night. The next day, we made sure to go to the beach early and we had a blast with our other friends. This went on until the last day of our trip. We were, obviously, sad because this amazing time was ending but happy as well for the memories we shared together. I will remember this vacation for the rest of my life.

Television is one of the most important inventions of the last century since it has had a great impact on societies around the world. Since Television was first invented, it has influenced different aspects of people's lives.  
Since Television was launched to the market it has acquired other purposes besides entertaining, such as communicating and advertising, that is way the possibility of it having educational purposes has been widely discussed. 
Television can certainly educate, it has great potential for doing so because of the way it presents information and the scope of people it can achieve. 
Television can educate in several ways, to mention some: by providing and extending information given in certain curses at school, and by providing information that is not even taught at school. 
It is very exciting that entertainment and education can be merged for accomplishing the spread of knowledge along the masses in an enjoyable way. 
Television can educate through content whose main purpose at first was entertaining. Television series, contests, movies, and news which do it all the time without us being aware of it.

text:
Dear Sir/Madam, 

I am writing regarding the advertisement on USA SUMMER CAMPS. I found this advertisement on the newspaper and I would like to state the reasons why I think I am suitable for the job at hand. 

First of all, I would like to point out that I have some experience in the area, since I have worked as a group leader before. Last year I was in Canada and two years ago I fulfilled the same role in England. The groups I was in charge of mostly consisted of people from ages 6 to 12, although I once had the chance to work with a group of young adults as well.

Everywhere I have worked before I have been praised for being very organised and having the ability to deal with unexpected situations successfully. I like to consider myself an energetic person. Usually, I don't have much time to spend on myself since I am always occupied with something. I have taken part of a basketball team since the age of 5 and I have recently become a young ladies' group's coach. As for my cooking abilities, I used to work as a kitchen assistant during the summertime. I did that for three summmers and I still help out at my parents' restaurant when a hand is in need. 

I would really appreciate it if you could take my application into account. If you do, I would also like to be sent the accommodation details, if possible, to the following address: 62Dssy7@gmail.com. If you need any other details, let me know so that I can send them to you as soon as possible. 

Yours faithfully. 

Rosa.

P.S. I have attached my CV

Dear Sir or Madam:
I am writing in response to your advertisement which I saw in the International Newspaper to apply for the job in the USA Summer Camps. 
This year, I have finished my degree in Mathematics in the University of Zaragoza and in September, I will start to study to become in teacher. I also have studied English language for ages and I consider that I have a good level. Moreover, this job would be an excellent experience to improve my English and be more selfconfident.
As for my experience, I love working with children and I sometimes took care of my nieces which they are 10 years old. My degree took up all my free time during this year, however, I tried to go on doing sport, especially  running and playing football. I also try to keep up with the latest trends in sports events.
I describe myself as a sociable, responsible, trustworthy and hardworking person which likes working with children. For all these reasons, I feel that I have a lot to offer your summer camp.

I enclose my CV and I would be glad to attend an interview at any time convenient for you.  
I look forward to hearing from you very soon.
 Yours faithfully,

My favorite sport is Football, but it is not a sport that I like to practise it's a sport to watch because it's beautiful, very cool and very exciting to support a team in a championship. I am Brazilian, and as almost everybody in my country, I'm a big football fan.

I've always loved to watch soccer, since I was a little kid, because my father was a great fan of the biggest team in Brazil, Flamengo. Actually, in his honor I had a Flamengo shield tattooed on my back on the left side because there wasn't a better way to pay homage to him than a Flamengo tattoo. 

The World Cup is happening now in my country Brazil. I love it when this event happens, so many incredible games going on, best players of the world, three games per day at the start, and with very good looking players. I don't know what exactly happens but in every World Cup the atmosphere changes, everybody gets happier, Mc Donalds launches the tastiest hamburgers, people go out to watch games with friends in bars or they meet in somebody's house.

I love the World Cup despite the fact that it being in Brazil has brought a lot of political problems, or just show us how corrupt our government can be with the huge overpriced projects, a lot of money that has been spent on unfinished stadiums, with shameful delays in their construction, etc. I love the World Cup, however i certainly would have preferred if it had been in another country.

I love to run because I think it is good for my mental and physical health.  Just running 30 minutes a day, you can improve your physical activity, lose weight, and improve your brain.  Also it helps you to release the daily stress and is a good motivator.

Everybody needs to know about the benefits they can get from running.  

You start walking 10 minutes each day, then for 20 minutes and you can add more minutes till start running for 30 minutes and then for an hour.  The best place to run is a nice spot close to the park.  You just need a pair of running shoes and clothes appropriate for the weather.  In winter, you need to put on heavy clothes, while in summer lighter clothes, a hat and pair of glasses will be all you need.  It is very important to put some sunblock on your face, neck and hands. 

In winter I go to run for half an hour in the afternoons, but in summer I go out and run in the mornings and in the afternoons to enjoy the nice weather.

Sometimes, you feel that you don't want to do it, but believe, once you put on your shoes, things change and you enjoy the running as you do it all the time.

It started a few years ago when I was a little overweight.  Being a person that loves sports, it is hard for me to see gaining pounds through the years.  Once I decided that I needed to do something, I started walking around my place.  

After three months, I was running faster and the pain in my heels disappeared. I was still out of breath sometimes,  but I kept doing it because I wanted to achieve my goal to lose 10 pounds.  After six months I was running almost 2 miles each day.  And now I am running 4 miles a day.

So, don't be lazy, get up and start running.  It is a great journey that is worth it!

Dear Sir / Madam, 

I am writing to express my interest in applying for the Sample Analyst position in your Laboratory.
I hold a Master’s degree in Environmental Biology and, previously, I have had the opportunity to work on international research projects that would provide me with the skills sets I need to be an effective fit in your laboratory. Based on my understanding of this position, you offer a full on-the-job training to your employees and encourage their  involvement with all laboratory activities . This opportunity appeals enormously to me and I feel confident that I can meet the challenges presented by such a role.
While engaged in diverse experiences (including my research internship, environmental volunteer service, and other types of employment), I have maintained standards of excellence at university and demonstrated my ability to take on a number of responsibilities as well as to effectively manage multiple concurrent projects while meeting deadlines.
As an intern in a biological laboratory, I have been trained to quickly learn new fields, think through problems in an analytical manner and maintain flexibility within a demanding schedule. As a meticulous, organized and result-oriented biologist, I pay great attention to details, am skilled in gathering data and used to keep detailed records. In addition, working closely with a team of dedicated researchers has helped me understand the importance of an efficient lab practice and develop my group-oriented skills. As a result, I am well prepared to collaborate with interdisciplinary teams as well as to be effective in independent work when I am required to use my own initiative to complete a task or solve a problem. Moreover, through my internship experience, I have acquired good analytical, quantitative and computer skills.
Beyond my coursework, I have taken an active role in international volunteer activities for three years, in the last of which I coordinated projects from the beginning to end. This leadership role required proficient communication skills, as I was providing support to people of different ages, backgrounds (with varying levels of English) or levels of technical capabilities.
With my relevant coursework, lab experience, committed and adaptable attitude, I am confident of excelling in this position. I would welcome the opportunity to join your team and put my skills to work for your Laboratory.
Please find attached  my Curriculum Vitae for your review. Thank you for your time and consideration. I look forward to receiving your reply. Should you need any additional information, please do not hesitate to contact me.

Yours faithfully,   

Valentina Toscano

Scout (Jean Louise) Finch is a round character. She is the narrator of the story.
Her outter look seems like a little girl. She is dark haired, very thin and small. Talking from the outter look, one can easily see that Scout is not "the usual" girl. Scouts character is kind of a tomboy. She does not like to dress like a lady even when aunt Alexandra tries to make a lady out of her, Scout refuses to dress or speak like one.
From the outside to her inner qualities. Scout is a really smart girl. In young age, before she went to school, she started reading. Her intelligence in young age was a Problem for her teacher Miss Caroline, because never had such a well-educated pupil before. Instead of celebrating it, she somhow inhibits Scouts learning. Due to that Scout gets bored and starts to hate school.
Furthermore Scout often reacts very impulsive, mostly in young age. She goes after Walter Cunningham after she gets in trouble on his behalf. Also when she had trouble with her cousin, because she called Atticus a "nigger-lover" Scout beats her up. In the first part of the novel, fighting is a technique that works for Scout. For her it is a method to make her mind clear. Later on Scout begins to understand, not least because of her father and brother, that it is important to think before talking. Somehow she reverts back to her old ways.
To conclude Scout is a smart girl with two sides. On the one hand Scout acts very impulsive and is an obstreperous tomboy but on the other hand she is very clever and more adult than others in her age. Scout always develops the story.

Dear Ali,

How are things with you? Are you still working all the hours God sends preparing for your exams? I'm sorry I haven't written for ages, but I was very busy with the school project I had to do this month. Thanks again for all your help. I'm very glad I can finally do something for you after everything you've done for me.
So you need information about my country's eating customs? Well then, let's start with the time we eat and what we eat at those moments here in Holland. On weekdays, Dutch people take their breakfast, which usually consists of a few sandwiches, somewhere between 7.00 and 8.00 a.m. In the weekend, we tend to sleep in and therefore take our breakfast a bit later. Around 12.00 a.m., most people have lunch, which also consists of sandwiches and is just as light as breakfast. When the clock strikes 6.00 p.m., it's time for dinner, the only warm meal of the day as well as the heaviest meal of the day.
Let me also tell you something about traditional Dutch meals. The most important ones are probably hotchpotches: mashed potatoes and vegetables, often combined with smoked sausage. In my opinion, some of them are absolutely revolting. A traditional Dutch meal which I think is far more tasty, consists of little thick pancakes, served warm with melted butter and icing sugar. Those pancakes are called "poffertjes". They can be eaten any time of the day, for breakfast, lunch, supper... Whole generations are brought up with this dish, yummy as it is.
Is this enough information for your project? If you want to know more about Dutch eating habits, just write to me, and I'll write back, giving you any other information you might need. Anyway, I really need to stop now, since I have got to get down to my homework.

All the best with your project,

Suzanne

My favourite way to travel is most definitely by plane. 
There are many reasons why plane travel is the way to go.

First, on a plane, I can get to my destination much faster.  This means I can actually go places. 
In a few hours time, I can get to some far-away destination.  I can make it a quick trip, too.  
I can go to Paris for a long weekend, for example.  The plane will get me there quickly so that I can have
go shopping, eat some lovely French meals, drink lots of wine and return before work on Monday. 

Boats trips are long and boring.  I went on an Alaskan cruise in 1997.  It was freezing cold and most of the time we 
were just sitting on the ship with nothing to do but eat.   I also got sea sick.  I definitely don't recommend it.
Trains are also boring, unless you take a bullet train, and I get motion sickness. 

Therefore, when it comes to speed and being able to go places, planes are definitely the best type of transportation available.   
I highly recommend a plane trip as soon as possible.

In today's intercultural world, one of the best assests people and nations can have is tolerance and a deep appreciation of cultural values different from their own. No wonder most training includes intercultural communication and cultural awareness courses. However, it is probably a truism that reading about or watching films about a country are only pale subsitutes to actually going to visit a place and experiencing the differences yourself. And the longer you stay in a place different from what you are accustomed to, the more opportunities you have to really understand what makes people behave a certain way, what they really like and dislike and how their community works.
