Many people have the impression that learning a language is only possible through hard work: studying grammar rules, learning vocabulary by heart and burying your head in a book. However, there are in fact several methods that you can employ should you want to become a linguist. In this essay I will discuss two of these: the immersion method, and the classroom method.

Firstly, the immersion method takes its inspiration from the way in which we all learnt to speak our nature tongue: implicitly. With this method, learners are simply exposed to the target language, either by going abroad to live in the country where it is spoken, or by having a native teacher. There is no explicit focus on grammar; instead, the learners are expected to “absorb” the language and its rules. This method has its advantages, as it is the way we all learnt to speak, and so it is arguably more natural. Another advantage is that students are unencumbered by overcomplicated, confusing metalanguage.

Secondly, the classroom method is the one with which most students (especially if they are older) are familiar. Learners are normally taught in their mother tongue, and are given grammar rules, which they then apply to the language they are learning. This method also has its benefits, not least logistically speaking, since many students don’t have access to native speakers or are not able to travel abroad. Furthermore, some learners respond better to an explicit focus on rules, which make them aware of the mistakes they are making.

While both methods clearly have their advantages, I believe that just limiting students to either one or the other can have a negative effect on language learning. Having a native speaker will give students maximum exposure to the language, while at the same time a focus on rules will give them the tools for self-correction and self-study.  I fully believe that this combination method is the most effective way for students to learn English.

Now we are going to evaluate the main charactheristics and differences between a pellet stove and a pellet boiler.
Let's start to focus our attention at the pellet stove. The diagram shows a compact structure and the simplicity of the machine; it has three main sections: the feed section, the combustion chamber and the blower(i.e. fan). In the first conic part it is possible to feed with the fuel (i.e. the pellet) that leads to the combustion chamber where the pellet will burn to generate the heat necessary to warm up the air. Beneath the combustion chamber there is the ash tray necessary to collect the ash generated by the combustion of the pellet. As mantion above the heat is necessary to warm up the air that, thanks to the fan, will be blown out to the room in order to warm up the external ambient (e.g. room, bathroom, kitchen...). This is a pretty compact machine but it's not very efficient and very clean. Actually, it produces a high amount of pollution such as ash and exhausted gas that contains micro- and nano-particle.
Let's focus now on the pellet boiler. The structure is pretty much the same as the pellet stove, the difference is that instead of a fan here we have a pump due to the fact that the goal of the boiler is to warm up water and send it to the heaters all over the house, so it's nedded a pump to do that instead of just a fan (the pourpose of a fan and a pump it's the same: move fluid from a point A to a pont B, but in one case you have to move air and in the second case water (they have a different density: water has 1000 times the density of air).
Like in the stove there is a feed section where you can feed the pellet that will go directly to the combustion chamber (according to the control system) in order to burn it and generate the heat to warm up the water. Now, thanks to the pump the hot water is able to reach the upstairs rooms.
Basically the two rely on the same methods: burning pellets to warm up a fluid (air for the stove and water for the boiler).

My home town, an international city, attracts millions of tourists from all over the world every year.  Knowing a clean and tidy city is no less appealing to the  tourists than beautiful scenery and bargain shopping, both the authority and the citizens understand the need to keep our city clean in order to keep the tourists coming, therefore they are serious in protecting the environment.


To keep the city clean and tidy, people adopt an environmentally friendly attitude in daily life: they refuse littering, if they cannot find a rubbish bin around, they keep rubbish in small plastic bag; at home, they separate the recyclable items from the rubbish before they get rid of the rubbish.  They follow the government's advice to set the air conditioner temperature at 25 degrees of Celsius.  

The government plays a crucial role in taking care of the environment.  It build sewage sites for the disposal of the city's waste.  It educates the citizens to cultivate their sense of protecting the city's environment.  We are lucky to live in a city where both the authority and the people have a strong sense of environmental protection.  We are sure that the tourists who visit our city can feel it and hope that they will help spread the message when they go home.

As you get involved with football and you enroll with this sport, you will clearly notice the benefits it brings to your daily life. So, give it a shot and you will realize it is one of the most amazing activities you can ever do.

'The letter that changed my life'

‘I think we’re being followed’ said Sara to me, as we pulled over the street.

We’d had a lovely meal in one of the most charming restaurants in Rome. Despite the fact that We’d had to share a table with others tourists, we’d had a great time.
 Sara had left our hire-car keys on top of the table and had paid no attention to them for a while. When we were about to leave we realized that there were a short letter on the table. ‘I have your car keys. Wait for me, please’ it said. We didn’t understand a thing because the car keys were just in front of us. So we rushed out the restaurant on suspicion of theft. 

We‘d been driving for half an hour when I noticed that there were a white car behind us. Sara tried to get rid of it but the white car was still there. We pulled over the main road. The other car driver came up to us slowly. We were really afraid.' You've had the wrong keys and the wrong car' said the man. As soon as the man explained everything to us we realised that we had mistaken car keys in the restaurant because both of them were exactly alike.

We exchange addresses and as time went on we became good friends. I ended up working to  Mr Smith' company in Madrid where I've been working there for 20 years.

People seem to be living quiet comfortable lives nowadays. We have reached an age of high technology. Humans will most likely continue to improve this technology and make their lives better for the future. We might live better lives in the future.
When thinking about how the lives of people will be like in the next 50 years, the first thought that comes to my mind is a person sitting lazily on a sofa that can adjust itself to his/her will. The reason for the laziness is that the work of the house will be done by robots. This is how I think life would be in the next 50 years. Robots will continue to be improved, till they will be able to do all work at home, so no one rich enough to afford a robot would bother to do the work himself/herself. The robot will be able to do things like cooking, fetching, washing clothes and dishes and cleaning the house. The men would only do the paperwork themselves. However, not everything about the life in the next 50 years will be positive. Water is already growing scarce over time. Eventually, it might become so much of a precious resource that it will be used as the international currency instead of dollars. We will have to find an alternative drinking source...

edits: can bring a headache instead of joy
text:
Shopping is my favourite pastime, and I simply cannot imagine anything more relaxing and joyful than spending my hard-earned money. But with a heavy heart I have to agree with this statement. Why? There might appear a few situations, when shopping instead of joy can bring a headache. 

First of all, it is quite hard to enjoy shopping when you are forced to do it. The best example here could be the regular, every-week filling-the-fridge shopping, which in principle cannot be pleasant. Personally I am not able to find anything exciting in hanging around extremely high supermarket shelves and pushing heavy trolley.  Crowd in every corner, awful and unpleasant lights and the necessity to run from one end of the market to another, because these shops are organised in the way, which forces you to see everything, in order to find what you really need.  That and the extremely long queues for the cash desk also are not very encouraging. 

What is more I hate do shopping when I really need to buy something. Because there is this wicked, unwritten rule, according to which if you are looking for something, there is not the slightest chance you will get it.  You will not be able to find the right size, the right colour or simply anything which would suit your taste. 
Shopping with your husband, boyfriend, father or any representative of the male kind, also can totally ruin the most fruitful shopping ever. I believe they are genetically programmed to take away all your ‘joie de vivre’.  The constant grumbling, regular checking the time, this anxious and adrift facial expression – how on earth it could create a favourable conditions for shopping?!  And believe me there is no difference if you are shopping for yourself or for them, it always looks this way. 

In conclusion, shopping can be and usually is a great opportunity, not only to expand contents of your wardrobe, but also, to relax and spend a great time. You just have to avoid supermarkets, buy clothes in advance – so there will not appear the situation, when you need something really badly and it is not in your closet, and of course of  the male company, better choose the female companion.

The bell rang and all the students left the class. I quickly took my things and went out of the classroom hoping to arrive as soon as possible home. But before I could leave school I remembered that I had left my trainers in the changing room, just after football session. Ten minutes after I had already taken my trainers and closed the gym door when I saw her walking towards me. I started walking towards my house when she yelled:
-"Michie!Wait for me!"
Oh no, not again... That stupid girl was completely in love with me, since last year she thinks that I like her, but she's wrong. And although she knows I hate the way she calls me, she doesn't stop doing it. She's an impossible woman. 
-"What do you want Stacey?"-I asked her.
-"Don't be angry Michie, I know you love me. I only wanted to tell you that Joe is going to make a party in his house tomorrow at 8 p.m. and I'll be there"-she said 
-"Thank you for the information. Bye"-I said, knowing what I wasn't going to do tomorrow.
Half an hour after I arrived home. I heard a voice behind me saying:
-"So, you'll be at the party tomorrow, right?"
I thought it was Stacey again, trying to get into my house again and trying to seduce me. And I yelled:
-"I'M FED UP WITH YOU! STOP. I DON'T WANT TO SEE YOU AGAIN... "
-"Ok, got it. Hope you get on well with your problem". And Cass, the girl I'm in love with slammed the door. I was feeling confused and bad. I went into my house and closed the door knowing at that moment that I had made a mistake.

The best sport ever.

Do you practise any sport? If so, you will know all the benefits but also effort that it takes. I love dancing and I do ballet, which requires a lot of discipline. 

I started dancing when I was six years old, my mates and I were so cute with our little dresses and tiny feet doing slow movements. For me it wasn't funny at all so I always tried to skip my classes, and I finally didn't go back the following year. 

But seven years later, as a teenager, I found ballet really feminine and I decided to start again. I think that this is not a usual sport, but it has the same advantages: it burn calories, improve circulation, is good for the bones and muscles... Therefore is a really beautiful way to exercise and help you to improve flexibility. 

My advice for people who would like to start dancing ballet is: don't be afraid, it doesn't matter if you are seven or seventy, if you want to do it you can. So let's do it!

Over the course of history, life has constantly changed. From the early nomad tribes, to the first human settlements, then to villages and cities to the formation of civilization, man has never stood still for too long. Key discoveries have changed the course of history. First, the fire, then agriculture, irrigation, and nowadays with technology. The more knowledge we accumulate, the faster progress will come. Mankind went from a rural based society to a modern skyscraper-filled civilization in just a century. And we will continue this process for as long we exist.

The discovery of electricity has increased our productivity greatly. Instead of just working during the day, man now could continue working during the night. Factories could have long working hours in order to produce more. People in turn started to consume more due to the increased workforce and the greater offer of products. The quick and practical life in the city started to drive thousands of people away from the fields. 

With the advance of electronic products, information has become even easier to spread. First with the radio, news about events happening far from your local community could be easily heard by anyone within earshot. Then with TVs, information started to spread faster and faster until our contenporary instantaneous reports from across the world in the palm of our hands.

Sometimes it seems we have reached the pinacle of existence. I'm sure the pharaos of Egypt felt that way when they gazed at the Pyramids. And yet, we've come this far. Now, we can look at those Pyramids from the other side of the world, receiving a live video feed in a device we hold in our hands. In the next 50 years, who know what we will be able to accomplish.

Education and technology are deeply related, to a certain extent in that education has suffered a series of changes throughout the past 20 years. In present times it is very common to see people learning courses through a computer. Online learning has become a modern phenomena in order to gain knowledge; however, face-to-face learning is still the better learning option chosen by students. Although there are many differences among these two, similarities can be found as well.

The main similarity between face-to-face learning and online learning is that they both provide valuable learning skills to students. Currently, exist all types of courses via the Internet, at any academic or vocational level. For instance, degree courses, master courses or just an updating course can be found. Adding to this, both learning options require time and dedication from students; otherwise, knowledge will not be properly delivered.

On the other hand, differences between face-to-face learning and virtual learning are numerous. Firstly, online learning conveys flexibility in its shedule. Studentd can attend courses when they decide, but always respecting due dates. Another difference between face-to-face learning and online learning may be that face-to-face learning allows students to develop human-relationships, whereas online learning is quite impossible on this to happen. During face-to-face learning students have a teacher-student relationship, as well as a peer-to-peer relationship, allowing them to develop inter-personaal skills and coexistence. Last but not least, time spent on these courses are different too. When doing a fece-to-face course besides having an attendance schedule, people spend more time commuting to the place where the course is given. In current days, traffic jams are a fact in big cities; therefore a lot of time is lost commuting.

Consequentlu, both learning options have their positive and negative aspects. Assessing these similarities and differences each student has the option to choose the option which better suits in his lifestyle.

Peschiera Borromeo, a little town near Milan, has an agricultural reality and there are many possibilities to walk around and to train yourself in a running parcour.
Unfortunately there is a lot of traffic, so the best place to avoid it is a little artificial lake called Idroscalo where people can run along the 7 kilometres perimeter or cycling open air while looking at the swans. 
In this area you can find many facilities such as two swimming pools, a tennis and a volleyball court. People can also try canoeing at the local school or the water skiing with a mechanical device that drags you on the water. It's really fun!
For those who feel brave, there is also a wall where you can climb with all equipment.
The best season to enjoy this place is certainly the spring, when the weather is not too hot and there are not so many people who picnic under the trees and disturb you while you're trying to relax!
If you too have got a dog and want to teach him something useful, take him here every Sunday morning and a trainer will teach him how to save people from drowning and your friend will become a lifeguard!
Here you can really forget about the city pollution!

To test the research’s hypothesis, self-administrated questionnaires were used on a total of 400 customers. The target population included telecommunication service users who subscribed a loyalty program. The choice of telecommunication industry in this framework is related to the vital role of loyalty and retention in this service setting. Many experts have emphasized the market maturity and the number and variety of competitive choices among service providers.  Following this, all types of service providers focus on customer retention as a source of growth (Amdocs Market Insight & Strategy, 2011 ). 
A total of 309 complete and exploitable questionnaires were collected, with a response rate of 77%.  This sample size allows us to perform multiple data analysis (multivariate and SEM). An appropriate sample size should be ten times the number of items used in the questionnaire (Sorbom et Joreskog, 1982). In this research, the sample size seems to be appropriate for SEM (309> 27 items multiplied by 10).

A game is an activity involving one or more players. Games are played primarily for entertainment or enjoyment, but may also serve as exercise. Everyone in this world has their own favorite sports, so do I. My favorite sport is football . I often play this with my friend in the evening. Football is a team sport played between two teams of eleven players each. It is a ball game played on a rectangular grass field with a goal at each end. The objective of the game is to score by maneuvering the ball into the opposing goal. The winner is the team which has scored most goals at the end of the match.

Football is played at a professional level all over the world, and millions of people regularly go to football stadium to follow their favorite team, whilst millions more avidly watch the game on television. A very large number of people also play football at an amateur level. In many parts of the world football evokes great passions and plays an important role in the life of individual fans, local communities, and even nations; it is therefore often claimed to be the most popular sport in the world.

football player. I learnt teambuilding, discipline as well as teamwork through playing football.

A review about medieval Turkey. 

I'm certainly not the only one watching this amazing series. I can't call it a soap opera because it's so much more than that. It's a love story between Turkey's most famous and cruel ruler of all times and his main wife. I wrote main because back then Turkish men were allowed to have harems. It's the story of Suleyman the Emperor and his wife, Hurrem. 
Like the title says, the story takes place in medieval Turkey. The actors and literally amazing. Their acting is on spot and the costumes and magnificent. The role of Suleyman is played by Turkey's most famous actor Halit Ergenc and he's amazing at it. What I liked most about him is that he agreed to grow a huge beard in order to get into role. 
The actress who plays Suleyman's wife, Hurrem is none other than Meryem Uzerli. She's such a beautiful woman and plays the role beautifully. 
The other actors are also really talented and bring to life many of the historical figures that Turkey had in that time. 
I strongly recommend this amazing series to people who want to take a glimpse into the history of a fascinating country and experience different feelings together with the main characters.

Foreign language learning in my country

Introduction
The purpose of this report is to comment on the way people, and especially children, learn languages in my country, what foreign languages they learn and where they learn them and to recommend changes in the language-learning system.

Languages people learn
There are many languages people in my country learn, but English would be the most popular as it is a world wide language. With Germany and Austria being our neighbours and thus business partners to many Czech companies, German is the second most popular foreign language spoken, followed by Russian, French, Italian and Spanish.

Who learns languages in my country
Mostly, it is children at schools who learn languages. They start learning English or German at the age of eight. Other language of their choice follows at secondary school. However, there might be a problem with the choice as not every secondary school offers e.g. Spanish or Italian, so students have to choose a language they do not prefer. Students at some schools also have a possibility of exchange programmes but these can be quite expensive and not every family can afford such an event. There are also many adults who want to learn or just improve their language skills. Adults usually attend language courses, or use a variety of on-line courses.

Recommended changes
I would recommend the government to increase salaries for Spanish, Italian or French teachers to persuade them to teach at schools instead of giving private lessons. It would also be wise to donate schools that prepare exchange programs for their students, so that more of them could afford that.

It would be great if all of us have a healthy life. However, young people generally don't pay enough attention to their health and fitness. 

There are many young people who follow Hollywood stars or famous singers and want to have the same bodies as them. As a consequence, they become slim and they don't ingest enough proteins and vitamins to have a healthy life

On the other hand, teenagers are becoming more dependent on cellphones, video games and television which make them being more sedentary. Being always on the bed or on the sofa is not recommended, whereas going outside and run or ride a bicycle would be a better option. This way they would be doing physical exercise. 

Finally, to be healthy it is also important to eat balanced food. Snacks, fast food, fried food and sweets are part of young people's life as they can find them everywhere: in the shops on the street, at parties and in shopping malls.

In conclusion, young people should behave differently towards their health and fitness. Being sedentary and eating fast food will not bring them anywhere.

The statement is rather too categorical, because to say that there is no future is going too far. It is true though, that  public transport would not be the general public's first choice. Sometimes the reasons for doing so are not to do with convenience but, rather more to do with economic issues or matters of conscience.

If we think selfishly, then the car is the obvious choice. It is easy, fast and ,we can almost park it right outside our destination or at walking distance -shorter rather than longer. It is initially expensive but it is so handy that we end up thinking it is part of us and  even think we cannot live without it.

Raising people's awareness of  pollution and how we must have a more sustainable existence is what makes us look for other less selfish and handy options. Publis transport is always going to be slower, less flexible and much less convenient but we have the reassurance that we are doing what is best for our planet. We are complying to the norm.

In conclusion, public transport  will always have a future if local governments have policies to promote it. It is never the attractive option, but it is the one which shows more solidarity.

Government jobs carry with them serious responsibilities. It is therefore no surprise that a person’s age and experience come under scrutiny when positions in government need to be filled. Many feel influential government jobs should be reserved for those who are older and have more experience, while others feel the criterion for these positions should be capability, namely whomever is most able to carry out the job. This essay will look at both sides before drawing a logical conclusion.
On the one hand, many argue that younger people should be made ineligible for important government positions, and the implications of this opinion are clear. Those operating at senior levels within a country’s military, for example, require field experience to prevent disastrous decisions that could cause the needless loss of life. Were younger people allowed to fast track their ascension within a country’s military, they could find themselves having to make critical choices based more on theoretical study than practical experience, and this could have catastrophic results. Thus, is it understandable why many feel younger government workers should be incubated before given promotion to important positions.
However, there are several plausible counters to this argument. For one, younger workers bring creativity and fresh ideas to government. For example, young government workers in Canada successfully pushed to increase HIV understanding and dispel stigmas attached to the disease in the 1980s, a development that encouraged tolerance and reduced irrational fear. In addition to fresh ideas, it should be remembered that to get a government job, one has to successfully engage a rigorous screening process. If a younger person engages this process as well or better than an older person, it is hard to argue that age should be a decisive factor when offering employment. It is clear from these reasons that there is merit to awarding important government career options to younger people.
Although the above look reveals solid evidence for both sides of the argument, it is felt that the healthiest approach to designating government positions is to ensure candidates fulfil rigorous training programs. Thus, a person’s age should not be considered a universal precursor to the awarding of government jobs.

Promotional Objective:

One of the promotional objectives is to increase the awareness of Trivago in Hong Kong. In order to achieve its objectives, Trivago invested more money in the promotion in 2014. For example, it promoted their search engine by the television commercial and Youtube advertisement. The Youtube advertisement means the viewers have to be enforced to watch the advertisement before they watch some video in Youtube. Since most of the people watch the television not just a few minutes or do not just watch one or two video(s) in Youtube, they will be enforced to watch its advertisement more than one times. Trivago has a very simple and rememberable tagline which is ‘Hotels? Trivago’. The audiences are easy to think of Trivago when they are thinking about hotels.

Also, Trivago wants to increase its market share by entering Hong Kong Market. Many Hong Kongers love to travel and go to different country to feel the culture and enjoy the different lifestyle. Many of them try to plan the cheapest way for their trip include booking the worthiest hotel. If they aware the benefits of using Trivago, they will love to use this as they could spend less time to compare all the hotels. Therefore, Trivago use the advisement to increase its market share in Hong Kong.

Moreover, Trivago is trying to enhance the company image in Hong Kong. Trivago is not much common in Hong Kong. Some people even probably do not know what it is. If Trivago want to gain benefits from the Hong Kong market, it has to develop and enhance their brand image. Doing promotion is one of the ways to improve its image. Trivago is trying to represent that it is the most convenient hotel search engine in the market.

The last but not the least, Trivago wants to boost its download rate in the mobile application platforms. Almost all the advertisements are encouraging audience to download its mobile application. If there are more people download its mobile application, it means more people to know its brand and use its service.

 
Current advertising strategy

We found one of the Television advertisements which is currently undertaking in Hong Kong.  The advertisement is about 16 seconds. There is a narrator introduces the function of Trivago and demonstrates “how to use its mobile application to search for a worthiest hotel.” At the last of the video, the screen shows a tagline and the website of Trivago. We will analyze its strategies from different perspectives below.

Television Commercial

In general, television is the most popular media in Hong Kong. Advertising by television is an effective way to communicate the service to the general public. Since that television is able to reach a large number of people during a short period of time, more potential customers will be exposed to its service. If the advertisement is designed well, people will remember it.

Moreover, television has the advantage of being able to utilize sight, sound and motion. Combining a catchy theme tune and a well-designed visual advertisement can increase the chances of viewers remembering the brand. This also allows for more creative options. As designers are not limited to using only sound or still images, they can create advertisements that are appealing visually and audibly. 

Background Music

Music helps stimulates sense and focus attention toward the advertisement. The background music in the advertising is relaxed and excite. It can make people feel youthful and it matches to the taste of young adults which are Trivago’s target customers. Besides, music also has other benefits. It helps audience to better recall the advertisement and stored it in long-term memory. It can also increase the retention of visual information.



Demonstration

The television advertisement shows the service being using. It demonstrates all the steps from searching the hotel, choosing selection criteria and comparing the price to different hotels. Through the demonstration, Trivago can show to the audience how easy to use its mobile application to find a worthiest hotel. It can enhance its creditability as the audience can clearly to know what its service is.  

On the other hand, as a mobile application, some people probably feel confused about how it operates. Therefore, with the visual effect, demonstration is the most effective way to teach the audience to use the mobile application. 

Informative

The television commercial presents information to the audience in a straight-forward manner. The narrator directly indicates the functions of the mobile application. For example, he says the application can instantly compare the rates to over 150 websites. For those who are high interested in hotel searching service, they may notice to such informative advertisement.

Cognitive Strategy

In the television commercial, Trivago uses cognitive message strategy. It clearly presented that its searching engine can help the customers to compare the price of over 150 websites of hotels in the world and find the most worthy hotel. This is a testable claim and Trivago can use it to be its unique selling proposition. This strategy shows its profession and reliability for its target customers. At the same time, it increases the confidence of the customers for choosing its services. 

As Hong Kong is a new market for Trivago, it needs to enhance its popularity in there. Before 2014, Trivago is not famous in Asia. It needs to utilities some strategies to increase its brand awareness and the information about its services toward its customers in order to achieve the promotional objectives.


Conative Strategy

On the other hand, Trivago also applies conative strategy in the advertisement. In the television commercial, the narrator tells the audiences to download the Trivago mobile application in their mobile phone. It encourages customer to purchase its services and truly make use of it. The purpose is to increase the sale and enlarge its market share in Hong Kong.

Means-End Chain

Moreover, “Means-End Chain” is adapted in the television advertisement. The leverage point of Trivago is providing hotel room search services. By using the Trivago’s services, customers can search the worthiest price of the hotel room to gain benefit. 

Trivago can achieve the personal value for customers through the advertisement. Some people desire to have a comfortable and pleasure journey with lower prices and the freedom of choosing their favorite accommodation. The advertisement can show that they are wisdom by using Trivogo service to plan an economically trip. 

Mean-End Chain is being used as Trivago is not only to help customer search for a hotel room, but also to achieve the personal value for customer which is worthier than money the customer saved in booking a hotel room. Trivago use this way to enhance its brand image and competitive advantage since the value of its services is increased.

Tagline

Nevertheless, Trivago designs a tagline in the television commercial. The tagline ‘‘Hotels? Trivago’’, can introduce the key idea of the television commercial. Audience can easily remember the brand name and get a plain awareness and knowledge of Trivago services. Besides, it can also improve the consistency of advertising platforms. As the tagline is catchy, if the tagline is continuously applied on the other advertisements, it will not be easy to stray from the main idea.







Other communication tools

Trivago does not choose radio to be their media as it is antiquated. People currently seldom listen to the radio. Attention of the radio commercial is low. Also, radio advertisements only contain verbal effect. Without the visual effect, it becomes less attractive. Even through people listen to the radio advertisement of Trivago, they probably do not know how to spell the word ‘Trivago’ as it is not a normal vocabulary. It makes people hard to search Trivago on the Internet. Therefore, the product awareness driven by radio advertisement is not enough. 

Newspaper is also not a good media since newspaper has been recently replaced by online newspaper. Likewise, Trivago is an online service so Newspaper advertisement may not appropriate for it. Lastly, hire spokesperson consequent high cost in promotion. And there is a risk of hiring a spokesperson as he may not bring an expected return for the company. Sometimes, if there is a spokesperson in an advertisement, the focus of audience maybe shifts from the product to the spokesperson. The promoting objective is difficult to be achieved. Therefore, television commercial is likely the most suitable method to promote its brand in Hong Kong.

Jacob was absolutely furious when he saw what was going on outside his window. A group of young boys was once again doing graffiti on the front of his house. Not even a month before he had paid a fortune to get his place refurbished and painted. He was fed up with all this profanity. How many times would he have to face this irreverence?  He headed the front door in rage.  The moment he reached the street he started yelling at them. Of course, they all left in a rush. Jacob remained there bursting in rage. While he was standing on the pavement tears of resentment covered his face. No one had ever responded to his demands. He knew that among his innermost feelings there was a growing icy animosity towards human nature. He wondered how he would react next time.
A few minutes later, his good next-door neighbour came by to help him to calm down and to collect the art weapons left over by the graffiti vandals.

Have you ever watch a game that involves people running around a field and scoring goals by kicking a ball? Yes, it's football! And  it is also known to be my favourite sport. I know that for some, playing football is boring but for me, it's the most awesome thing ever. I'm a freak when it comes to football. I think I had watched almost all the football matches in history especially when it was the FIFA World Cup season. I would not sleep until the game was over. Although, I don't play really well, but I would choose it over any other sports any day. I enjoy playing football because the feeling you get when you are on the field is priceless. I would feel free when I'm in the field. I was told that I was a natural player when I was young. I didn't need any coaching since my football skills came naturally. I think that I got this from my dad and my elder brother. Both of them are just like me, we freak out when it comes to football! 90% of our conversation includes football and we can talk all day about it for sure. Here is some advice to someone who is starting to this sport. Make sure to play smoothly for the first time and make sure to use a football shoe when you're playing in the field. This advice is to avoid you from injuring yourself as a beginner in football.

Do you have a favourite sport? I've played tennis for 5 years now and I can assure you it's one of the best sports any person can do!
Playing tennis means more to me than anything else. First, whether played individually or in teams, it's great fun and demands a lot of effort. Winning or losing is up to you when you play singles, and you know you have to do your best to achieve the best score. Also, I love it because it takes my mind off worries. It has helped me to stay focused and improve my concentration, too. As well as that, tennis gives me the opportunity to stay fit and meet new people.
Since it's not very easy at the beginning, if you are interested in taking up tennis you should persevere and train at least twice a week. Don't forget to buy a good pair of tennis shoes and a fairly good racket. 
All in all, I've practised many sports in my life but tennis's been far the best exercise for both, my mind and body. I really get a lot of pleasure in doing it. Give it a try and you'll see!

My hero and my foe

Do you know "The Flying Dutchman"? I consider him as the Dutch Superman of 2013, since he has won some important sports competitions. Do you also know Clown Bassie? Well, I consider him as the meanest Dutch celebrity of this year.

"The Flying Dutchman", also known as Epke Zonderland, is a gymnast from Groningen who was the first man worldwide to do an incredibly difficult exercise on the parallel bars. By performing this exercise perfectly, he became the World Champion this year (and he also won the gold medal at the Olympics of 2012). For this achievement, I admire him quite a lot.

Clown Bassie, on the other hand, is an actor of a TV-programme for children. After a live show, he made a little girl crying by shouting at her and then kicked her in the back. Why would you treat toddlers so badly?

To summarise, my hero of 2013 is Epke Zonderland, because of his achievements in the gym. My villain of this year is Clown Bassie, since I think his behaviour is unacceptable!

Clearly, travel in your own car is much more comfortable than on public transport. For this reason, many people now believe that there is no future for public transport. These people believe that ver the next few years we will see a severe decline in the amount of people using bus, trains, trams, etc. to get places. In my opinion, this is dissapointing for a number of reasons.

First of all, public transport bring us closer to other people. We share moments with those people using the same mode of transport as us. Also, it is an excellent way of saving the environment. By using public transport we reduce our carbon footprint and help to save the Earth. Furthermore, we also save time: as cities become bigger it becomes more and more difficult to park, which in turn leads to us wasting time looking for somewhere to park, or wasting money in expensive carparks.

In conclusion, I believe that public transport should be a necessary part of everybody's life, we should use it every day to save the Earth, money, and time.

If you’re looking for a great film to watch on a rainy day, I totally recommend Alice in Wonderland. It would give you all the magic of a fantasy film based on a book.
Directed by Tim Burton, the story is a  retelling of  fantasy novel Alice's Adventures in Wonderland .The film shows a young   Alice Troubled by a strange recurring dream, the loss of her beloved father,  an   unwanted marriage proposal, and the oppressive expectations of the society in which she lives. Unsure of what to does, she chase a rabbit in a blue waistcoat, and accidentally falls into a large rabbit hole From which she emerges in a forest, where she is greeted by many strange creatures. There Alice will star an adventure where she must slay the Red evil Queen and restore the White Queen to power.
The film features Mia Wasikowska as Alice. With her sweet face, pale skin, and great acting, she looks perfect as a confused and brave girl who has to save that “wonderful” world.  But we must not forget about the marvelous acting of Johnny Deep ( as the mad hatter) and Helena Bonham Carter( as the red queen), with them the film wouldn’t be the same.
But it’s not just the acting that is great in this film. The cinematography is fantastic, with wonder digital landscapes. But what really makes it magical is the makeup and the costume design, they really managed to create something amazing  with the appearance of characters. Finally, the film had the great touch of Tim Burton as director.
If you enjoy a classic book, but with more action and a little bit twisted; watch Alice in Wonderland.  I totally recommend it, you will not be disappointed.

Is science evil? People’s opinions on this question differ widely. I think that science has altered our lives in a positive way. Here are some facts to support my view. 




Firstly, I should say that life nowadays is unthinkable without science. In the century of advancing communications and technology it is hard to imagine the world without medicine, astronomy, computers, and history. People today are interested in learning about the surrounding world, about new civilizations and distant planets. Science explains to us a lot of the things that we previously were not aware of. Without its help, for example, we would have never realized were we have come from. It also gives us clues that there may be life on other planets and we might not be the most superior beings in the world. 




By using computers nowadays it is very convenient to find the information you are looking for. 




There is no secret for the human beings today because they have explored every place on the Earth. They climb the highest mountains, dive in the depths of oceans, and conduct dangerous experiments and all for the sake of science. The present belief is that scientific approach will solve all the problems and do away with all difficulties. With its help, for example, people are able to cope with natural disasters. We know how to destroy hail clouds which can cause great damage to our crops. We are also able to protect ourselves from various diseases and help the sick. That is why science is so significant nowadays.




On the other hand, the greatness of science goes together with its disadvantages. For example, we are obliged to agree that science has given no answer to man’s doubts. The obsession to know everything has led some of us to make dangerous experiments for which we pay with our lives. 







To conclude, I will only say that science makes our lives easier. With its help we cope with different situations and that is why it is so fundamental to human existence and I think is not evil.

At some time or another, each and every young person must provide themselves with the necessary skills. «What can I do for my life?». When you start to consider interests and strengths, it makes sense to consider your interests first. After all a successful career is best measured in how satisfying you find it, and it’s easier to develop strengths and skills than to actually have to learn to find something interesting.
While we are studying we may not think seriously about job. But in a few years time our job will be one of the most important things in our everyday life. 
When someone asks an adult “what do you do?” they nearly always reply with their occupation. Work, for most of us, will be the defining aspect of life and thus of our identity. Through our work we find an identity, we can find status, intellectual stimulation as well as wealth which enables us to buy comfort. We can work out our place in the world.
Our working identities can change over time, our identity and behaviours as a young graduate are different from those of the professional expert and from those of the senior leader. Our ability to develop our identity is critical to our ability to be successful in a range of career roles, we need to shed our old identity and add new elements. 
We each have a picture of who we are and what we will/won’t do in our heads, once formed our brains garner the evidence that it is a true picture and ignore evidence that suggests that it is not true. So people say ‘I don’t do numbers’, ‘I don’t do detail’ ‘I don’t do preparation’, they believe it and make it true. ‘I can’t do sales’ becomes a self fulfilling prophecy. We can change our beliefs, actions and thus our identity through experimentation, practice and conscious self discipline. 
In an age where career progression may lead us into new environments and sectors it is ever more important to challenge our sense of self and explore whether you can create ‘a new you’ by changing the beliefs you hold about yourself and the world in order to develop and expand your career options.

Factors behind the decline 
There are more than 200 old, abandoned, local buildings in our capital city. But most of them are about to be declined by town planners. This means we will lose a part of our national history. While the fact that those buildings are not seen as worthy of preservation is an important factor, demolition is more frequently caused by a lack of public funds. 

Firstly, demolition is partly caused by how valuable the old buildings are estimated. Old local buildings often do not provide opportunities to make any money, they only cost town planners a lot of money because they probably need to be renovated. 

However, even with these arguments, demolition is more frequently affected by a lack of public funds because it covers the part about the hindsight of an appropriate budget for eventually renovating as well. With no appropriate budget it is unreasonable to keep old buildings which are useless when they are not renovated. And above that, without public funds there are too few people who show they care about the fate of historical buildings. This might cause that town planners will think there are not enough reasons to keep them. 

After all, the factor with the most influence on decline of local buildings is the lack of public funds which make it possible to keep our old buildings, or at least a few of them, because these funds frequently accumulate money for projects like renovations.

Any form of public transport like a bus or a train is too much of an inconvenience especially in a large city such as London. Imagine going to work on a rainy day: you have one hand on your umbrella and the other clutching your bag, the wind is blowing mist on your face and a puddle of water is sprinkling tiny dots of wet dirt in your stilleto while you are making your way to a bus station. Not a good scene, is it? Definitely not a good way to start your day. Indeed, the method by which a person go from point A to point B can spell the difference between a good and a bad day. 
Transportation is very important in our daily life and in this modern world we live in, the very least that we expect from almost anything is inconvenience. This is why, most of us, prefer to travel with our own car rather than by  a public transport; not only that it keeps us within our private sphere, it also keeps us dry travelling on a rainy day. Yes, we are willing to spend more in the name of convenience. We'd rather pay a hefty price for gas than be inconvenienced in a public transport.

Dear Sir,

My name is Paula Zuidweg and I have recently graduated from high school. Next year I will be starting the Psychology bachelor programme at the University of Groningen, and I would like to earn some money beforehand. So when I came across this advertisement yesterday, I found myself thinking how wonderful it would be to apply for this job.

I believe myself to be a suitable person for this job, as I am a hard working, reliable, cheerful, fun-loving person. When I was 15 years old, I started looking after our neighbour's children, aged seven and nine. Those children are too old for babysitters now, but I love children and would really like working with them again. I believe myself to be a proficient cook, as I've always cooked for my family in the weekends. When I was almost three years old, my parents moved to Indonesia because of their work circumstances. There I went to Surabaya International School, where I learnt English. Two years later we moved back, but I continued speaking in both Dutch and English to my parents. I also read books in English, so I think my English is certainly good enough for this job.

P. Zuidweg

Fame and the attitude to fame have  been  one of the most thought-provoking topics.  Students usually find it very inspiring and engaging to discuss this issue  because it is very difficult to give a clear-cut answer and so, it makes the process of discussion very exciting.  
There may be  a significant number of arguments which support the statement that fame is a good thing.   My personal attitude to fame is rather ambivalent. On the one hand, I personally think that the desire to become  famous is a great driving force that stimulates  people and brings a lot of benefits to others in  its wake. Sportsmen are one of the most vivid examples  of it. If  we take football clubs, for  example, we can see that the desire to become well-known and popular makes football players very dedicated sportsmen. They  can fight against the odds to be in the top league. It is remarkable how much stamina and spirit can be  demonstrated by such sportsmen. Their desire to be at the top contributes a lot to the fame and reputation  of their clubs and countries as well.  What is equally important and adds to the importance of fame is that  somebody's  desire to be famous can have a triggering effect on  others. It means that other people feel challenged and don't want to fall  behind and look  underdogs. Without  this  stimulus  they may   have been inactive.   

On the other hand almost equal number of people may   maintain  a contrasting point of view. They  give examples when the desire to become famous made people aggressive and ruthless. Such people  tried  to achieve their goal irrespective of the means. I can illustrate my words by the example of military campaigns. The desire of some country's leaders to become famous and to glorify their names as great commanders brought about wars and  conflicts between countries. Hundreds and thousands of innocent people may fall victim to the insatiable desire of such fame -seeking personalities.

So, all in all, we can not answer this  question as "yes" or "no" because there is almost equal number of examples that help to support the contracting points of view.

It was midnight and Susan's crying was muffled by her pillow. She couldn't believe that he was capable of doing such a horrendous thing. 
It was seven o'clock when she got home with her arms full of grocery bags. It was a strange atmosphere in the house and a chill went down her spine. She brushed it off and went to the kitchen to put all the groceries on the kitchen counter. She looked around the kitchen and saw a post-it on the fridge. 'We need to talk' it said. She checked the hour, then decided to call Michael. He wasn't answering his phone. 'He might be busy. He'll call later'she thought. 
She went to their bedroom to change her clothes and start dinner. She wanted to surprise Michael with delicious pasta and some rose wine. She went down to the kitchen and proceeded with preparations, but she couldn't get rid of that weird feeling. 'Something is up. I can feel it', so she picked up the phone and decided to call Michael again. After three rings, he answered the phone, his breath short. 'Yeah? Hey baby!'
"Hi. Where are you? she asked, apprehension rising slowly. "Oh, I had to finish something for work, so I'll be late tonight. Don't wait up' he said and hung up. 
She looked at the phone surprised and tried calling him again, but his phone was turned off. She called his best friend and also his workmate and asked him about Michael, but he had no clue about it, so she decided to go to his office. 
The ride felt like and eternity. She parked her car a few meters away for Michael's office and walked up to it. She was about to open the door when she heard a female voice coming from his office. "What are we going to do? This isn't something that will go away in a few months. I'm pregnant and we need to solve this out. What are we going to do about Susan?" said the unfamiliar woman.  "I don't know."said the familiar male voice. "I guess we'll just have to play this one cool, because I can't lose Susan. You need to understand this. I'll pay alimony and help you with the kid, but I cannot lose Susan".
she couldn't believe her ears. Michael has been cheating on her. Full of rage and disappointment she opened the door and saw the woman sitting in Michael's lap. Michael was petrified. Susan looked at him, then at the woman. She couldn't be more than twenty-two. She looked at him again then turned around and left. 
When she got home she packed some of her belongings and drove to her best friend's house. 
After two hours, she could hear Michael's voice coming from downstairs. "I need to talk to her. She needs to hear me out. I won't leave!". She heard heavy footprints on the stairs and buried her head deeper in the pillow. Michael entered slowly and tried to approach his wife. "Don't!"she said and threw the pillow at his face. 
Michael closed the door and knew at that moment he had made a mistake.

Respected teachers and all my friends

Good morning to one and all present here. I am very happy to see you all ones again. I am here today to deliver a speech to you about boycott bullying. These days we see in the walls written boycott of stop bullying. Do we know the real meaning of the word bullying.Bullying may be defined as the activity of repeated, aggressive behavior intended to hurt another individual, physically, mentally or emotionally. 

Bullying is characterized by an individual behaving in a certain way to gain power over another person. It can be classified into four types:

Physical (hitting, punching, or kicking)
Verbal (name-calling or taunting)
Relational (destroying peer acceptance and friendships)
Cyber-bullying (using electronic means to harm others)

Those who have been the targets of bullying can suffer from long term emotional and behavioral problems. Bullying can cause loneliness, depression, anxiety, lead to low self-esteem and illnesses.

In conclusion, I would like to say that self harm, low self esteem and bullying are all causes of destruction in our schools. We need to stop this. We need to do something to prevent it, before it's too late. Now to boycott bullying form our school i request all of you to take an oath that , I make a commitment to take a stand against bullying. I will treat others with respect and kindness. I will have to compassion to not be a bully and the courage to not to be a bystander. It is my responsibility to help others being bullied and to report bullying.

Thank you

Michael was sitting on the bench of the garden, waiting for his mother to finish her work. She was a machinist, and was currently working on some secret work he couldn't understand. As Michael heard the sound of breaking glass, he ran up to his mother's office. 
She was on the cold ground, laying like a dead body, her son sat by her side, trying to wake her up. He stopped when he saw the dark shadow walking to him. It was a man in his late thirties, very thin and light grey eyes. An evil smile was drawn on his face. He raised his hand, whom was holding a metal bar, full of blood. 
Michael had no time  to scream, he was already laying on the floor, by his mother's side.

5 years later.

There he was, sitting on a bench in a garden, waiting for his mother. But this time, he just knew she would never come. She was not dead, but in coma, in a hospital. He was in the same state as her for about a week after the drama, and had to live on his own for the years who came. 
As he grew wiser and stronger, Michael still always had this hope that his mother would wake up. But it would never happen, not anymore. 
He walked up to her room, where she was comfortly sleeping in her bed. He sat by her side, and held her hand. 
Tonight, she would be gone, he already signed the papers, his choice was made. He took a deep breath before leaning over her and kissed soflty her forehead. 
Full of sorrow and pain, Michael closed the door and knew at that moment he had made a mistake.

My first memories of food are from my early years, as I looked at my grandmother cooking typical Spanish dishes such as paella or tortilla. When I was in school I used to go to my granparents´ home to have lunch because my parents were at work,  I fondly remember my gandma´s great cooking skills that she still owns to this day. She´d cook the best tortilla, paella and all of the typical Spanish dishes  that I´ve ever eaten.

A few years afterwards, right when I started high school and hit my teenager years, I began eating bigger amounts of unhealthy food from American fast food restaurants that I used to go to with my friends some days right  after class and during the weekends. Those years I was very familiar with the smell of cheese burguers, BBQ pizzas  and also kebabs.

By the time my high school years were done, and right when I attended university, I developed certain predilection for typical healthy Spanish, unavoidibly  combined with less fast food due to the usual diners with friends. The main cause of that change was that I had to have breakfast, lunch and dinner at my college dorm´s dining room that had amazingly good cooks, They´d cook really good dishes such as cocido, garbanzos and paella.

Wonderful inventions such as the train, bus and airplane have allowed us the freedom to travel and explore this great planet for a lower price. Industrialization gave us the ability to mass produce public transit vehicles so that everyone could be free to move. 

Travelling by car may be more convenient on an individual basis but pollution is a danger we have to face. If all of used cars, the levels of pollution would be incredibly high.  Public institutions should encourage the use of public transport, especially trains as they use electricity and are less pollutant than other means of transport. There is a problem, though. Prices of train tickets can be very high and they should be reduced. Traffic is a really big problem in cities nowadays and only the use of public transport can make a significant difference in the quality of life in our cities.

If those who run public transportation systems hope to make them greener in the future, they'll have to come with solutions that are both energy efficient and effective.

In conclusion, I think that public transport has an important role to play if we want to preserve the quality of life in our cities.
