I live in a small village, in the German region of Hesse, called Griesheim.
The city authorities have a very strict policy regarding waste disposal. All citizens are involved in the process by organizing their waste in the corresponding bins and by making good use of the waste calendar. 

Every house in the village has three containers: 
- One for the paper;
- One for the bio waste; and,
- One for the waste that cannot be recycled.

In addition, yellow plastic bags are provided for free to separate the plastic, cans and bricks. 

The cost of the waste disposal service depends only on the volume of non-reciclable waste produced. The yellow bags and the glass are processed at no cost, whatever the volume. 

There are also public conainers for glass and clothes all around the village.

Eventually, the citizen becomes part of a very meticulous recycling process by looking up to the cost.

On the other hand, the city provides a punctual public transport system, very convenient. This system relies on the tram. Trams are available 24 hours and tram stops are evenly distributed; it takes no more than 8 minutes walking from one stop to the next one. 

The bus network completes the public transport service. 

To ride is another suitable option, if the weather allows. The city is bike friendly and bike paths are available. Large forests and country roads, where cars are not allowed, are also part of the offer.

Jack and the great, furry waffle.

Jack was a fat, lazy guy who loved food, and he would never miss a meal. He would only drag himself out of his house when he heard a new type of food was created. Jack lived with his mommy, he had no job, and when she had told him to be independent, he only lasted one month before going on poverty. He was really sad because the government was enforcing a law on banning new types of food, this had become a huge problem because more Americans were getting diabetes. One day before this new law was established, a crazy scientist created a new waffle, "the great, furry waffle." This was an incentive for Jack to go out, he was sure that destiny had rewarded him with this blessing because he had eaten ten hot dogs in a row, although he felt a bit sick after, he knew it was worth the try. There was a bit of conflict in his plan, the new waffle was in Texas, and he lived in Washington. He knew he wouldn't last a day in the heat, but there was nothing better than a new waffle. He saw on his mommy's television that if he was the first person to try the waffle, he would get a bonus of a hundred bacon strips. Jack bought a ticket to the earliest flight to Texas, once he got off the plane he ran through the landscape. He liked the trend of everyone being fat in America, that way he could fit in. Once he got to the laboratory where the pancake was made, he told the mad scientist that he wanted to eat his waffle. The scientist gave him "the great, furry waffle" and a bunch of syrup. Jack grabbed it and put it in his mouth, he could taste heaven in his mouth. It was a combination of bacon, meat, and cheese with a little bit of butter. What he didn't expect was that all the hair had gotten stuck in his throat, leaving him unable to breathe! In a matter of seconds nothing he fell to the ground, choking. Suddenly, a giant fish fell from the sky, causing him spit out the hairball, Jack could not believe what he saw, the man riding the fish was Bugs Bunny! Jack finally lost weight and lived happily ever after, the end.

edits: the unwritten rules of vocal patterns successfully
text:
Have you ever stopped to think that exist some standards in the society that everyone knows and follows although some people do it unconsciously? These standards are called unwritten rules which can be defined as unspoken rules imposed in each culture to make the population to live more civilly (Bob Greene, How Unwritten Rules Circumscribe Our Lives - Paragraph 6). In fact, since the beginning, the written rules have helped to create the civilizations while the unwritten rules have helped to maintain them, allowing life to be more harmonious. For example I can cite the importance of the unwritten rules in my own culture, the Brazilian culture. There are some aspects and actions that everyone who lives in Brazil needs to follow, and those directly reflect the values of the Brazilian culture.

One of the most important unwritten rules that you should follow in Brazil is related to the vocal patterns. When Olquin said that the situation and the environment define the correct tone of speech (1995), he was talking about the African American Communication, but he is also describing the Brazilian communication at the same time. Even though there is no definite consensus about the exact vocal patterns in Brazil, there are some facts about the extremes of it. First, Brazilians feel uncomfortable when people close to them raise their tone of voice and continue speaking loudly during a long time, without they have clear reasons. It means that you pretend to transform the dialog in a monolog; moreover, unknown people in the same environment of you frequently do not want to know about your thinking. Surprisingly, on the other hand, a speech too low is seen as an antisocial rule, and can be interpreted as an offense. In Brazilian culture, if during a conversation a person speaks too low, the listener will assume that the speaker does not want to continue with the dialog or does not care about what you are talking. In both the extremes of a speech, loud and low, there is a violation of the values of a good communication. Therefore, when you are in a conversation, it is important to pay attention to execute with successful the unwritten rules of vocal patterns.

As vocal patterns are considered so important for Brazilians, personal territory is another unwritten rule that is easy to see people using on the streets daily. When you are in a space that you feel comfortable being around other people that you do not know, this space is your personal territory. And, it can change according to your degree of familiarity or intimate with the other person. In some countries like the United States, whose respect of personal territory is extremely important, the public and the intimate space can vary between 25 feet and the touching (Edward T. Hall). In Brazil also there is this difference between the public and the intimate space, yet the magnitude of this is not the same of the U.S. Although the Brazilians have a shorter personal space in comparison with the United States, they are no tolerant with strangers invading it. Soon, even though the distance between people are shorter in Brazil, both countries value the idea of maintaining a space that both people feel comfortable, called personal space.

Although Brazilians usually do not worry about distance made by others, people from different cultures believe that Brazilians spend much time looking at others. As a result, some people can make misinterpretations. For example, in some cultures, Brazilians can be considered rude by women because they like to keep a constant eye contact, and for these women this means a lack of respect or invasion of privacy. Differently, foreign men often believe that they are being desired due to this constant eye contact. In general, this supposition is not regarded as true for many people in our culture since Brazilians believe that constant eye contact is one of the most important points to maintain a good dialog. According to article " Nonverbal Communication: Speaking without Words", eye contact is important because "insufficient eye contact can create communication barriers". In fact, in Brazil, the eye contact is primordial, being considered without interest to speaker or that the speaker is bothering you if you do not give enough attention when you are talking to. The source of this rule is easy to be identified especially when the parents are talking to their kids; it is hard to get exclusively the kid's attention, but the parents insistently repeat, "look at me when I am talking to you". Therefore, this interaction demonstrates that the eye contact can have a strong influence in the cultural values of attentiveness and respect with the others' opinion.

After being socially judged by the society, we can perceive the direct influence of unwritten rules in our cultural values when someone breaks at least one of them. In Brazil, the social rules like vocal patterns reflect in the communication values which can be decisive to keep a good communication. Also, the personal territory are governed by rules that vary depending on the country, and in Brazil are considered small, but everyone there appreciates this cultural value. Eye contact is another important cultural value which is used by Brazilians meaning respect and interest for others. As in Brazil, each country around the world has reflections of the unwritten rules in the cultural values. Because of these varieties of values and rules, usually there are some misunderstandings between people of different nations. Respecting these rules is the first step to understand them and avoid some conflicts. In addition, you should avoid judge cultural values from other countries based on unwritten rules of your own.

It was a rainy Monday afternoon and Michael was gazing out the window thinking about his life, when he saw his friend, John, dashing through the street. Wondering what he might be doing, Michael shouted:
- Why are you in such a hurry?
- I'm late for my piano lesson! I really have to go, see you later - John replied panting.
- Oh, okay, bye!
Michael had a chemestry test the next day, however he wasn't in the mood to study and so he decided to call Alex, his best friend:
- Hey Alex! Do you want to go out?
- Yeah, sure! Where should we meet?
- How about the cafe near our school?
- To be perfectly honest I don't really like it there! what about the one next to the shopping center?
- Souds great. See you there at half past six?
- Ok, see you later then.
Michael grabbed his coat and creept out of his house in order not to wake up his parents. He remembered that he still hadn't studied for his chemestry test. Michael closed the door and knew at that moment he had made a terrible mistake.

edits: serious changes in blood lactate levels were not found
text:
According to Ferguson et all (2013), dietary nitrate (NO3-) supplementation, via its reduction to nitrite (NO2-) and subsequent conversion to nitric oxide (NO), reduces blood pressure. Bond, Morton and Braakhuis (2012) also argue that nitrate is considered a potent vasodilator. The reason for this is that the nitric oxide relaxes blood vessels and dilates them, which helps the blood flow more easily and lowers blood pressure. Thus, the induced vasodilation may affect both systolic and diastolic  blood pressure after the exercise. Nevertheless, a study of The New England Journal of Medicine claims that only the diastolic blood pressure is affected by nitrate supplement, once it was not found in their study a significant change on systolic blood pressure after nitrate supplementation in healthy volunteers. Surprisingly, the current study has found significant changes in both systolic and diastolic blood pressure post exercise. Thus, the investment on research about the influence of nitrate supplementation should continue, the aim of which would be to improve sports performance and improved quality of life.

In conclusion, the results of the present study indicate that supplementation of beetroot juice has no significant effect on 700 m rowing ergometer performance. It is unquestionable that some research found  significant improvements. In this present study, however, the rowing time of the participants was not shorter than times without supplementation. Importantly, it was not found serious changes in blood lactate levels either. It was assumed that beetroot juice would increase the oxidation and would reduce the lactate production. Nevertheless, the nitrate supplementation did not change the lactate level significantly. Finally, it was confirmed that nitric oxide relaxes blood vessels, consequently reducing the blood pressure. By this action, beetroot juice may effectively protect the cardiovascular system during exercising. Despite the present findings, it is necessary more research to understand the effects of nitrate supplementation. By this action, athletes may improve their performance as well as quality of life.

Dear editor,
    I read your article about technology and education in the newspaper yesterday and I am writing this letter because I strongly disagree with your personal opinion about teachers and education. Due to the fact that I am studying to become a teacher, I have some more knowledge about this subject than any other people because I am in the school classroom every day and I face the reality of it every day. 
    To begin with, I agree with you that technology sometimes makes the educational process easier and more pleasant in this way that students have no idea that they broaden their knowledge. Of course, I make use of computer and projector during my teaching daily, because this is a pleasant and entertaining activity for children. After all, my objection is that interactive learning is not the only way for children to be educated. The traditional educational process may sometimes seem to be boring and dull for children but a teacher should be a part of this process as a guide. Without teachers’ guidance, self- studying may bring some problems to children, such as possible misunderstanding.  Networking educational contents are not safe at all. It is common for children to watch violence scenes. So, the teacher is a necessary part of the educational process.
    Nowadays, young people graduate from universities, who come up with new and innovative ideas about educational process and so the tradition will be updated next years. To be more precise, new educational methods promotes the students’ teamwork. In other words, students have the opportunity to discuss with their classmates in order to solve a mathematic problem in cooperation or to talk about a subject. Furthermore, when it’s necessary good students can help the other classmates to improve themselves.  In this kind of education, teacher is only the guide who helps students to discover the information on their own. Furthermore, it makes children more sociable. In contrast, interactive learning may bring some advantages but it can also makes children antisocial, because they learn on their own without the need to be in the school with other people. They don’t need to co-operate and to work as a team. This is bad, because it will be necessary to work as team in their future job and then they will face serious communicative problems.
     To sum up, I am not against interactive learning and the use of technology. My personal opinion is this is not sufficient to cover the education process.  I think that it is efficient when there is a combination of traditional education and interactive learning.

The “Campo de Marte” sports centre
The “Campo de Marte” sports centre in Lima is the perfect place for young people who are keen on sports and for the ones who would like to take up a sport. This is a good option especially during the summer time. While doing these activities, teenagers will easily make new friends and develop new skills. Also this is a healthy way of getting fit.
This sports centre provides a huge variety of physical activities. One of these is athleticism. “Campo de Marte” is one of the few places in Lima where you can practise athleticism professionally. Besides, you have the chance to take part in international competitions if you stand out. Another important activity is swimming. You can practise it in a semi- Olympic swimming pool, which is always clean and protected against the sunlight. However, during the winter it can be not warm enough to swim properly.
I strongly recommend young people to choose sports in which you can take part of a team. This experience would teach you how to work with different kind of people.

Dear Mr Michael Wallis,

Thank you so much for this opportunity, I am very grateful for everything.  I think English is in fact very important because first of all although not being the most spoken language in the world, it is the official language in a large number of countries.  Most of the content produced on the internet (50%) is in English and last but not least although learning English can be challenging and steals some of our precious time, we can see that it is also very valuable to learn and can also create many opportunities.

About the accommodation, we talked and decided that we would prefer to be with English speaking families because of what a great opportunity it is for everyone to actually test their speaking skills. This is a once in a lifetime opportunity and I am certain that we will cherish every second of every minute there.

I was actually about to email you about the activities that are to be planned. Regarding the students preferences, they all love the outdoors, like parks and rivers and they also love a good museum because of their thirst for knowledge. All in all, anything that will keep them away from being bored and with nothing to do.

Concerning this amazing trip I only have two questions left starting with the weather, considering your experience with the changes happening this time of the year and the second and last about what type of clothes you recommended which is of great importance primarily for our female students .

Yours sincerely
Margaret Dunn

I agree with the statement above to some extent. On the positive side, travelling by car is more relaxed because you do not have to rely on others to drive for you. Actually you have more freedom in which roads to choose and you can have breaks whenever you feel a need for some time off the street. In addition, driving by yourself you are not limited by the stations you have to visit. Going by train for example, you need to get to the next train station and afterwards from the destination train station to your target. Often enough you have to rely on other services such as busses or taxis to reach your destination. 
On the other hand, using public transportation is good for the environment because the amount of gas, electricity and other materials is a lot lower per head. Furthermore you have the chance to take a nap, do some work or watch TV while you are being transported. Moreover you can be lucky to avoid big traffic jams especially if you are taking the train. Avoiding traffic jams, construction sites, accidents and other obstacles you may being affected by may result in a lower amount of time spent travelling.
As a conclusion you can say public transport will have its use even in the future. While going by car may be more comfortable from time to time, the reasons I stated above lead me to the conclusion that public transport is necessary.

It is popularly believed that the golden era of public transportation will be ended soon due to the heavy use of automobiles such as cars, cabs and vans. Public transportation modes like trains and buses have been immensely helpful to the general public throughout the past couple of decades. On the other hand, travelling by car is getting for popular than it ever was with development of science and technology.

People who are based on rural and remote areas are always prefer to use public transportation according to the researchers from Columbia University. However,in some countries, public transportation is a nightmare because it has not been maintained by the governments properly, this is one of the main reasons which had led people to use personal vehicles rather than relying on public transportation.

Not only people in countries where it has poor public transportation but also the most developed countries, there is a high tendency of using cars instead of depending on public transportation. Despite the fact that using cars being expensive, many people still prefer to use their own vehicles because it saves their valuable time. Public transportation, on the other hand, consumes a lot of time to travel from one distance to another.

Use of high power efficiency and linear high power amplifier (HPAs) are growing. Power efficiency and linearity are important factors in many applications such as cellular communication, wireless communication. Higher power efficiency and linearity cause decrease power consumption, increase lifetime and reduction of interference channels. Class-E power amplifier satisfies those goals with linearity techniques.
Class-E power amplifier PAs work as a switch and can obtain theoretically 100% power efficiency. Class-E power amplifier (PA) was introduced by Sokal in 1975. These PAs work as a switch and can obtain 100% Drain Efficiency theoretically. However in practice there are some limitations such as, switch on - resistance and various power losses that prevent achieving 100% Drain Efficiency .

Secret agents have often been chosen as the main character of stories and films, such as James Bond's ones, which managed to be really successful. But what exactly makes spy stories so fascinating? There could be a lot of reasons, like the idea of living in an adventurous way or doing things in secret; but in real life, what kind of person does a secret agent have to be?

First of all, being a spy requires special skills; not everybody is suitable for this kind of life. For instance, the ability to bear both physical and psychological stress is not something you can easily learn. In the same way a secret agent has to be able to take risks when required. Therefore bravery is very important: nobody needs a fearful spy. A secret agent works undercover, so his most important quality is possessing great skill in lying. Besides, since his work is secret, he can't let anybody, including family and friends, know about it.

So, although the life of secret agents may seem fascinating and exciting, it is also difficult and risky and not so simple as the one shown in films.
